title: Senior Data Scientist – Telematics Data Science
job_summary: This includes participation within the broader data science community including Kaggle competitions or any personal projects with open data.
job_description:
Join an exciting team of actuaries, data scientists and engineers at the forefront of using data to drive decisions at every level of our organization. The insurance industry is undergoing a transformation and you get to be in the driver’s seat of this data-driven, technology revolution.

You will work on impactful projects that range from predicting customer life-time values and optimizing customer journeys to incorporating novel data sources for building cutting-edge pricing algorithms. You will leverage machine-learning algorithms to automate and predict claim outcomes and find new and innovative ways to impact our customers. This team is exploring the frontiers of the insurance business such as how to harness the data from connected homes and cars to deliver new types of products to customers.

As a senior data-scientist, you will be part of a dynamic small team with exposure to different business partners and direct influence on future products and innovative solutions. You will propose machine-learning and statistical models for practical applications that impacts millions of customers. You will also mentor and guide your peers in novel approaches and provide peer review for their work. The team has already developed algorithms used in production systems and you will be part of the team that expands the scope of these algorithms. This is your chance to join the InsureTech revolution!

The insurance industry has entered a period of unprecedented change, disruption and rapid technological development. Aviva recognizes that in this rapidly changing environment building a distinctive capability in Data Science is critical - demonstrating this commitment through the development of our Data Science Practice. If you are passionate about Data Science and leveraging your analytical prowess to tackle business challenges, this role could be for you. We are embracing new technology and exploring new ways of working. With our constant advancement, you will be at the forefront of a fast-evolving field. These exciting roles are at the heart of a high-performing Data Science team that is transforming Aviva in the Digital age. Here, we are creating a long-lasting legacy and optimizing every customer’s experience.

What you'll do

Transformation of complex data sets into meaningful conclusions & recommendations

Develop innovative solutions for pattern recognition using machine learning and statistical approaches

Maintenance of expanding set of data mining tools, frameworks & approaches

Communicate actionable recommendations based on insights/model results

Driving co-ordination/delivery accountability of project and BAU delivery based on timelines & direction

Driving conformance/Alignment to IT/Enterprise Architecture standards (where applicable)

What you'll bring

As a data-scientist, you will need the following skills and experience to succeed in the role:

An educational background in computer-science or engineering, math, statistics, physics or related field. A minimum of MSc is required and Phd preferred.

5+ years of experience with model development and working with large datasets. This can include experience from any industry or academia (post-doc experience), but experience in the insurance industry is preferred

5+ programming experience in Python or R with good grasp of software engineering standard methodologies such as code-reusability, modularity, use of repos, etc

What sets you apart

A growth mindset with versatile skills and able to work through problems from first-principles.

A portfolio of projects that demonstrate your ability to draw inferences from data. This includes participation within the broader data science community including Kaggle competitions or any personal projects with open data.

A can-do teammate who is willing to roll-up the sleeves and do whatever is needed to move projects forward. That means at times you will wear different hats and be a project manager, developer, modeler and chief communicator of solutions.

Amazing people skills and able to translate and communicate complex algorithms to non-technical individuals. Someone who understands that it is not enough to just have a phenomenal algorithm but meaningful to build an agreement for the solution from different partners.

The best problems in the industry are yet to be articulated. We need someone who is creative, self-motivated and can lead projects independently.

The Ideal candidate has experience with telematics data and distributed computing engines such as Spark.

What you’ll get

Competitive rewards package including base compensation, eligibility for annual bonus, retirement savings, share plan, health benefits, personal wellness, and volunteer opportunities.

Exceptional Career Development opportunities.

We’ll support your professional development education

Additional Information

Aviva Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. If you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance. If you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the Talent Acquisition Partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.

title: Principal Statistical Programmer (neuroscience) - Canada
job_summary: We are an award-winning specialist biometrics contract research organization (CRO) that works with pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device companies to…
job_description:
Overview:
About Phastar

Phastar brings data to life! We are an award-winning specialist biometrics contract research organization (CRO) that works with pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device companies to provide statistical consulting, analysis and reporting, data management, and data science services.

Our unique approach to data analysis, “The PHASTAR Discipline”, has gained us a reputation for outstanding quality. With this as our core focus, we’re looking for a talented individual who shares our passion for quality and technical expertise to join our team…could this be you?!

Why Phastar

Phastar is a company that cares. We strive to be the premier biometrics provider to work with, and to work for, and we take our responsibility to do our part for the environment and our community seriously.

Our pro bono scheme provides charities access to our biometrics experts at no cost; we source sustainable products to reduce our carbon footprint and, when you join our team, we will plant a tree in your honour as part of our rewilding project. Learn more about our ESG initiatives at phastar.com/cares.

Caring for YOU

YOUR career, YOUR work/life balance, YOUR PHASTAR experience.

Total flexibility – working hours that work for YOU.
Remote, office or hybrid – a working arrangement that works for YOU.
Culture of learning – continuously develop YOUR knowledge and share YOUR expertise with others.
Career Path - tailored to YOUR strengths and aspirations.
Monthly well-being checks – to ensure you get the support you need.
Fun, friendly working environment – experience PHASTAR’s famous social events throughout the year.

Responsibilities:
Sound a good fit for you? Here are some of the key contributions you would be making as a fully integrated member of our sponsor’s neuroscience team:

Hands-on statistical programming support for phase I-III clinical trials.
Manipulation of data to produce analysis datasets, including SDTM and ADaM datasets.
Production and review of Tables, Figures and Listings (TFLs) according to statistical analysis plans.
Creation and review of programming specifications and, if required, annotation of case report forms (CRFs) to CDISC standards.
Attendance at regular client meetings to provide updates on projects and timelines.

Qualifications:
The skills and experience you’ll bring to the role…

BSc or above in mathematics, science, or IT related discipline.
Experience working on clinical trials within a CRO/pharmaceutical environment.
Ability to work with SAS macros and perform end-to-end SAS programming tasks.
Substantial CDISC SDTM and ADaM experience.

Keen to be considered for the role? APPLY NOW to submit your application. Please note, we are unable to provide sponsorship for this role.

Phastar is committed to the principles and practices of equal opportunities and to encouraging the establishment of a diverse workforce. It is our policy to employ individuals on the basis of their suitability for the work to be performed and their potential for development, regardless of age, sex, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy or maternity, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion, or belief. This includes creating a culture that fully reflects our commitment to equal opportunities for all.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

Phastar does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Phastar's Head of Talent Acquisition to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to Phastar. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and Phastar. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of Phastar. Phastar shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Sr Specialist Downstream Integrated Ops Data Management and Analytics
job_summary: Proven experience with large technology implementations, application deployment or system migrations, Deep technical understanding of DCS technologies, data…
job_description:
Job Number: 137794
Title: Sr Specialist Downstream Integrated Ops Data Management and Analytics
Employment: Contract

Salary:
# of Openings: 1
Classification: Data Entry
Industry: Management Admin
Location: Calgary, AB
Postal Code: T2P 0M5
Country: Canada
Apply To: ptungaturti@agilus.ca

Description:
Agilus is recruiting for a Sr Specialist Downstream Integrated Ops Data Management and Analytics in the oil & gas industry in Calgary, Alberta.

A typical day:
Pull together and represent Downstream Manufacturing business interests on behalf of all Downstream sites through all phases of workstream initiative execution including production deployment, implementation of sustainment strategies, and long-term lifecycle management.
Engage and coordinate with key domain experts and representatives from each Downstream site and IT to develop an aligned plan, architecture, and approach for digital capability implementation related to integrated ops data management that will establish consistent patterns and methods for process data integration, data engineering, analysis, and reporting.
Develop, retain, and steward the strategy and roadmap for digital capability growth within the data management and analytics domains, Actively lead and coordinate applicable digital initiative working groups, working with project managers and the Digital Enablement Office to drive thorough project execution and risk management.
Business accountability for the integrated requirements and delivery of digital solutions supporting the integration and management of process and operations data from various source systems and DSM sites, Day-to-day oversight of project planning, execution, and sustainment related to operations data management and analytics solutions.
Business ownership and custodial responsibility over integrated DSM Operations Data Management and Analytics strategy, roadmap, and plan, Detailed design approaches and architectures for data management and analytics solutions.
Significant experience within Operations Data Management, Operations Technology systems and a deep understanding of Data Science workflows and processes - Engineering Degree preferred, Proven track record of implementing integrated Operations and Process Data Management Solutions, High operational business acumen within the Oil and Gas sector.
Drive and ensure alignment of a cross-functional oversight team within the Digital Enablement Program governance model, Represent escalations, concerns, change requests and proposals from initiative working groups and oversight teams to the Digital Enablement Office (DEO).
Fulfill Business ownership accountabilities for the initiatives within role purview, their long-term success, and contribution to the organization, Promote data management and data governance philosophies within the DSM organization.

Successful candidates will have:
Minimum 16 years work experience within the Energy industry with special consideration given to direct upgrading and refining experience, Minimum 8 years of direct work experience with process control systems, industrial automation systems and process data management.
BSc in Engineering or equivalent, Experience with management of large time-series data sets.
Proven experience with large technology implementations, application deployment or system migrations, Deep technical understanding of DCS technologies, data historians, data infrastructure, process automation, cloud solutions, data engineering and data utilization /management.
Experience with PI data historians, DataParc, and their interfaces to enterprise systems, PI AF and PI Analysis server development and support, data visualization and advanced data science platforms
Experience with cloud solutions and/or certification specifically with AWS and Azure is an asset, Strong operational business acumen (Downstream or Upstream), Ability to influence at multiple levels and across diverse stakeholder groups.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively across multiple stakeholder groups, Ability to travel on a semi-frequent basis, Proven ability to plan, coordinate, and ensure safety, Excellent project management, scheduling, and time management skills.
Capable of working independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary team, Ability to advance culture of performance improvement through structured work processes that are relevant, reportable, and measurable.

Total rewards:
5 days on / 2 days off
12 Months of contract position
Competitive Compensation
Legally authorized to work in the Canada without restrictions

Interested?

We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available on Request.

title: AI Product Engineer
job_summary: We're looking for a creative and passionate AI Product Engineer to help us leverage modern AI technologies to help automate development workflows and save our…
job_description:
We're looking for a creative and passionate AI Product Engineer to help us leverage modern AI technologies to help automate development workflows and save our customers time.

The ideal candidate is knowledgeable about the rapidly developing AI landscape and has a product mindset. They should have a proactive attitude towards learning and be creative problem solvers.

Successful candidates will have technical knowledge and interest in integrating AI models into products and thrive in ambiguous early-stage start-up environments. Their contributions will help shape the future of Zenhub’s platform.

The best candidates will have broad experience across data science, engineering, and product. While expertise in all areas is not expected, the candidate should be eager to learn, contribute, and be involved with the entire development process.

If you are an ambitious AI Product Engineer with a passion for technology and a desire to make a meaningful impact, we would love to hear from you!

A little about us:
At Zenhub, our mission is to help make software teams more productive. Our product is used by more than 8000 organizations around the world to help plan and track software projects and provide visibility into progress and key milestones for the wider organization.

As a company, we recognize the advantages that AI can bring to our customers, in terms of time saving and a better user experience. We couldn’t wait to start integrating AI into Zenhub and we just released our first AI integration AI Labels. This is just the beginning, our mission is to continue further innovation in this space. We’re looking for ways to make stand ups, sprint planning, prioritization, estimation, and retrospectives as streamlined as possible.

We’re backed by three of Canada’s most prominent venture firms, Yaletown Ventures, BDC Capital, and Ripple Ventures, as well as Axiom Zen, an award-winning product studio responsible for breakout hits in the Web3 space like Dapper Labs, CryptoKitties, and NBA TopShot.

What we’ll accomplish together:
Lead the product development, research, and design for new AI-powered features.
Get hands-on with the engineering implementation of those features.
Develop and maintain the backend infrastructure, ensuring scalability, performance, and reliability with AI integration in mind.
Create intuitive and engaging user interfaces on the frontend to enable seamless interaction with AI-powered features.
Participate in the entire software development lifecycle, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, testing, and deployment of AI features.
Research and implement new AI technologies, frameworks, and tools to enhance Zenhub's AI capabilities and user experience.
Optimize AI solutions for deployment on premise, ensuring security and efficiency in air-gapped environments.
Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members to maintain code quality and best practices.
Stay up-to-date with the latest AI and software development trends, sharing knowledge with the team and actively contributing to continuous improvement.

A little about you:
Capable of applying skills across various use cases: This role encompasses a mix of data science, engineering, and product responsibilities. While expertise in all areas is not expected, the candidate should be eager to learn and contribute to the entire development process.
Adaptability and prioritization: Ability to work with processes and plans, but also be flexible and prioritize tasks based on their impact.
Understanding of backend or frontend development principles: Familiarity with basic principles and best practices of either backend or frontend development.
Knowledge of AI concepts and technologies: Familiarity with AI concepts like machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing.
Experience with AI APIs and libraries: Previous exposure to working with AI APIs and libraries, with bonus points for familiarity with LLM API. Knowledge of the main differences between GPT and LLaMA models is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity: Ability to solve problems and think creatively to develop innovative solutions.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills: Effective communication and collaboration with multidisciplinary teams.

Nice to Have:
Experience with data science or machine learning techniques.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and experience with deploying AI solutions in the cloud.
Programming skills in at least one of the following: Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, TypeScript or Python.
Previous experience in developing and deploying On Premise solutions.
Exposure to natural language processing (NLP) techniques and libraries.

How to apply:
Please include your resume and/or LinkedIn.
Please include your GitHub profile or a link to an AI project that you’ve built

More about ZenHub:
We’re proudly Great Place to Work Certified! 100% of our surveyed team members said ZenHub is a great place to work, and we received a 94% average Trust Index© Score from our team members.

Don’t sweat it if you don’t have everything listed in the role description. One of our values is “Growth Mindset”. If you have some of the qualities listed above, and are excited about the role and motivated to learn – we want to hear from you!

At ZenHub our people are the priority. We believe the more perspectives we embrace, the stronger our team. We recruit the best, and welcome people of all backgrounds regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or ability. With a focus on respect and a commitment to continuous learning, we’re building an inclusive culture that supports our team in doing their best work. We work hard to provide our full-time team members perks that make their lives better by offering:

Boundaryless working style. We want our team to work from wherever is best for them. Whether you prefer to work from the comfort of your home office or from our bright, spacious, and dog-friendly collaboration hub, we support you. For those opting to wfh, we offer a generous monthly stipend to cover ongoing remote work expenses. If you opt to join us in-office, we’ll contribute to your commute expenses or bike maintenance.
Flexible vacation. We work hard and it’s important we take time to recharge. We have a flexible time off policy with no hard limit and encourage our team members to take a minimum of 3 weeks off per year.
A commitment to continued learning and development. We provide an annual professional development budget to use towards conferences, classes, books, and other opportunities to maintain and expand your skill set.
Fitness reimbursements. Stay fit with our monthly reimbursements for health-related benefits like gym memberships, fitness apps, and personal training.
Top-of-the-line equipment. In addition to receiving a company smartphone of your choice with a paid voice/data plan, every team member receives a generous annual new tech budget to try new gadgets, tools, and platforms.
Flexible parental leave + top up. We understand the importance and demands of a growing family. In addition to state, provincial, and federal leave allowances, parents on our team are eligible for leave top-up and have the ability to create flexible schedules or take days off when family needs to come first.
Social Connection. When it’s safe to gather again our team will have access to a shared collaboration space in Vancouver, but our team is committed to remote-first. We're focused on fostering strong relationships and an equitable experience no matter where in the world you’re working.

Check out our careers page to learn more about what other benefits we offer!

title: Senior Manager, Analytics – Stores & Services
job_summary: This role will drive analytical leadership within the company and enable data-based decision making to help Staples Canada become a leading data-driven…
job_description:
: 1258494

Who we are
As the Working and Learning Company, we at Staples Canada, are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. At Staples, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We look for people who are curious, approachable, and passionate, and who enjoy finding solutions.
If that’s you, let’s work, learn, and grow together.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team

Staples Canada is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
This role will drive analytical leadership within the company and enable data-based decision making to help Staples Canada become a leading data-driven organization. The individual will lead the Reporting & Insights practice for Stores & Services as part of the Enterprise Analytics & Data Science team. Our multi-tenant cloud platforms power our analytics and ML/AI capabilities and we’re looking for an active hands-on contributor to play a central role in helping our teams understand performance and impact of their strategies. Additionally, the role will be continuously challenged to bring forward valuable insights to help their partners make better and more informed decisions.

We’re on a transformation journey and this role will be a key enabler in accelerating our analytics practice. In addition to having direct ownership over Stores & Services, this role will work closely with various cross-functional partners and have the opportunity to build deep insights across the customer journey – extending to marketing, supply chain, and our B2B functions.

This position represents an ideal role for a highly motivated and highly analytical individual. We are a highly collaborative, agile work environment, so the ideal candidate would demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills and excellent technical depth. The successful candidate will be passionate about data and have a strong foundation in analytics, understanding business needs, and storytelling.

Specifically, You Will:
Strategy & Enablement:
Establish the company as the leader in leveraging and executing on a customer first data-driven strategyOwn and develop the vision, strategy, and execution for a best-in-class customer intelligence and analytics function, ensuring scalability of systems, governance, tools, capabilities, processes, and talentWork with other functions within Analytics and Engineering to curate and source together transactional/behavioural/operational data (in-store, online, third-party) into views that can easily be leveraged and trusted for decision making, connecting back to our customer, their journeys and business prioritiesDevelop suite of reporting tools, with a self-serve enablement focus, that define business impact and project success, while also providing deep insights on integrated data sets to evaluate short term and long-term ROIDrive both strategic and tactical execution to unlock the value of data across internal and external data sets and generate critical actionable insights to drive the decision-making processEstablish analytical standards and best practices to be leveraged across the company’s ecosystem
Delivery of the Functional Analytics Roadmap:
Execute on the roadmap and deliver reporting & impactful insights to core partners across Retail Operations and Services (online and stores)Provide business insights and recommendations to drive increased revenue, conversion, traffic, profitability, and an improved customer experience. job_description:
JOIN OUR TEAM

Metro Supply Chain is a strategic supply chain solutions partner for some of the world’s fastest growing and most recognizable organizations. We advance our customers’ business through innovative, real-world solutions within a culture that supports our communities, protects our environment, and enables our team to thrive. Managing 14 million square feet in 98 sites across North America and Europe with a team of 6,000, it is the largest privately-owned supply chain solutions company based in Canada.

The Supply Chain Analytics team at Metro has one mandate - drive change through data.

Analytics in Supply Chain:
As per Deloitte, supply chains are a rich place to look for competitive advantage, partly because of their complexity, and partly because of the significant role they play in a company’s cost structure. With the power of new analytics, companies can now fine-tune their supply chains in ways that simply weren’t possible in the past. As a supply chain company analytics and insights are everything!
Based on this, Metro Supply Chain is embracing and driving change which is critical to our success. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and attracting the best talent to drive the company forward.
The successful candidate will support the design and delivery of analytics and insights to customers, operations, and senior leadership. They will bring decision, descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics to life to support operational performance reviews and continuous improvement efforts.
At Metro we focus on efficiency, effectiveness, people, and financial metrics to drive change and improve prediction and planning.

A small sample of what you will be involved in:
Produce insightful business analytics related to the distribution centres, transportation, contract packaging, and time critical teams.
Using customer data to visualize, analyze, and simplify the performance picture it is not just boxes going from point A to point B.
Work proactively with key business partners to identify opportunities and to drive transformational business growth initiatives, which deliver customer and shareholder value and meet targets as agreed with company senior leadership.

Who you are:

Qualifications:
University/College degree in Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, or related field5+ years of relevant and demonstrable experience in the business intelligence and analytics field and 3+ years of experience in a leadership role as this is a hands-on role.Coding skills in languages such as, SQL (must-have) and PySpark/ Python (preferred)Strong understanding in SQL programming language and cloud-based platforms (Azure, Snowflake, others)Ability to work on data science tools (R, Python, Apache Spark, others) is preferred.Understanding of data pipelines and ETL (extract, transform, load) processes.Expert knowledge of data visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI (must-have)Ability to work with IT and Data Engineering teams to help embed analytic outputs in business processes.Proven track record of delivering impactful analytics/technology projects.Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written. Able to engage and effectively manage relationships at all levels of the organization.Experience in supply chain or transportation industry is a plus.
Why Join Us
Work in an environment where safety is our first priorityThe opportunity to build a career with a growing companyMedical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your familyLife and disability insuranceWellness programs to support your family’s well-beingA Retirement Savings Program with a company matchCompany team wear allowanceEmployee Appreciation DayCompany sponsored social eventsCommunity volunteering
We are committed to building and fostering a diverse workplace where people feel included and valued. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals.
Should you require accommodation for a special ability or need during the recruitment process, please reach out to a member of our Human Resources Team.

title: Marketing Data Scientist
job_summary: Who we are Join Scene+ and be part of Canada's most robust lifestyle loyalty program with over 13 million members and growing! We are a trusted brand, driven…
job_description:
Who we are

Join Scene+ and be part of Canada's most robust lifestyle loyalty program with over 13 million members and growing! We are a trusted brand, driven by the belief that there's always something to look forward to with rewards for every kind of life. Our goal is to become Canada’s favourite loyalty program by nurturing our Members with rewards their way.

We're the exciting joint venture of Cineplex, Empire, and Scotiabank, blending the energy, optimism, and atmosphere of a startup with the funding of three major players. With over 60 team members and plans to grow more, we're an emerging, responsive company. We offer collaboration, accountability, challenges, and rewards to everyone who joins us.

Our motto is "Love what's next," and we believe it applies to your career too. Join us to help evolve the program, collaborate with amazing teams, and love what lies ahead

Who we need

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Marketing Data Science, we are looking for a Marketing Data Scientist who brings the technical expertise and practical knowledge to leverage analytics and demonstrate marketing effectiveness. You will play a pivotal role and take ownership of our post-campaign analytics, developing our omnichannel campaign deployment, and delivering data-driven recommendations for personalized member offers. From testing new campaigns, building dashboards, and presenting impact, you will work strategically and creatively to ensure we are engaging and delighting our members.

What's in it for you

Ownership. We are a data science driven company. Our customer database is one of Canada's largest and most complex, with data from dozens of different partners and millions of members. Every project you work on will have a sizeable impact on the organization as a whole and our loyalty program members.

Future forward impact. This is a chance to define and shape your role as part of a future-forward team that values authenticity and invites fresh perspectives. Joining us now is a chance to drive decisions and bridge post-campaign analytics with marketing plans. You will have the opportunity to recommend tools, approaches, and best practices as well as expand our data-driven marketing capabilities.

Anticipation. With over 30% of our team promoted within the last year, we have a proven history of supporting the growth of our people. You will work with a manager whose focus is to remove barriers and empower his team to collaborate seamlessly and accomplish great things. You will be supported in your day-to-day deliverables - growing your presentation skills, and contributing to decision-making - and in your overall career development. Whether you want to move into Machine Learning and data modelling or explore another area of our business or one of our parent companies, there is always something to look forward to.

As our new Marketing Data Scientist, you will:
Build. You will code and develop omnichannel campaigns for member engagement and offers. You will work with partners to define campaign objectives, target audiences, test requirements, and delivery timelines.
Analyze marketing data. You will monitor campaign performance and consult on adjustments to marketing strategy based on your findings. You will conduct post-campaign deep dives, collaborating with Marketing, Partnerships and Data Science to implement changes to messaging and ensure alignment on objectives.
Optimize. You will augment existing campaigns with insights and tools created by the data science team. You will identify gaps in data point collection, demonstrate areas for further exploration and targeting, and evolve the entire campaign process to improve efficiency and reduce errors. You will implement campaign testing to drive meaningful outcomes.
Grow. You will research new tools, trends, and approaches, and work with vendors to stay up to date with the latest methodologies and best practices in the field.

You bring:
The analytics. You have a background in data science and experience in marketing and campaign analytics. Ideally, you have worked on customer loyalty programs, identifying trends and opportunities to create effective, engaging campaigns. You have worked with big data sets in a customer-facing industry and you can apply your findings to drive decisions and pinpoint gaps in data point collection. You have experience with testing frameworks like A/B, long-term control holdouts and price optimization. You can distill data to key relevant findings, create and make presentations, tell a story and use data visualization to enhance your message.
The technical skills. You can learn new tools independently and quickly. You are proficient in MS Office, including the strengths in building presentation decks in PowerPoint that succinctly convey results and provide data-based recommendations. You have a solid foundation using Python/Pyspark for data science, writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources, and using Tableau for data visualization. You have strong digital business acumen and a proven record of successfully working with marketing automation tools like Salesforce, Hubspot, Adobe, Moengage, etc.
Interpersonal skills. You can nurture relationships across internal and external teams: gaining trust to influence decisions. You have professional communication skills, including translating complex analytics concepts and findings for different audiences and levels.

Why work for Scene+? The best of all worlds. We offer:
Perks. Enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, performance-based bonuses, and extra rewards from our owners, including discounted rates on mortgages, banking, movies, and groceries.
Transparency. Our strategic focus comes from our owners, along with funding and infrastructure support. The creative approach and direction is Scene’s to run with.
Warmth. We’re nurturing an authentic culture of relationship building, knowledge sharing, and creativity. As we continue to grow and work together, everyone is invited to share ideas for fun with the team.
The future. We are all about living in the moment while looking towards the future. Because to us, the only thing more exciting than today is tomorrow.

Apply now.

If you have 70% of what we're looking for and 100% authenticity and passion, express your interest here. Please contact us by email and let us know what accommodations or assistance we can provide you during the application process.

At Scene+, we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We strive to integrate these values into everything we do, from our partners and offers to our teams and interactions. We welcome and appreciate candidates from diverse backgrounds, including women, persons with disabilities, Black, Indigenous and People of Colour (BIPOC), the LGBTQ2SIA+ community, and other equity-seeking groups.

title: Senior Data Scientist (Reinforcement Learning)
job_summary: Tiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Scientists to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. Our employees bring deep expertise in…
job_description:
Tiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Scientists to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. Our employees bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.

We are looking for a robust Senior Data Scientist preferably, with a Ph.D. who holds solid knowledge of reinforcement learning, deep learning, quick learner, and has strong coding capabilities. This person will be responsible for writing complex production-level codes.

Key Responsibilities

Effectively communicate the analytics approach and how it will meet and address objectives to business partners.
Advocate and educate on the value of data-driven decision-making; focus on the "how and why" of solutions.
Lead analytic approaches; integrate solutions collaboratively into applications and tools with data engineers, business leads, analysts, and developers.
Create repeatable, interpretable, dynamic, and scalable models seamlessly incorporated into analytic data products.
Collaborate, coach, and learn with a growing team of experienced Data Scientists.
Stay connected with external sources of ideas through conferences and community engagements.
Support demands from regulators, investor relations, etc., to develop innovative solutions to meet objectives utilizing cutting-edge techniques and tools.

Requirements

Ph.D. (highly preferred) or Master's in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Data Science, or a related field.
At least 6+ years of extensive Data Science experience with Reinforcement Learning, Deep Learning, knowledge in AI, and DL modeling coding capability as this person needs to make designs happen.
Strong statistics foundation and knowledge of statistical packages. Proficiency with Python and SQL and ability to write complex Python codes and SQL queries.
A solid knowledge of deep learning, quick learner, and a strong coding capability. This person will be responsible for writing complex production-level codes.
Hands-on experience building models is a must.
Experience with supply chain/retail forecasting is a must.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to understand business partner needs and deliver solutions.

Benefits

This position offers an excellent opportunity for significant career development in a fast-growing and challenging entrepreneurial environment with a high degree of individual responsibility.

title: Data & Insights Specialist
job_summary: About Futurpreneur Canada Futurpreneur Canada has been fostering the entrepreneurial passions of diverse young entrepreneurs across Canada since 1996. We’re…
job_description:
About Futurpreneur Canada

Futurpreneur Canada has been fostering the entrepreneurial passions of diverse young entrepreneurs across Canada since 1996. We’re the only national, non-profit organization that provides financing, mentorship and resources to aspiring business owners aged 18-39. More than 17,700 young Canadian entrepreneurs, spanning every province and territory, have successfully launched their business with Futurpreneur’s support. Their main street businesses help drive Canada’s inclusive economic prosperity in communities from coast to coast to coast.

Futurpreneur is a founding member of the G20 Young Entrepreneurs’ Alliance, the Canadian member of Youth Business International, and the Canadian host of Global Entrepreneurship Week.

Our Purpose (why we exist): To drive inclusive Canadian prosperity by fostering the success of young entrepreneurs

Our Mission (what we do every day to achieve our purpose):To provide early-stage financing and mentorship, alongside experiences and other resources to help diverse, aspiring entrepreneurs aged 18-39 launch successful businesses that contribute to sustainable and inclusive economic development, in their communities and for Canada.

Our Values (how we work – our core principles & commitments): We are mission-driven, collegial & collaborative, diverse & inclusive, and accountable & transparent.

Here’s the opportunity:
Futurpreneur is looking for an experienced Data & Insights Specialist to analyze a broad array of client and market data to glean valuable insights to improve Futurpreneur’s outreach, operations and entrepreneur support programs. Using their strong business acumen, the Data & Insights Specialist will collect data from different sources, extracting key business insights from and interpreting this data to help us reach and support young entrepreneurs. The ideal candidate will have mathematical and statistical expertise, along with natural curiosity and a creative mind. While mining, interpreting, and cleaning our data, this person will ask key questions, connect the dots, and uncover hidden opportunities for realizing our data’s full potential to help Futurpreneur improve our capacity to support diverse, young entrepreneurs.

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, the incumbent will work closely with many internal teams and senior leaders to present information using data visualization techniques for operating and also reporting purposes, both internally and externally with our funders.

This is a permanent, full-time position that can be located anywhere in Canada, though ideally in Toronto. The incumbent will be working on our hybrid work model (minimum 2 days in the office).

What you will be doing:
Research planning and execution

Collaborate and meet with senior leadership and various teams such as Business Development, Client Service, Client Experience, Programs & Partnerships, Finance and Marketing & Communications to identify research needs and opportunities that support business objectives
Lead the end-to-end process of designing and executing data research projects, including Futurpreneur’s annual survey of all current and past entrepreneur clients (conducted by a third party), encompassing data collection, thorough analysis, and comprehensive reporting. Utilize these insights to enhance our understanding of critical client dynamics, thereby enabling us to more effectively engage, empower, and equip our Young Entrepreneurs for success
Develop and manage project timelines, budgets, and resources to ensure timely and successful completion of data projects
Stay up-to-date with industry trends within the entrepreneurial ecosystem and data analytics including emerging technologies, and best practices in data research and analysis

Data collection

Identify valuable data sources for business needs and enhance/automate the data collection processes
Collect and gather data from various sources, including Futurpreneur's CRM database and Loans system, websites, surveys, and other relevant repositories, using appropriate tools and methods, such as web scraping, SQL queries, and API integrations, to ensure data completeness and relevance to the project goals
Build and maintain relationships with external data providers and vendors to ensure the timely and accurate acquisition of relevant data for analysis and visualization purposes, including negotiating contracts, managing data licenses, and collaborating with data partners to improve data quality and accessibility
Source missing data from systems and databases that are not integrated with our CRM, such as Loans system and publicly available sources such as Statistics Canada

Data analysis

Develop and implement data models, such as conceptual, logical, and physical models, to represent complex datasets and business processes, and to facilitate data analysis, visualization, and decision-making. This includes selecting appropriate modeling techniques, tools, and software, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure model accuracy and alignment with project objectives
Analyze and interpret data (e.g. KPI, client-related data) to identify trends, insights, and opportunities to answer research and reporting questions that improve business performance
Present research findings to senior management in a clear and concise manner including data visualizations techniques (such as charts, graphs, and interactive dashboards using Power BI, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Dynamics CRM, while exploring new tools like Tableau, Googlecharts, Infogram) to effectively communicate complex data insights to stakeholders and decision makers
Work with senior leadership and various teams to make recommendations to adapt and evolve existing business strategies and propose solutions. Some of the areas include:

Marketing - provide insights on high-converting lead channels to enhance ROI assessment and enable scalable initiatives, identifying the origins and conversion journey of high-quality leads for successful application and disbursement (using data in our Dynamics CRM, website landing pages, Google, and social media ads analytics accounts)Entrepreneurship programs - develop and implement a data-driven framework to answer critical questions about Young Entrepreneurs’ success, business ideas, program effectiveness, and event impact, enabling informed decision-making and continuous improvementMentoring - enhance mentoring program measurement framework with KPIs including mentor recruitment, mentor/Young Entrepreneur satisfaction, and performance metrics for mentor matchingCredit Adjudication and compliance - analyze industry-specific application and disbursement data, track compliance conditions, report median days to disbursement (in conjunction with launch readiness), and provide insights on program/segment performance with credit scores and business risk profilesClient services and conversion - develop and maintain data models to accurately calculate the lead to applicant to disbursement conversion rate; analyze key drivers of conversion, such as lead source, nurturing activities, and engagement metricsClient experience - analyze client service data (calls/engagements, conversion rates, follow-ups, sentiment analysis using the data from our surveys, Zendesk ticketing system, CRM, website and client portal) and user experience data (customer flows, time, clicks, handoffs, process repetition) to improve service quality and enhance user satisfaction throughout clients’ Futurpreneur journeys
Data Management

Organize, structure and maintain data in a logical and meaningful way, including creating databases, data dictionaries, establishing naming conventions, and developing folder structures to facilitate efficient data storage, retrieval, and analysis
Perform data cleaning procedures to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data, including identifying and resolving inconsistencies, errors, and missing values in large datasets
Develop and maintain data pipelines and data processing workflows to ensure timely delivery of data

What you bring:
Relevant experience may include education with a focus in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Maths or other quantitative field or equivalent hands-on career experience
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst
Experience in data mining and statistical analysis
Understanding of machine-learning and operations research
Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity in programming languages like SAS, Java/Python or C++ is an asset
Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop)
Strong quantitative skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)
Knowledge of digital marketing analytics tools including Google 360, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and Adobe Marketing Suite
Advanced experience in pattern recognition and predictive modeling
Experience with Microsoft Office particularly Excel, PowerPoint
Ability to work effectively in a dynamic, research-oriented group that has several concurrent projects
Strong time management with ability to prioritize and manage deadlines
Analytical mind and business acumen, able to determine the questions that will provide the most insight
Strong attention to detail
Strong problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication for effective stakeholder management, including ability to write and speak clearly to communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand
Bilingualism in French & English (spoken & written) – an asset
Alignment with Futurpreneur’s values and commitment to the mission/purpose of the organization
Be a role model for Futurpreneur’s organizational culture by creating a positive impact at every touchpoint with people

HOW TO APPLY:
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume, cover letter and salary expectations by June 5, 2023.

What we offer:
Futurpreneur offers you the opportunity to work for an organization with a clear and compelling purpose - To drive inclusive Canadian prosperity by fostering the success of young entrepreneurs. Respect, teamwork, diversity and inclusion, transparency, empathy, impact, innovation, high performance, recognition and working hard and having fun are important to us!

We offer an attractive compensation package that encompasses a competitive salary and amazing benefits, such as health and dental benefits package plus RRSP contribution matching, health spending account, flex hours and more.

Futurpreneur Canada is committed to an inclusive, equitable workplace and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. We embrace the unique perspectives and experiences within our team. Reasonable accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process.
