title: GIS Data Analyst
job_summary: Extracting, transforming and analyzing data from multiple data sources, ensuring data quality and integrity is maintained from source to the final output;
job_description:
(CUPE 905.03.25)

(Job ID#2023.75)

Department: Office of the Deputy CAO

Division: Information Technology Services

Location: Civic Centre

Status: Permanent, Full Time

Hours of Work: 35 hours per week

Number of Positions: 1

Wage Range: $39.31 to $43.69/hour

Date Posted: July 5, 2023

Date Closing: July 19, 2023

Position Purpose

This position is responsible for implementing and operating data services to collect, manage, integrate, share and reuse high quality data to inform strategic decisions and support the delivery of Town of Georgina’s strategic priorities. The Data Analyst - GIS will also develop, maintain and support corporate spatial and tabular data from a variety of sources, data visualization services, predictive and process modelling. For full details, please see attached job description.

Minimum Qualifications

Four (4) year University Degree in Geomatics, Statistics, Geography, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Administration or a related field; four (4) years of proven experience in GIS, data management, developing data analytic and business intelligence solutions, and web/e-government solutions; two (2) year in developing business requirements through a data analytics lens; experience in SAS or SPSS, SQL, Tableau and similar enterprise systems in the context of reporting and data extraction as well as integrating GIS solutions with other business systems using FME or other integration platforms and data warehousing and business intelligence tools and platforms including cloud, on premise and hybrid environments. For full details, please see attached job description.

How to apply:
Qualified applicants are invited to submit a resume and cover letter, identifying the Job Title and Job ID#. Please apply by visiting www.georgina.ca/careers no later than 11:59 pm on the closing date. The assessment process may include a practical test and/or interview.

Committed to diversity and a barrier-free environment:
The Town of Georgina is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate the needs of applicants under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Human Resources Office to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted.

Personal information collected will be used in accordance with the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act for the purpose of candidate selection. Further information concerning the collection of personal information should be directed to the Human Resources Manager, Town of Georgina, 26557 Civic Centre Road, Keswick, ON L4P 3G1 (905) 476-4301

JOB DESCRIPTION

POSITION: Data Analyst – GIS JOB NO: MU104

DEPARTMENT: Corporate Services DIVISION: ITS

LOCATION: Civic Centre GRADE: 15

DATE PREPARED: January 2020

PRIMARY FUNCTION:
This position is responsible for implementing and operating data services to collect, manage, integrate, share and reuse high quality data to inform strategic decisions and support the delivery of Town of Georgina’s strategic priorities.

The Data Analyst - GIS will also develop, maintain and support corporate spatial and tabular data from a variety of sources, data visualization services, predictive and process modelling.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Direct: Supervisor of GIS and Data Analytics

Indirect: Manager of Information Technology Services

DIRECTION EXERCISED:
Provides advice, guidance, instructions to co-op students, contractors and vendors as requested/required.

WORKING PROCEDURES:
ITS Administration Functions

Designing, delivering and maintaining GIS enterprise-wide / in-production analytic solutions;
Developing, evaluating and refining analytic models to inform strategic decision making through data visualization, business intelligence and predictive analytics services;
Extracting, transforming and analyzing data from multiple data sources, ensuring data quality and integrity is maintained from source to the final output;
Developing and deploying algorithms using advanced statistical and mathematical methods;
Developing, maintaining, and updating the Town of Georgina’s GIS spatial data stored in File Geodatabases and SQL databases;
Developing and maintaining a data catalogue identifying what Town of Georgina collects and creates and how it is used;
Developing, maintaining, and enhancing metadata used by both technical and business teams through data quality assessments;
Identifying areas for data quality improvements and supporting business in developing solutions to systematically resolve issues;
Plans for the implementation of technologies, business system integrations and methods for use within the operations of the organization;
Acts as a project lead in planning, coordinating and controlling automation related projects for the municipality, including submitting project milestones and status reports, post implementation reviews and project conclusion reports;
Recommend policies, assess division-level operating policies, procedures, work systems, methods and standards and report on division performance taking corrective action where necessary;
Prepares, obtains client approval and executes detailed project implementation plans fulfilling user requirements, including liaising between the client department and client agency, budgetary and scheduling responsibilities and project, milestone and status reporting.

Business Planning, Budget and Financial Management Functions

Acts as a project lead in planning, coordinating and controlling automation related projects for the municipality, including submitting project milestones and status reports, post implementation reviews and project conclusion reports.
Recommend policies, assess division-level operating policies, procedures, work systems, methods and standards and report on division performance taking corrective action where necessary
Prepares, obtains client approval and executes detailed project implementation plans fulfilling user requirements, including liaising between the client department and client agency, budgetary and scheduling responsibilities and project, milestone and status reporting.

Communication, Liaison and Customer Service Activities

Participate in Technology Steering Committees for the purpose of directing the use of technology within the organization; and facilitating Ad Hoc Committees as required for the planning and implementation of specific initiatives
Develop a constructive and trusting partnership with stakeholders by providing guidance, communications, advice and decision support on the delivery of corporate service initiatives, including risks and impact assessments.

Other Responsibilities

Supports the Emergency Community Control Group, initiates and implements the activities assigned in the Corporate Emergency Plan to support response efforts during community emergencies
Other duties as assigned;

The foregoing is intended to outline the general description of the duties and responsibilities for this position. It is not intended nor should it be interpreted as a complete description. The Town of Georgina reserves the right to amend this position description at any time provided that such change does not represent a substantive change in the purpose or essential nature of the position.

SKILL/KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS:
Education and Training

Four (4) year University Degree in Geomatics, Statistics, Geography, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Administration or a related field;
Certification in GIS and / or Data Analytics desirable;

Experience

Four (4) years of proven experience in GIS, data management, developing data analytic and business intelligence solutions, and web/e-government solutions;
Two (2) year in developing business requirements through a data analytics lens;
Experience in SAS or SPSS, SQL, Tableau and similar enterprise systems in the context of reporting and data extraction;
Experience in integrating GIS solutions with other business systems using FME or other integration platforms;
Experience with data warehousing and business intelligence tools and platforms including cloud, on premise and hybrid environments;
One (1) year on the job for the period of adjustment, orientation, and adaptation.

Required Skills

Thorough skills in quantitative and qualitative analytical methodologies; Data extraction, cleaning, collection, organization, analysis and interpretation from various systems/databases;
Survey techniques and methodologies; Data analytic models and frameworks; Database principles and structure; Statistical analysis, methods, tools and predictive modeling; Spatial Data analysis, data conversion, GIS Workflows, Model Building, Understanding of programming (Python), and data integration; and Understanding of emerging analysis trends and technology.

Knowledge and Competencies

Good understanding of municipal and provincial legislative, regulatory and policy framework, and administrative functions and responsibilities;
Good understanding of data governance, change management and project management; Knowledge of ERP (enterprise resource planning) and enterprise geographical information systems (GIS);
Knowledge of industry standard practices, guidelines, benchmarks, and safety policies and procedures.
Valid Class “G” Driver’s License and access to a reliable vehicle required to commute to various Town facilities;
One (1) year on the job for the period of adjustment, orientation, and adaptation.

Physical Demands and Working Conditions

Normal office conditions;
Ability to attend/respond to evening and/or weekend meetings/incidents as necessary.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Big Data
job_summary: Guiding the team to develop innovative data engineering solutions and contribute to data democratization in Office organization.
job_description:
Microsoft Office is at the center of Microsoft’s efforts to empower our users to do more. Across mobile, web, and desktop, empowering users to create, edit, and interact with their documents, embracing a core belief that you should have the best of breed experience irrespective of device. The Data, Insights, and Growth (DIG) team – part of the Office Fuel organization powering engineering capability and customer lifecycle – builds transformative capabilities that help Microsoft teams immerse in understanding, protecting, and empowering the customer via data. We deliver innovative modern data solutions and services which enable new Office experiences at service velocity, intelligent analysis, and richly informed hypothesis-driven agility – driving business success through customer engagement and satisfaction.

We offer a fantastic and fun team environment with a commitment to people, inclusion. We celebrate team cultural values of being:

Customer-obsessed (and helping everyone else live this)
Exceptional partners – designing and co-developing capabilities for and across dozens (to hundreds) of teams
Committed to continual learning and growing in building a high-trust, collaborative, diverse, and deeply inclusive team environment.

We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join our Telemetry Analytics Team. Our telemetry systems are the bedrock of our data-informed culture, providing insights and telemetry across millions of clients daily. We empower Office Engineering Teams with Data and Insights to let them respond to customer feedback, steer future investments, and ensure our customers have the best experience possible daily. We serve Enterprise Tenant Admins with Insights about Office Health, empowering them to engage and collaborate for greater productivity. Processing trillions of events daily, our highly scalable systems enable teams to derive insights related to product reliability, business metrics and feature success metrics. Enabling Office Experimenters to safely conduct large scale experiments for product performance, reliability and engagement is another key focus area and team is focused in building large scale systems for Office Experimentation. We do this through building and modernizing our batch and real-time data processing systems, Azure Machine learning to derive insights and detect actionable anomalies. Engineers throughout Office use these systems to make product decisions to shape the future of Office. We leverage state-of-the-art Azure technologies for big data processing tech that is available internally and open source/Azure technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Explorer, Azure Data Factory etc. Great opportunity to impact millions of Office Customers, shape Office Telemetry systems architecture and contribute to the success of several Office Teams and Enterprise Customers.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
Contribute to the strategy, vision, architecture, and execution for Office Telemetry infrastructure
Coach and mentor engineers, both technically through code and design reviews
Guiding the team to develop innovative data engineering solutions and contribute to data democratization in Office organization
Collaboration with Office Engineering teams to review data needs and build scalable systems to meet internal and external partner needs
Modernizing the data platform for scale, compliance, and keeping costs in control
Collaboration with the Data Science team in building and productizing the data science models for Reliability and Growth needs

Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline AND 4+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python
OR equivalent experience.

Additional or Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 8+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 6+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python
OR equivalent experience.
Experience in highly scalable web services, data processing, near-real-time systems, and “big data” problems

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Director, Global Finance Performance Analytics
job_summary: Strong awareness of data best practices and what’s possible with rich data. They will be data-driven, solutions-oriented with a proven ability to synthesize…
job_description:
Position Title: Director, Global Finance Performance Analytics

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Toronto HQ

Requisition ID: 22651

JOB PURPOSE: McCain is on a digital transformation journey and we are seeking a creative, courageous and data-driven individual to help shape and realize our vision for Finance. The primary purpose of this leadership role is to own how Finance Digital Technologies and Analytics will enable global business performance and profitable growth decision-making.

This role is responsible for driving how dynamic financial information, analysis and planning processes, can be improved using digital and data strategies/technology. This role will be the Finance lead shaping the analytics performance roadmap in Finance, partnering with technology, global and regional Finance teams. The role will set and own the global standard for transforming financial data into business performance information for decision-making.

In this role, the incumbent will serve as Finance Business partner to Sales, Marketing, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Agriculture functions to provide data analysis and insights, and recommend action plans to maximize the bottom line, leveraging diverse data sources.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Identify opportunities for descriptive and advanced analytics to drive profitability, provide financial understanding and direction to our business
Manage the development and sustainment of Profitability, Costing and Financial Planning models, analytical reporting, scorecards and dashboards
Set strategy and roadmap for how Digital Technologies, Financial Data and Analytics will be leveraged by Global and Regional Finance teams at McCain to enable rich financial information
Promote and drive the use of data and adoption of data analytics to Global and Regional teams to inform business decisions
Guide the continuous improvement of FP&A, Management Reporting and Profitability Analysis solutions in OneStream, SAP PaPM and SAP Analytics Cloud
Elevate and promote the use of SAP ERP, Management Reporting, Financial Planning Tools (OneStream, SAC, PaPM) and Analytics and their application with regional teams and key stakeholders, including c-level executives
Leverage diverse data sources to provide regular analytics insights, reporting and actionable recommendations to the FLT and other key stakeholders
Work in partnership with Finance, Technology and Data & Analytics teams locally and globally.

KEY PRIORITIES:
Drive continuous improvement strategy for finance to modernize how financial data information is used in a dynamic setting for business decision making
Simplify the current reporting processes to leverage more technology.
Identify opportunities to utilize existing and new data sources to identify relevant trends and propose actionable recommendations
Prioritize key reports and analysis that are essential to driving insight for profitable growth
Develop dashboards and reports that offer new insights and track metrics relevant to business performance
Work with Technology team to rapidly scale, modernize and automate reporting tools
extract from big data the meaningful trend, and propose actionable recommendations
Support user training and promote use of data and adoption of
Build a backlog of new reports and dashboards to accelerate manual reporting activities, or provide necessary data to key business decision makers

Implementation of Digital Technologies and Business Processes
Collaborate with Technology, Global and Regional Finance, Sales, Supply Chain, HR and external implementation partners to ensure a globally aligned and efficient continuous improvement of finance performance management needs
Liaise and translate the regional McCain team’s requirements and expectations

Business partnership
Strategic financial partner to Commercial, Marketing, Manufacturing, Agriculture functions
Provide insights about opportunities to maximize revenue, minimize cost and increase operational efficiency to drive the bottom line
Accountable for identifying decisions worth making with data, framing them (including defining metrics and key assumptions), and proposing actionable recommendations

MEASURES OF SUCCESS:
Simplification of the reporting/budgeting processes by leveraging more technology
Implementation and adoption of best practice Finance processes and Digital Technology
Transformation of how we utilize data science and analysis at McCain Foods
Team Engagement (both at corporate level and regional level)

KEY QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCES:
Bachelor’s Degree, CPA (preferred)
5-7 years working with data to drive decision making and strategy; with a demonstrated history of driving transformational change in a large, global organization
Experience in translating data use cases, requirements to Data Science/IT teams and translating results into insights for the business
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Knowledge and expertise in SAP Finance modules and tools and how they integrate with Sales, Procurement, Manufacturing and Logistics processes
Strong awareness of data best practices and what’s possible with rich data
Excellent communication skills and ability to build compelling narratives with data
Experience with requirement analysis (interviewing, facilitation, gap analysis, data analysis, business process mapping, user interface design and mock-up)
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Experience implementing best practice Finance business processes and driving new, innovative internal concepts or products to completion
Effective project management skills
Minimum three years of experience working with Financial Planning, BI and data visualization tools (e.g., OneStream, SAC and Power BI strongly preferred)
Experience in food industry, CPG or manufacturing, ideally in the Finance function

KEY COMPETENCIES:
Collaboration, Champions Change, Drives Results

CANDIDATE PROFILE:
Strategic, results-focused individual who has a love of best practices and data and is someone who embraces change and continuous improvement. This individual has a demonstrated history of driving transformational change in data/digital.

Proven leadership abilities. This individual will be known for their experience in leading a team through transformation change. The candidate will have led a team of peers and/or external suppliers through a high-profile, business-building initiative, demonstrating a persistence and patience that is unwavering in the face of obstacles. Furthermore, the candidate will have demonstrated skills in the delivery of multiple projects concurrently, with the demonstrated ability to prioritize within a changing business environment.

Strategic change skills. The successful candidate will be a leader in bringing fresh ideas and curiosity to drive the use of digital technology and analytics in our business; leading change and innovation in this area. They will be an individual who values diversity of perspective. They will be data-driven, solutions-oriented with a proven ability to synthesize data from multiple sources and to provide actionable insights to the business based on the story the data tells. The successful candidate will demonstrate an entrepreneurial flair and a tendency to thrive in environments with broad flexibility and scope.

Strong collaboration, relationship-building and people development skills. The successful candidate is known for their ability to build strong partnerships with a variety of stakeholders – senior management peers, functional reports, suppliers and customers. They will be able to utilize their working relationships in order to garner new ideas and improve implementation. Must be able to roll up sleeves and get into details as needed.

OTHER INFORMATION

Key internal relationships: Commercial, Marketing, Manufacturing, Agriculture, HR Leaders. Global and regional Finance teams. FLT engagement. Global Technology partners. Global and Regional Data and Analytics leads.
Travel: as required
Job is primarily performed in a standard office environment

The above information indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. We see value in ensuring we have a diverse, antiracist, inclusive, merit-based, and equitable workplace. As a global family-owned company we are proud to reflect the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that diversity drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger.

McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

The health and safety of McCain employees and their families has been our number one priority since the start of COVID-19 pandemic. With vaccination restrictions easing across the globe we do not currently require employees to be vaccinated, but we reserve the right to change this mandate in line with health guidance and regulations in each country.

Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with the Global Privacy Policy

Job Family: Finance
Division: Global Finance
Department: Financial Planning and Analysis
Location(s): CA - Canada : Ontario : Toronto

title: Senior Specialist Talent Solutions Enablement- 12 months contract
job_summary: KPI measurement and data analytics. Gather benchmark data about best-in-class TA practices and KPIs and make recommendations to improve processes and practices.
job_description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our TA team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. We offer meaningful opportunities because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Senior Specialist, Talent Solutions Enablement is responsible for liaising with the Recruitment and Workforce Planning teams to understand CN’s hiring needs and provide recruitment solutions and strategies. The role tracks and reports talent acquisition Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in order to provide recommendations in accordance with the results as well as running the backend Applicant Tracking Software (ATS) platform and other technology-driven Talent Acquisition (TA) solutions.

Main Responsibilities
Tracks and Reports on TA KPIs — 50%
Track and report the TA KPIs on a monthly basis to identify top drivers of attraction, retention, and engagement
Provide analysis, insights and recommendations based on the results
Measure the performance and effectiveness of recruitment campaigns and partner sourcing platforms through the use of Google and other analytics tools
Gather benchmark data about best-in-class TA practices and KPIs and make recommendations to improve processes and practices

Enables Talent Solutions – 50%
Work with Human Resources (HR) to manage the ATS platform and be the TA team’s super user and support the team by resolving administrative backend issues
Identify and support the implementation of TA technology solutions
Working Conditions
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday with the possibility of afterhours work during important projects or TA enhancements. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress. The role requires minimal travel (approximately 5%).

Requirements
Experience
Human Resources
Minimum 7 years of combined experience in a similar role with:
Systems integration and management
KPI measurement and data analytics
Experience in data visualization
Employer marketing campaign measurement
Education/Certification/Designation
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Human Resources, Marketing or a related field

About CN
As a leading North American transportation and logistics company, CN is a true backbone of the economy. With a team of approximately 25,000 railroaders, our focus is on moving both our company and the economy forward. We transport US$200 billion worth of goods annually for a wide range of business sectors from resource to manufactured products to consumer goods, across a 20,000-mile network spanning Canada and mid-America. CN is the only Canadian company listed in the Transportation and Transportation Infrastructure sector of the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI). Launched in 1999, the DJSI World represents the gold standard for corporate sustainability. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Business Analyst
job_summary: Familiarity with data visualization tools like Power BI, or similar platforms. Utilize data insights to drive process improvements and training initiatives for…
job_description:
Are you interested in helping Manitobans get connected to the province’s leading Internet Service Provider? You can help people become more connected than ever with Valley Fiber Ltd. Valley Fiber Ltd is a full-service company offering dedicated fiber optic internet, TV, and digital phone for people across the province. We’re growing fast, and we’re looking for talented people join us! We are seeking out a full-time Business Analyst to join our team at Valley Fiber.

Reports To
The Business Analyst will report directly to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing.

Job Overview
The Business Analyst is responsible for a strong focus on customer retention and acquisition through the collection and analysis of relevant datasets to drive sales performance, provide insights into lowered Cost per Gross Addition (CPGA) and improved Average Revenue per User (ARPU) across various lines of business. In addition, the role will be responsible to collect and analyze data regarding our Call Centre performance.

What We Offer :
Comprehensive benefits packageStaff discounts on internet service and at select local businessesOpportunities for professional development, increased responsibility, and
advancement
Opportunities to work on big projects that have a lasting impact on the
daily life of Manitobans

What You'll Do:1. Sales Data Analysis:
Collect, clean, and analyze sales data by product and channel to gain insights into sales performance. Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to optimize sales strategies and drive revenue growth. Collaborate with sales teams to develop data-driven strategies for enhancing sales effectiveness and expanding market reach.

2. CPGA and ARPU Improvement:
Analyze data to understand the company's CPGA and ARPU across multiple lines of business and products/services. Identify factors influencing these metrics and develop strategies to improve them. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, marketing, and product management, to develop initiatives that optimize CPGA and ARPU while maintaining or enhancing customer acquisition and retention rates.

3. Call Centre Performance Enhancement:
Analyze Call Centre performance metrics, including Call Handling, Help Desk Tickets (including ticket accuracy and systems notation), and Net Promoter Score (NPS). Identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance customer support experiences, reduce ticket resolution time, and increase customer satisfaction. Utilize data insights to drive process improvements and training initiatives for Call Centre agents.

4. Customer Retention and Acquisition:
Use data analysis to understand customer behaviors, preferences, and churn patterns. Collaborate with the Customer Care and marketing team to develop strategies that improve customer retention and acquisition. Leverage data insights to enhance customer experiences, develop targeted marketing campaigns, and optimize customer lifecycle management.

5. Performance Monitoring:
Design and implement tracking mechanisms to monitor the effectiveness of sales, CPGA, ARPU, and Call Centre improvement strategies. Develop or manage dashboards and reports to provide regular updates on performance metrics to key stakeholders. Present findings and recommendations to senior management and relevant teams.

6. Insights and Recommendations:
Translate complex data analyses into actionable insights and recommendations for optimizing sales performance, CPGA, ARPU, and Call Centre operations. Collaborate with business stakeholders to develop and implement data-driven strategies and initiatives aligned with the company's goals and objectives.

What You Bring:
Bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, business analytics, or a related field. A master's degree or higher is preferred.Proven experience working as a Business Analyst, Data Scientist, or a similar role in the telecommunications industry.Strong proficiency in data analysis and statistical modeling using tools such as Python, R, or SQL.Familiarity with data visualization tools like Power BI, or similar platforms.Solid understanding of telecommunications metrics, KPIs, and industry-specific challenges.Experience with predictive modeling, machine learning algorithms, and forecasting techniques.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey findings and recommendations to diverse stakeholders.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Working Conditions:
Ability to work on internal systems for extended periods of time.
If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive customer retention and acquisition strategies in the telecommunications industry, we would love to hear from you. Apply today and help shape the future of our company.

Working out of our Winnipeg offices with periodic working sessions in Winkler, this role offers a unique opportunity to join a dynamic, customer-focused organization. Founded in Winkler, Manitoba Valley Fiber has rapidly expanded our footprint, serving residents and commercial accounts across rural Manitoba. The organization is backed by DIF Capital Partners, a global infrastructure firm deeply rooted in Europe, the US and Canada.

As a key part of our creative and dynamic team, you will have the opportunity to shape the direction of the department and contribute to the success of Valley Fiber as a sales, marketing, and call center operations leader.

If you have a solid background in data analysis, business strategy, and telecommunications, along with a passion for customer-centric decision-making, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and make a significant impact on Valley Fiber's growth and success.

We thank all applicants who apply, however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. Please submit your resume to hr@valleyfiber.ca.

Valley Fiber does not discriminate against individuals who have a disability or based on their culture, nationality, ethnicity, gender, or religion. Valley Fiber strongly encourages individuals from minority-groups to apply and is willing to reasonably accommodate where possible.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - AI Chatbot IT Company
job_summary: A data-science problem that has not been solved yet. Someone who excels with both front and back-end programming, all in Typescript.
job_description:
This is the leading open-source chatbot stack, allowing developers to build better chatbots without a team of data scientists and machine learning experts. First released in 2017, the platform includes a unique managed NLU engine, an integrated development and visual conversational design environment, flexible integrations, and extensive options for customization.

Developers love the product and has more than 9500 Github stars and 100,000 users. The company is privately held and headquartered in Quebec, and recently closed a series A funding, led by Decibel.

Role:
We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Senior Developer to join our Engineering team. Someone who excels with both front and back-end programming, all in Typescript. The Senior Full Stack Developer is responsible for developing and designing front-end web architecture, along with scalable backend code, on his own, from Day-1.

As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will both jump in current initiatives, and will lead a project from conception to final product, requiring excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Full autonomy and creativity are super important in our team. You will be expected to solve challenging problems on your own. It sounds rough - but that’s how we succeed.

Title: Senior Fullstack Developer
Address: Rue Sainte-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3B 1H9 or Boul. Charest Quest, Suite 200, Québec (Québec) G1N 2J7. Hybrid working situation 2-3 days in office.
Type: Full time and permanent
Salary: Open to discussion + Benefits + 3 weeks vacation + 2 weeks off during Holidays + stock options

Key responsibilities:
Own the products and understand the requirements to ensure fast and accurate development of new or better featuresWrite unit and end-to-end tests for mission-critical featuresClean up technical dept while keeping a forefront viewGet in touch with the community and come up with new ideas to make the Botpress products a successBuild tools, write code, and contribute to product development to resolve all issuesContribute to product documentation
Qualifications and Education Requirements

A minimum of 5+ years of professional experience in software development or programming in a similar environment
5+ years of professional experience with: Typescript, React.js, Node, PostgreSQL, RedisStrong written and verbal communication skills in English (French is an asset)A confirmed interest and experience in Conversational AI, voice- and chat-based user experiencesWell-organized, excellent work ethic, pays attention to detail, and self-startingAbility to thrive in a fast-paced startup and passionate about improving technical abilities
Benefits

You will join a team of ambitious individuals passionate about speed of execution, data-driven decisions, and, obviously, chatbots.
You will contribute to the growth of one of the most popular AI chatbot dev tool in the world.Top-tier health benefits and access to telemedicine for you and your family.Flexibility to work remotely.3 weeks vacation per year + 2 weeks off for Christmas and New Year.Competitive compensation, because that matters as well.All kinds of other little perks ;)
Why join?

Apart from joining an awesome team of talented, fast-moving, and cutting edge developers, you’ll be working with/on:

A popular open-source project built for developersA modern stack used by hundreds of thousands of developersA product used by startups, schools, nonprofits, and Fortune 500 companiesA backend runtime built for performance and deployment simplicityA frontend application that devs like just as much as VS CodeA machine learning pipeline that evolves every single weekA data-science problem that has not been solved yetA cloud infrastructure that serves billions of API callsA developer community with thousands of membersA workplace that is distributed and remote-firstA group of like-minded investors and advisors that has funded, built and scaled similar companies such as Elastic, Mongo, Snyk, Influx, Algolia, Twilio, and Databricks.

title: Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations
job_summary: Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data.
job_description:
: 1260941

Who we are
We, at Staples Professional, provide our business customers with a deep professional expertise when it comes to Business Essentials, Furniture, Facilities, Technology, Print/Promo, and Pack and Ship, as well as next-day delivery service and customized solutions for ordering, billing and reporting. We are part of the Staples umbrella in Canada, and as such we are a true multi-channel solution provider – online, at our customers place of business and in-store, for all our customers needs. We are looking for people who are curious, passionate and put the customer first.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team
Staples Professional is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
Reporting to the Sr. Director, Sales Operations and Customer Service, the Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations will develop and execute the strategy, priorities, and direction of our recently formed team. Lead the design and execution of best-in-class dashboards and scorecards to bring on-time, accurate visibility across all team in Staples Professional.

Supporting multiple functions, (sales, customer service, marketing, supply chain & senior leadership), in Staples Professional and across Staples Canada, the candidate will enable data-driven decision making which will be used to answer key relevant questions about business performance, drive sales growth, expand lines of business and improve profitability across small to enterprise-sized accounts. The individual will be a hands-on leader, working with their teams to visualize data which will tell compelling stories, creating a bias for action. They will lead BI, Data Governance and CRM projects, in support of analytics- and CRM-product roadmaps.

We are on a Next-Generation Sales and Customer Service 3-year journey where new technology and processes, powered by AI/ML, will accelerate our go-to market strategy, and supercharge our B2B customer experience. This is a highly visible role that requires being able to link analytics to business implications to form actionable, high-impact recommendations that drive revenue growth & reduce seller friction. A strong understanding of a sales-led SaaS model - both motions and metrics - is key.

To be their authentic self each day, they thrive on leading change, collaborating across teams, inspiring people, are highly motivated and are a die-hard for analytics. The work environment is ever-changing, and agile so the ideal candidate would demonstrate resiliency, prioritization, and be passionate about the customer experience.

Specifically, You Will:
BI Intelligence & Data Governance - 60%
Sales Operations - 40%

Develop short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic, business performance and operational objectives; Building and maintaining scorecards, dashboards that can be leveraged across Staples Professional and Staples Canada.
Partner with key stakeholders to address their unique needs to drive performance and support exploring ‘how-to’ best utilize data to achieve outcomes; selection of the right KPIs for new initiatives and storytelling of the data after launch
Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data. Key partners include Finance, Data Science, IT, and Sales Leadership.
Working with the Data Science team, leverage unified 360 view of customers to deliver customer health reporting, insights, and drive a customer data narrative across all aspects of Staples Professional
Leverage the relationship with technology and SaaS vendors to bring thought-leaders and best- practice into Staples Professional
Collaborate with the CRM Centre of Excellence, IT, 3rd party Integrators and software vendors to lead, develop and design the SFDC, sales ops and other sales enablement tools roadmap.
Facilitate alignment and collaboration across sales, pricing, sales enablement, and marketing, to directly affect Staples Professional’s revenue and customer experience.
Responsible for technical activities, enablement and user adoption associated with Staples Professional’s day-to-day sales & service tools: SFDC, HighSpot etc. Measure, monitor and improve tool utilization.
Build-out automated process flows and seller motions to maximize revenue and penetration potential of markets (white space, adjacent products, new business)

Leadership
Motivate, mentor, and ensure your direct team has the right tools, processes, and principles in place to deliver work that is on time and to support partner needsLead a continuous learning environment with respect to utilizing the latest methodologies, technologies, and illustrative best practices to tell stories which can drive business decisionsDevelop a community where associates are energized, with an ownership mindset, that enable each other to be better every day, and extend that support across all teams.
Some of what you need:
Post-secondary degree/diploma or the equivalent relevant working experienceBachelor degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science or similar fields5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, CRM product ownership, reporting, analytics or data managementPowerful business acumen, with ability to put data in the context of a customer problem and know where to look for answers that go beyond the data.Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.).Expert oral and written communication skills; senior executive to sales manager levelProficient in SQL and experience with big data sets in a cloud environmentExperience with MS Office (Excel and Power point)Proven skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, communication and decision-makingDeep understanding of customer success principles, approaches and considerations with ability to share this understanding with othersFlexibility to adjust and thrive in an environment with changing requirements, schedules and priorities for multiple projects or assignments.Quickly learn, synthesize and simplify information for other's consumptionWork on multiple, simultaneous programs that require both strategic thinking as well as high-speed tactical executionStrong Business to business (B2B) knowledge an asset

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_summary: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights. Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams.
job_description:
Purpose

Drive the implementation of the new BI framework and governance policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
Strategy: Support & Deliver

Governance

Maintain VGW reporting taxonomy, by updating and classifying as necessary
Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams
Creates new reports and retrofits existing reports as part of the rollout strategy of BI related products to the new state
Follow and promote the adoption of the governance framework for VGW's Data Catalog to ensure policies, standards and definitions are followed with peer Analysts across the organisation
Become an advocate of Alation across the organisation & lead discussions
Create & review supporting documentation (Articles & Wikis) that support the rollout and adoption of the new BI framework across the organisation

Reporting

Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework & governance
Apply the new report tooling framework when developing new reports, dashboards and self-service BI tools
Review data sources & queries to determine if it is accurate or relevant for the development of VGW's Data Catalog and Business Data Dictionary
Collaborate with the Data Management team to maintain and improve the performance of data sources used as part of BI products.
Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of scalable and reliable analytical products, dashboards, and metrics that drive VGW crucial business decisions
Provide ad-hoc support on data collection, analysis and reporting

Stakeholder Management and Team Collaboration:
Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve
Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW's Data Catalog & BI's new processes and procedures.
Summarise queries and concerns from external teams in relation to the rollout of BI's framework
Can run requirement sessions with a product or data team to discuss relevant requirements and best solutions
Can work autonomously on program components and ad-hoc analytics work, is capable of problem-solving issues that are encountered, however, understands to when to escalate blockers.
Builds and maintains positive relationships with stakeholders, and proactively identifies and addresses any issues or concerns they may have.
Clearly articulates and communicates insights to stakeholders.

Learning & Development:
Mentor and provide support to associates BI in best practices and technical optimisation
Support the execution of L&D programs for BI-related tooling (Data Catalog & Tableau) and proficient SQL skills
Work with direct reports to build comprehensive personal learning and development plans to deepen technical or social tracks and broaden skill sets on underdeveloped areas that will add value to VGW and enable career progression
Encourage diverse opinions and problem-solving from a variety of sources that differ from your personal context and background
Provide broad growth impact, through internal skill shares, public user groups, blog posts or similar.

Qualifications, skills & experience:
A Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Data Science or Artificial Intelligence.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to create and review queries.
Business acumen

job_summary: Communicate complex data findings and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Oversee the creation and maintenance of documentation for models and…
job_description:
Requisition ID: 180969

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job

We are seeking a highly analytical and skilled Senior Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background leading and managing a team of Data Scientists completing data analysis, statistical modelling, and machine learning. The Senior Manager will be responsible for leading the design, enhancements, and implementations of data-driven solutions supporting the Bank's AML/ATF Client Risk Rating models.

This role contributes to the overall success of Global Compliance’s AML/ATF team by analyzing and improving Client Risk Rating models thereby enhancing operating efficiency and is conducted in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

Key Job Accountabilities

Lead and manage a team applying a range of modeling techniques from basic statistical models to AI and Machine Learning, to develop, maintain and implement models for client risk rating case generation in support of Scotiabank’s AML/ATF program
Oversee the creation and maintenance of documentation for models and for the results data analysis
Collaborate and coordinate with project teams and teams from model validation, internal audit, and external audit to ensure that models meet all legal and regulatory requirements
Communicate complex data findings and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Lead the communication with first and second lines of business and other stakeholders, and recommending changes to AML/ATF client risk rating models as appropriate
Lead the communication with model users to ensure that model limitations are properly understood, and that models meet model governance/usage requirements

Skills, Experiences and Functional Competencies

Experience leading a team of Data Scientists, having statistical modeling and data science methods; programming in Python (familiarity working with popular libraries for data science, machine learning, and visualization: such as Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn, ggplot2), querying using SQL or any SQL-like language is preferred, experience with Apache Spark is beneficial
Experience with databases such as Oracle or SQL Server, as well as big data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, or other distributed computing frameworks
Experience with cloud-based infrastructure and tools, (specifically GCP) and either Linux and/or BitBucket is beneficial
Nice to have experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch
Excellent communication (both oral and written) and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a hybrid team environment

Education and Other Requirements

Master’s degree or higher within STEAM, (science, technology, engineering, analytics, or mathematics), statistics, data science, artificial intelligence, computer science, computer engineering, financial modelling or related
Fluency in both English and Spanish is preferred

title: Senior Staff Software Engineer, Machine Learning
job_summary: By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as…
job_description:
At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.

Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:
You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there.
You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0.
You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.
You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.
You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.
You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone.

The Coinbase Machine Learning team is committed to developing sophisticated ML models that make our platform more secure, expand usage of Coinbase through personalized recommendations, and improve the user experience for our customers. Our Mission is to keep building scalable, adaptive, blockchain aware ML systems that enable Coinbase to effectively manage risk for its products and continue to build trust and engagement with its users.

What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):
Upscale our ML models starting with our Recommendation Platform, but expanding the scope to other ML use cases
Guide the output of a team of 5-15 other ML Engineers
Work directly with product partners to identify and solve new use cases for the ML on blockchain.

What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):
MS in Machine Learning (PhD preferred)
10+ years of experience (or PhD+7)
Expert in latest ML techniques (e.g. supervised and unsupervised learning, deep neural nets, reinforcement learning, transformers)
Expert in coding on ML platforms (e.g. Tensorflow, pytorch)
Capable of architecting and owning foundational and reusable ML blocks that can accelerate the rest of the team.

Nice to Have:
Preferred: Domain expertise in RecSys (recommendation systems)

Job #: GML07NA

title: Staff / Senior Machine Learning/Data Engineer
job_summary: Develop data models, ETL workflows, and data quality checks to ensure data accuracy and consistency. Design, build, and maintain scalable and efficient data…
job_description:
The Opportunity

Do you want to just build software, or do you want to build software that helps people improve their lives? Viamo is a mission-driven organization and communication platform that is supporting people in geographies with minimal access to the Internet (take a look at some examples of our impact here (https://viamo.io/case-studies/)). With everything that has happened in the past few years, many of us have reconsidered what we want to do with our lives and how we can make a meaningful impact. Viamo is a place where you can work with talented, driven, and thoughtful people to improve the world for the better. If that sounds intriguing, please read on…

We are looking for a passionate and experienced Staff / Senior ML/Data Engineer to design and develop high-quality, modern data-driven solutions to fulfill our mission. You will be building software that is currently used in 40+ countries (primarily across Asia, Africa, and the Caribbean) to give connectivity to people with limited technology. You will be part of a team that is building, scaling, and maintaining Viamo's products including our large-scale web application and communication platform that processes 4 million+ interactions a day and positively impacts millions of lives. In the years ahead, we are aiming to scale our platform strategy to go beyond sharing information: connecting 100 million active users to vital services and many of the benefits of the digital economy.

All our users need is a simple mobile phone and a mobile connection to get access to vital information and services. Through channels such as text messaging and Interactive Voice Response (as well as internet-based channels such as Facebook Messenger and WhatsApp), end-users who are farmers, expectant mothers, small business owners, and others can get access to life-changing information. Throughout the COVID pandemic, Viamo's platform was key to efforts in many countries to get public health information out to hard-to-reach populations.

We are looking for a Staff or Senior-level Machine Learning/Data Engineer who has been doing ML-focused development for 8+ years with backend development experience. Ideally, has formal training in Computer Science or Software Engineering. Specifically, we are looking for an Engineer to help us design, build, and maintain scalable Machine Learning solutions that optimize our user's experience on our platform. Experience with recommender systems and personalization engines would be a huge asset.

The successful candidate will have experience with large-scale distributed systems and ML technologies coupled with a solid understanding of database and data analytics. It would be an advantage, although not a prerequisite, to have experience in some or all of our key tech stack components, including:

MySQL
BigQuery
Google Data Studio
PHP / Laravel

(The list above represents the key ones - we use many other technologies, including AWS, Docker, Ansible, Jenkins, BitBucket, etc.)

We are new to the world of Machine Learning, so we would expect you to help advise us on some of the tools and frameworks to use.

Strong written and verbal communication skills are a prerequisite, as we are a very team-oriented company working remotely with colleagues across the world, so clear communication is central to our success. We appreciate people who balance thinking long-term and pursuing technical excellence and are focused on delivering value to users. We are experienced Agile / Scrum practitioners and we operate in multi-disciplinary product crews towards shared success. If you are an independent, self-starting, and quality-minded developer with top-notch communication and analytical skills, we would like to talk to you.

About Viamo

At Viamo, we envision a world where all people have access to the information they need to make decisions for healthy, prosperous lives, and have meaningful relationships with governments, civil society, and businesses.

With more than 300 team members spread across 25 countries, and serving projects in more than 40 countries, we truly work on a global scale to catalyze a mobile tech movement. We are connecting nonprofits, governments, and businesses to the people they serve using the digital technologies they already have in their pockets (voice calls, interactive SMS, and social network chatbots). The majority of our Engineering team is based in Canada, but we have team members all over the world.

At Viamo, we value Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion. We know that diverse perspectives and experiences make our products, services, and teams stronger.

Did you know?

HR research shows that men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, but women and other under-represented people often apply only if they feel they check 100% of the requirements. We would love to see your application even if you don't feel you hit every point below. If you think this role looks like something you want to do and could grow into - we are excited to see your application!

Key Responsibilities

As a Staff / Senior ML/ Data Engineer, your responsibilities include:

Design, build, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines and data infrastructure to support data processing and analytics requirements.
Architect and develop reliable technical backend/data solutions optimized for efficiency, performance, and scalability.
Develop data models, ETL workflows, and data quality checks to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Ensure data security and privacy are maintained across all data processing and storage systems.
Design, implement, test, and maintain scalable ML models

What's in it for you?

A chance to do work that is genuinely meaningful with peers who are talented, driven, and thoughtful
Fully remote role - work from anywhere you have an internet connection and can be productive
Flexible work schedule
Unlimited vacation
Health benefits plan
Continuous learning opportunities and support for professional development.

About you

Desired experience:
Experience with ML technologies and languages, preferably including recommendation engines, NLP, etc
Scalable, Back-end development experience (we process 1M calls per day)
Have designed, built, and maintained scalable data pipelines and data infrastructure
Have a deep understanding of database and data analytics technologies.
Ideally, you have experience with recommendation or prediction engines, as our near-term work includes optimizing our User Experience through deep analytics and Machine Learning.
Ability to balance speed and quality - based on the task at hand, you strike a balance between working efficiently and writing quality code.
Proactive and continuous communication - Given a problem, you collaborate with others and keep everyone in the loop along the way.
Being open to thinking differently - Some designs need to be constrained within technical and/or architectural boundaries and other times designs need outside-the-box thinking! As a Senior Engineer, you are able to understand what a given situation calls for and support designs on both ends of this spectrum.
In terms of specific technologies, we would expect you to have experience in most of the following (we have indicated our expectations of your skill level in each as one of the following: F- Familiar / I - Intermediate / E- Expert):
Python / sci-kit-learn / Pandas (E)
SQL (E)
BigQuery, Google Data Studio, GCP (F)
Tensor flow and/or PyTorch (F)
SW End techniques (CI/test driven development/etc) (I)

Technical areas and tools that are “Nice to have”:
PHP / Laravel
ChatGPT or other Generative AI / Large Language Model technologies

Viamo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and encourage applications from all candidates. We believe that diverse perspectives help our teams to create innovative solutions and understand our global clients' needs. In alignment with our values, we are committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse global workforce without discrimination.

Apply now with a CV and a short cover letter. We're excited to work with you on this mission ahead.

title: Director of Go-To-Market Analytics, Revenue Operations GTM Insights & Analytics
job_summary: Deep expertise in statistical analysis, data analytics, & modelling for actionable business insights from complex data sets.
job_description:
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 240+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

We are a fast-growing global company with 20 years of continuous growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,100 networks and 3,000+ cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.

A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary

As a member of the Go-To-Market (GTM) Insights & Analytics (IA) leadership team, the role holder is responsible for ensuring the quality, integrity, & availability of data analysis & modelling related to EQIX’s go-to-market strategies. Reporting directly to the Senior Director (Global Head) of Revenue Operations (RevOps) GTM IA, you will lead & guide the GTM Analytics team’s robust analytical collaborations across RevOps & the Customer & Revenue Office, & leverage data-driven approaches to shape effective GTM strategies for sales, marketing, customer care, experience, success, & commercial operations, evaluating & providing actionable insights, driving consistent segmentation & targeting, and utilising predictive/prescriptive data science that empowers data-driven decisions driving predictable revenue acceleration through optimised customer experiences.

Responsibilities

Oversee & guide the full range of GTM Analytics & best practices

Oversee & guide RevOps GTM analytics, leading a team of analytics professionals & leveraging industry best practices & advanced statistical analytical techniques, predictive & prescriptive AI/ML & technologies to analyse complex datasets, derive actionable insights, & shape effective segmentation, targeting, optimised customer experiences & revenue-accelerating GTM strategies.

Develop & execute a comprehensive analytics strategy aligned with company objectives

Develop a comprehensive GTM analytical plan & roadmap by understanding company objectives, goals, & GTM priorities, identifying areas for analytics, engaging stakeholders, & defining measurable KPIs.

Evaluate data availability & quality, & identify suitable sources, systems, tools, & analytics techniques for reliable analysis, visualisation, forecasting, & decision-making.

Establish operational infrastructure/architecture with the DataOps team & build a skilled analytics team to execute data-driven approaches, plans & roadmap.

Establish & maintain strong analytical interlocks with relevant stakeholders

Collaborate & position the team as the analytical point of contact with cross-functional RevOps & the Customer & Revenue Office priority stakeholders to gather input, align objectives, facilitate the adoption of interoperable practices & ensure consistent delivery of analytical GTM value.

Effectively & regularly communicate insights, recommendations, analytical findings, outcomes & value generated from analytics initiatives (with scale) to internal stakeholders, leadership & external partners.

Continuously monitor the performance of GTM analytics initiatives & evaluate their effectiveness, soliciting feedback to refine & iterate the GTM analytics strategy as needed.

Provide actionable insights, & empower data-driven decisions

Leverage appropriate analytical techniques & tools to conduct thorough data analysis, extracting actionable insights that inform GTM decision-making by uncovering, visualising, & presenting trends, patterns, correlations, probabilities & forecasts in clear and compelling reports, dashboards, and data visualisations that enable stakeholders to make informed decisions to shape effective GTM strategies.

Lead & manage a diverse team of analytics professionals, fostering innovation & continuous improvement

Manage GTM Analytics teams' performance through motivation, engagement, & coaching.

Drive people development strategy, including location-based & hybrid-virtual initiatives.

Provide transformational leadership & guidance for escalations & interlocks to other stakeholders.

Establish GTM Analytics processes based on industry best practices for EQIX's best-in-class approach.

Model Equinix cultures & values.

Provide guidance, mentorship, & development opportunities to enhance teams' skills & capabilities.

Qualifications

Substantial experience overseeing data analytics, modelling, insights generation, team leadership, & shaping data-driven GTM strategies.

Deep expertise in statistical analysis, data analytics, & modelling for actionable business insights from complex data sets.

Proven track record in leading & managing high-performing teams, fostering collaboration, & providing mentorship & professional development.

Familiarity with advanced analytics, predictive & prescriptive AI/ML & technologies to optimise GTM strategies & customer experiences.

Effective stakeholder management & communication skills to engage cross-functional teams, senior leadership, & external partners.

Knowledge of RevOps &/or Customer & Revenue Office, including GTM segmentation, sales, marketing, customer care/success & commercial ops.

Committed to continuous improvement by staying updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, best practices in analytics, & embracing open-source transformation.

Preferred: Bachelor's degree in a related field (Data Analytics, Data Science, Business Analytics/Administration, Economics/Econometrics, Computer Science, IT, or similar). Optional: Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) or Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIP) certification.

Experience with Excel, SAS, SPSS, Python, R, ANOVA, MATLAB, Tableau, ESRI, Power Bi, Salesforce, Clari, AI/ML tooling & scripting.

Skills and Attributes

Enthusiastic collaborator, skilled in developing GTM analytics capabilities & rigour.

Prioritises strategic requirements & impacts in alignment with stakeholders.

Strong technical skills & a passion for optimising & automating.

Exceptional communication skills, specialising in data-driven storytelling & visualisation with a focus on predictive & prescriptive analytics.

Transformational leader driving bold & scalable change in GTM analytics.

Global mindset, excelling in matrixed & consensus-driven environments.

Cultivates innovation, embraces risk-taking, & learns from failure as a growth opportunity in GTM analytics.

Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Machine Learning Geoscientist
job_summary: Study and transform data science prototypes for the geoscience specific data streams. Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods.
job_description:
The Role

MinePortal from DataCloud is the groundbreaking cloud-based intelligent platform that powers geotechnical knowhow of the rock in the mining industry for operational intelligence. Our mission is to push the envelope in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Geophysical IoT sensors, Machine Learning (ML), Data Management, Signal Processing, and Grade Engineering, in order to provide the best-possible blast outcomes for our customers. We are looking for a Geology, Statistics, and ML Specialist to help build industry-leading modeling technologies that the world’s largest mines will adopt.

Key Responsibilities

Reporting to the VP Software, the Machine Learning Geoscientist role will include following broad responsibilities and any other assigned work from time to time



Apply domain expertise in the development and implementation of machine learning models within the hard rock and coal mining industry



Teach internal and client teams how to integrate machine learning software into existing workflows to optimize blast design, blasthole spacing, and other engineering applications



Study and transform data science prototypes for the geoscience specific data streams



Feature extraction and identification over large data sets to feed automated algorithm development



Apply knowledge in geology, geosciences, applied mathematics, and quantitative analysis to sensor solutions for challenges facing our sponsors.



Explore promising research and maintain/gain the technical edge required for projects. Share and develop new approaches and methods.



Design machine learning systems that can automatically recognize features, extract features, and create volume models out int and sparse data



Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools for mining domain specific applications



Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods



Run machine learning tests and experiments



Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results



Train and retrain systems when necessary



Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks



Keep abreast of developments in the field



Contribute to analysis of algorithmic computational complexity and memory requirements.



Work with Hardware Engineers to specify and optimize sensor and IoT device design and configuration for multiple sensing use cases.



Interface closely with Application and UX Engineers to develop compelling analytical use cases to utilize ML outputs and insights.

Key Qualifications



Master’s degree in Geosciences, statistics, mathematics, applied physics, or a related field.



Comprehensive expert level knowledge of programming and experience in C, C++, Python, R, Golang, or similar language used in geo-stat, ML, and computer vision sciences.



Proficient verbal and written communication skills necessary to effectively collaborate in a team environment and present and explain technical information.



Experience in working in distributed teams in the research, development, and implementation of machine learning, spatial modeling, and geo-stat algorithms.



Takes initiative, independent worker



Ability to manage multiple concurrent major projects with different tactical and strategic objectives



Can effectively assume an array of roles as appropriate in various kinds of organizations. These may entail different responsibilities, forms of leadership, team work, and project management.



Experience leading in environments that are highly volatile, cross-functional, and cross-organizational

Work Hours & Location



Full time, Flexible working hours, 15 days/year vacation



Work from home office and DataCloud’s office in Vancouver



Some travel to Seattle, Palo Alto, and Client offices world wide

DataCloud is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law. The Candidate must be authorized to work in Canada.

About DataCloud

Founded in 2016, DataCloud delivers high-resolution rock mass characterization data to our clients in real-time. Our innovative measurement and analysis platform provides invaluable orebody insights during drill and blast operations. Our technologies help mine planning teams to dramatically improve their extraction efficiencies.

With our unique combination of skills in both mining and technology, DataCloud is helping to solve many of the problems that have challenged the mining industry for decades. Our founders come from institutions such as Stanford, UC-Berkeley and Cambridge, who have expertise in geosciences and cloud architecture.

Our portfolio of products and services span the latest in Geo-Statistics, Geo-Physics, and advanced digital and artificial intelligence technologies, including cloud computing, machine learning, advanced visualization, and new sensor technology enabled by IoT systems.
