job_description:
: 1260941

Who we are
We, at Staples Professional, provide our business customers with a deep professional expertise when it comes to Business Essentials, Furniture, Facilities, Technology, Print/Promo, and Pack and Ship, as well as next-day delivery service and customized solutions for ordering, billing and reporting. We are part of the Staples umbrella in Canada, and as such we are a true multi-channel solution provider – online, at our customers place of business and in-store, for all our customers needs. We are looking for people who are curious, passionate and put the customer first.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team
Staples Professional is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
Reporting to the Sr. Director, Sales Operations and Customer Service, the Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations will develop and execute the strategy, priorities, and direction of our recently formed team. Lead the design and execution of best-in-class dashboards and scorecards to bring on-time, accurate visibility across all team in Staples Professional.

Supporting multiple functions, (sales, customer service, marketing, supply chain & senior leadership), in Staples Professional and across Staples Canada, the candidate will enable data-driven decision making which will be used to answer key relevant questions about business performance, drive sales growth, expand lines of business and improve profitability across small to enterprise-sized accounts. The individual will be a hands-on leader, working with their teams to visualize data which will tell compelling stories, creating a bias for action. They will lead BI, Data Governance and CRM projects, in support of analytics- and CRM-product roadmaps.

We are on a Next-Generation Sales and Customer Service 3-year journey where new technology and processes, powered by AI/ML, will accelerate our go-to market strategy, and supercharge our B2B customer experience. This is a highly visible role that requires being able to link analytics to business implications to form actionable, high-impact recommendations that drive revenue growth & reduce seller friction. A strong understanding of a sales-led SaaS model - both motions and metrics - is key.

To be their authentic self each day, they thrive on leading change, collaborating across teams, inspiring people, are highly motivated and are a die-hard for analytics. The work environment is ever-changing, and agile so the ideal candidate would demonstrate resiliency, prioritization, and be passionate about the customer experience.

Specifically, You Will:
BI Intelligence & Data Governance - 60%
Sales Operations - 40%

Develop short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic, business performance and operational objectives; Building and maintaining scorecards, dashboards that can be leveraged across Staples Professional and Staples Canada.
Partner with key stakeholders to address their unique needs to drive performance and support exploring ‘how-to’ best utilize data to achieve outcomes; selection of the right KPIs for new initiatives and storytelling of the data after launch
Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data. Key partners include Finance, Data Science, IT, and Sales Leadership.
Working with the Data Science team, leverage unified 360 view of customers to deliver customer health reporting, insights, and drive a customer data narrative across all aspects of Staples Professional
Leverage the relationship with technology and SaaS vendors to bring thought-leaders and best- practice into Staples Professional
Collaborate with the CRM Centre of Excellence, IT, 3rd party Integrators and software vendors to lead, develop and design the SFDC, sales ops and other sales enablement tools roadmap.
Facilitate alignment and collaboration across sales, pricing, sales enablement, and marketing, to directly affect Staples Professional’s revenue and customer experience.
Responsible for technical activities, enablement and user adoption associated with Staples Professional’s day-to-day sales & service tools: SFDC, HighSpot etc. Measure, monitor and improve tool utilization.
Build-out automated process flows and seller motions to maximize revenue and penetration potential of markets (white space, adjacent products, new business)

Leadership
Motivate, mentor, and ensure your direct team has the right tools, processes, and principles in place to deliver work that is on time and to support partner needsLead a continuous learning environment with respect to utilizing the latest methodologies, technologies, and illustrative best practices to tell stories which can drive business decisionsDevelop a community where associates are energized, with an ownership mindset, that enable each other to be better every day, and extend that support across all teams.
Some of what you need:
Post-secondary degree/diploma or the equivalent relevant working experienceBachelor degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science or similar fields5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, CRM product ownership, reporting, analytics or data managementPowerful business acumen, with ability to put data in the context of a customer problem and know where to look for answers that go beyond the data.Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.).Expert oral and written communication skills; senior executive to sales manager levelProficient in SQL and experience with big data sets in a cloud environmentExperience with MS Office (Excel and Power point)Proven skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, communication and decision-makingDeep understanding of customer success principles, approaches and considerations with ability to share this understanding with othersFlexibility to adjust and thrive in an environment with changing requirements, schedules and priorities for multiple projects or assignments.Quickly learn, synthesize and simplify information for other's consumptionWork on multiple, simultaneous programs that require both strategic thinking as well as high-speed tactical executionStrong Business to business (B2B) knowledge an asset

Associate discountHealth and Dental benefitsRRSP/DPSPPerformance bonusesLearning & Development programsAnd more...

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_summary: Purpose Drive the implementation of the new BI framework and governance policies and procedures. Responsibilities: Strategy: Support & Deliver Governance…
job_description:
Purpose

Drive the implementation of the new BI framework and governance policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
Strategy: Support & Deliver

Governance

Maintain VGW reporting taxonomy, by updating and classifying as necessary
Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams
Creates new reports and retrofits existing reports as part of the rollout strategy of BI related products to the new state
Follow and promote the adoption of the governance framework for VGW's Data Catalog to ensure policies, standards and definitions are followed with peer Analysts across the organisation
Become an advocate of Alation across the organisation & lead discussions
Create & review supporting documentation (Articles & Wikis) that support the rollout and adoption of the new BI framework across the organisation

Reporting

Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework & governance
Apply the new report tooling framework when developing new reports, dashboards and self-service BI tools
Review data sources & queries to determine if it is accurate or relevant for the development of VGW's Data Catalog and Business Data Dictionary
Collaborate with the Data Management team to maintain and improve the performance of data sources used as part of BI products.
Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of scalable and reliable analytical products, dashboards, and metrics that drive VGW crucial business decisions
Provide ad-hoc support on data collection, analysis and reporting

Stakeholder Management and Team Collaboration:
Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve
Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW's Data Catalog & BI's new processes and procedures.
Summarise queries and concerns from external teams in relation to the rollout of BI's framework
Can run requirement sessions with a product or data team to discuss relevant requirements and best solutions
Can work autonomously on program components and ad-hoc analytics work, is capable of problem-solving issues that are encountered, however, understands to when to escalate blockers.
Builds and maintains positive relationships with stakeholders, and proactively identifies and addresses any issues or concerns they may have.
Clearly articulates and communicates insights to stakeholders.

Learning & Development:
Mentor and provide support to associates BI in best practices and technical optimisation
Support the execution of L&D programs for BI-related tooling (Data Catalog & Tableau) and proficient SQL skills
Work with direct reports to build comprehensive personal learning and development plans to deepen technical or social tracks and broaden skill sets on underdeveloped areas that will add value to VGW and enable career progression
Encourage diverse opinions and problem-solving from a variety of sources that differ from your personal context and background
Provide broad growth impact, through internal skill shares, public user groups, blog posts or similar.

Qualifications, skills & experience:
A Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Data Science or Artificial Intelligence.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to create and review queries.
Business acumen
Experience working with BI analysts, data analysts, and/or cross-functional teams.
Problem-solving skills to identify pain points and recurring concerns.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

Personal Competencies:
Delivers results. Works tenaciously toward and derives satisfaction from achieving challenging goals; pitches in where required without regard to status. Self-disciplined; measures progress and evaluates results; prevents irrelevant issues or distractions from interfering with the timely completion of important initiatives.
Interpersonal skills. Demonstrates clear, professional, and respectful communication in all interactions, consistent with an inclusive work environment. Treats others with dignity and respect. The team isn't just better for having you; the others are better by having you
Pursues excellence. Dedicates required time and energy to assignments or tasks to ensure that no aspect of the work is neglected; works to overcome obstacles to completing tasks or assignments. Raises the bar, and helps others reach it too.
Applied learning. Readily absorbs and comprehends new information from formal and informal learning experiences.
Embraces change. Actively tries to understand changes in work tasks, situations, and environment as well as the logic or basis for change; actively seeks information about new work situations.
Teamwork and collaboration. Adheres to the team's expectations and guidelines; fulfils team responsibilities; demonstrates personal commitment to the team.

VGW Canada Inc. is committed to building an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workplace. By learning from each other's differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. VGW Canada Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please advise our Talent Acquisition Specialist in advance should accommodation be required. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Analytics & Operations Manager
job_summary: Analytics & Operations Manager-2307007698W Description Kenvue, part of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies (Kenvue), is currently recruiting for…
job_description:
Analytics & Operations Manager-2307007698W

Description

Kenvue, part of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies (Kenvue), is currently recruiting for Manager Analytics & Operations, Consumer Deliver Supply Chain Canada. This position reports into the Director Deliver, Supply Chain Consumer Canada and is based at Markham, ON with a possibility for a remote candidate. There will be strong preference for candidates able to work hybrid schedule.

Who we are

At Kenvue, part of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, we believe there is extraordinary power in everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and propelled forward by science, our iconic brands—including NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO®, TYLENOL®, LISTERINE®, JOHNSON’S® and BAND-AID® —are category leaders trusted by millions of consumers who use our products to improve their daily lives. Our employees share a digital-first mindset, an approach to innovation grounded in deep human insights, and a commitment to continually earning a place for our products in consumers’ hearts and homes.

Join us in shaping our future–and yours. Watch us here:
What will you do

The Manager Analytics and Operations, Consumer Supply Chain (Deliver) will be an inspiring leader in driving the analytics capability for Consumer Supply Chain (Deliver). The focus will be to lead the development and deployment of business intelligence and analytics capabilities in support of business priorities and long-term strategies. The Manager will bring an end-to-end view to Deliver by maintaining strategic alignment with all business partners and building technology & business solutions.

The successful candidate will be the key lead for the development of analytic tools connecting the dots in data, producing visualizations/reports and providing insight and recommendations to the end user to support the business. This individual will also be involved in benchmarking, attending industry conferences, partnering with the NA Analytics Center of excellence (COE) and regional counterparts to assess best practices to help enhance analytics for Deliver Canada.

Key Responsibilities

Lead a team of 3 Data Analysts and 1 Customer Logistics Operations leader ensuring the team develops and maintains in-depth knowledge about analytic tools, business processes and data relationships covering the order-to-cash processes.Partner with the Director to develop and lead the implementation of the end-to-end analytics roadmap crafting a logistics business-intelligence strategy.Partner with relevant global, regional and local stakeholders, and cross-functional teams (inclusive of IT) in establishing and standardizing critical metrics and reporting processes providing the organization with visibility to the leading and lagging indicators.Drive efficiency and performance improvement via robust data and technology solutions to reduce time spent on metric report generation and enable robust, meaningful insights in support of improving key performance indicators.Establish and lead the governance of Consumer Deliver Data architecture with order-to-cash process.Regular interactions with Deliver Leadership Teams, and Global and Regional counterparts. Consultant engagement & IT management.Other duties as required.
Qualifications

What we are looking for

Required Qualifications

University degree / bachelor’s degree or equivalentMinimum of 8 years of work experience with 5 years’ experience in advanced data analytics in relevant industry.Outstanding data modeling, presentation, and ad-hoc analysis skills. Proven-track record in analytics and knowledge of data management/automation and visualization using data engineering and data science.Strong communication skills and ability to deal with leaders at every level of the organization.
Desired Qualifications

Prior experience in People management.Experience working with business intelligence tools/software to analyze data of BI tools environment (Power BI, Tableau)Experience with SAP and SAP BW strongly desiredExperience with Azure stack strongly desiredKnowledge of data analytics tools and techniques like Alteryx and Python. Strongly desired.Experience with Agile project management methodology
Other

This position may require up to 10% domestic and/or international travel.
What’s in it for you

Competitive Benefit PackagePaid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time, Summer Fridays & More!Learning & Development OpportunitiesEmployee Resource Groups
Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.

title: Senior Technical Data Analyst
job_summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Technical Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team. Needs a strong background in data…
job_description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Technical Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team. Needs a strong background in data analysis and to be able to effectively communicate complex analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences, focusing on our highly profitable Search Engine Monetization business. This role requires a strong background in exploratory data analytics, statistics, data modeling as well as excellent communication and leadership skills.

The Role You Will Have:
Analyze data from search engine marketing campaigns, including keyword performance, ad spend, and conversions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data-driven opportunities and develop strategies to leverage data assets
Develop and maintain analytical dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators and provide insights to stakeholders
Analyze data trends and patterns to identify opportunities for improvement and make recommendations to leadership
Utilize statistical and machine learning techniques to extract insights from data and build predictive models
Train and mentor junior data analysts and team members on data analysis techniques and best practices
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in search engine marketing and data analysis

What You Will Bring:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Data Science)
5+ years of experience in data analysis and visualization of large data sets
Strong experience with statistical and machine learning techniques
Advanced proficiency in SQL, and at least one programming language (e.g. Python, R)
Deep familiarity with all digital marketing metrics including CPA, CPC, CPM and ROAS
Excellent communication and leadership skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, BigQuery)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI), as well as surfacing insights with interactive notebooks (e.g Jupyter, Google Colab)
Familiarity with pulling data from third party API’s and basic ETL processing

What We Have to Offer:
Competitive salary + bonus + equity
Generous PTO + 11 company holidays
Open sick time
Medical, Dental & Vision
RRSP w/matching
Paid professional development
Leadership & growth opportunities
Virtual company and team building events

Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. title: Senior Software Developer, Machine Learning, Google Cloud Compute
job_summary: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming…
job_qualifications: ['Natural language processing', 'Leadership', 'Distributed systems', 'Data structures', 'Google Cloud Platform', 'Doctoral degree', "Bachelor's", "Master's degree"]
job_description:
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
3 years of experience testing, maintaining and/or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.
3 years of experience with ML/AI algorithms and tools, deep learning and/or natural language processing.

Preferred qualifications:
Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
1 year of experience in a technical leadership role. Experience developing accessible technologies.
About the job

Google's software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for software developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software developer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our software developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities
Write and test product or system development code.
Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Senior Manager, Analytics – Stores & Services

job_description:
: 1258494

Who we are
As the Working and Learning Company, we at Staples Canada, are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. At Staples, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We look for people who are curious, approachable, and passionate, and who enjoy finding solutions.
If that’s you, let’s work, learn, and grow together.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team

Staples Canada is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
This role will drive analytical leadership within the company and enable data-based decision making to help Staples Canada become a leading data-driven organization. The individual will lead the Reporting & Insights practice for Stores & Services as part of the Enterprise Analytics & Data Science team. Our multi-tenant cloud platforms power our analytics and ML/AI capabilities and we’re looking for an active hands-on contributor to play a central role in helping our teams understand performance and impact of their strategies. Additionally, the role will be continuously challenged to bring forward valuable insights to help their partners make better and more informed decisions.

We’re on a transformation journey and this role will be a key enabler in accelerating our analytics practice. In addition to having direct ownership over Stores & Services, this role will work closely with various cross-functional partners and have the opportunity to build deep insights across the customer journey – extending to marketing, supply chain, and our B2B functions.

This position represents an ideal role for a highly motivated and highly analytical individual. We are a highly collaborative, agile work environment, so the ideal candidate would demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills and excellent technical depth. The successful candidate will be passionate about data and have a strong foundation in analytics, understanding business needs, and storytelling.

Specifically, You Will:
Strategy & Enablement:
Establish the company as the leader in leveraging and executing on a customer first data-driven strategyOwn and develop the vision, strategy, and execution for a best-in-class customer intelligence and analytics function, ensuring scalability of systems, governance, tools, capabilities, processes, and talentWork with other functions within Analytics and Engineering to curate and source together transactional/behavioural/operational data (in-store, online, third-party) into views that can easily be leveraged and trusted for decision making, connecting back to our customer, their journeys and business prioritiesDevelop suite of reporting tools, with a self-serve enablement focus, that define business impact and project success, while also providing deep insights on integrated data sets to evaluate short term and long-term ROIDrive both strategic and tactical execution to unlock the value of data across internal and external data sets and generate critical actionable insights to drive the decision-making processEstablish analytical standards and best practices to be leveraged across the company’s ecosystem
Delivery of the Functional Analytics Roadmap:

title: Director, Global Finance Performance Analytics
job_summary: Position Title: Director, Global Finance Performance Analytics Position Type: Regular - Full-Time Position Location: Toronto HQ Requisition ID: 22651 JOB…
job_description:
Position Title: Director, Global Finance Performance Analytics

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Toronto HQ

Requisition ID: 22651

JOB PURPOSE: McCain is on a digital transformation journey and we are seeking a creative, courageous and data-driven individual to help shape and realize our vision for Finance. The primary purpose of this leadership role is to own how Finance Digital Technologies and Analytics will enable global business performance and profitable growth decision-making.

This role is responsible for driving how dynamic financial information, analysis and planning processes, can be improved using digital and data strategies/technology. This role will be the Finance lead shaping the analytics performance roadmap in Finance, partnering with technology, global and regional Finance teams. The role will set and own the global standard for transforming financial data into business performance information for decision-making.

In this role, the incumbent will serve as Finance Business partner to Sales, Marketing, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Agriculture functions to provide data analysis and insights, and recommend action plans to maximize the bottom line, leveraging diverse data sources.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Identify opportunities for descriptive and advanced analytics to drive profitability, provide financial understanding and direction to our business
Manage the development and sustainment of Profitability, Costing and Financial Planning models, analytical reporting, scorecards and dashboards
Set strategy and roadmap for how Digital Technologies, Financial Data and Analytics will be leveraged by Global and Regional Finance teams at McCain to enable rich financial information
Promote and drive the use of data and adoption of data analytics to Global and Regional teams to inform business decisions
Guide the continuous improvement of FP&A, Management Reporting and Profitability Analysis solutions in OneStream, SAP PaPM and SAP Analytics Cloud
Elevate and promote the use of SAP ERP, Management Reporting, Financial Planning Tools (OneStream, SAC, PaPM) and Analytics and their application with regional teams and key stakeholders, including c-level executives
Leverage diverse data sources to provide regular analytics insights, reporting and actionable recommendations to the FLT and other key stakeholders
Work in partnership with Finance, Technology and Data & Analytics teams locally and globally.

KEY PRIORITIES:
Drive continuous improvement strategy for finance to modernize how financial data information is used in a dynamic setting for business decision making
Simplify the current reporting processes to leverage more technology.
Identify opportunities to utilize existing and new data sources to identify relevant trends and propose actionable recommendations
Prioritize key reports and analysis that are essential to driving insight for profitable growth
Develop dashboards and reports that offer new insights and track metrics relevant to business performance
Work with Technology team to rapidly scale, modernize and automate reporting tools
extract from big data the meaningful trend, and propose actionable recommendations
Support user training and promote use of data and adoption of
Build a backlog of new reports and dashboards to accelerate manual reporting activities, or provide necessary data to key business decision makers
Implementation of Digital Technologies and Business Processes
Collaborate with Technology, Global and Regional Finance, Sales, Supply Chain, HR and external implementation partners to ensure a globally aligned and efficient continuous improvement of finance performance management needs
Liaise and translate the regional McCain team's requirements and expectations
Business partnership
Strategic financial partner to Commercial, Marketing, Manufacturing, Agriculture functions
Provide insights about opportunities to maximize revenue, minimize cost and increase operational efficiency to drive the bottom line
Accountable for identifying decisions worth making with data, framing them (including defining metrics and key assumptions), and proposing actionable recommendations

MEASURES OF SUCCESS:
Simplification of the reporting/budgeting processes by leveraging more technology
Implementation and adoption of best practice Finance processes and Digital Technology
Transformation of how we utilize data science and analysis at McCain Foods
Team Engagement (both at corporate level and regional level)

KEY QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCES:
Bachelor's Degree, CPA (preferred)
5-7 years working with data to drive decision making and strategy; with a demonstrated history of driving transformational change in a large, global organization
Experience in translating data use cases, requirements to Data Science/IT teams and translating results into insights for the business
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Knowledge and expertise in SAP Finance modules and tools and how they integrate with Sales, Procurement, Manufacturing and Logistics processes
Strong awareness of data best practices and what's possible with rich data
Excellent communication skills and ability to build compelling narratives with data
Experience with requirement analysis (interviewing, facilitation, gap analysis, data analysis, business process mapping, user interface design and mock-up)
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Experience implementing best practice Finance business processes and driving new, innovative internal concepts or products to completion
Effective project management skills
Minimum three years of experience working with Financial Planning, BI and data visualization tools (e.g., OneStream, SAC and Power BI strongly preferred)
Experience in food industry, CPG or manufacturing, ideally in the Finance function

KEY COMPETENCIES:
Collaboration, Champions Change, Drives Results

CANDIDATE PROFILE:
Strategic, results-focused individual who has a love of best practices and data and is someone who embraces change and continuous improvement. This individual has a demonstrated history of driving transformational change in data/digital.

Proven leadership abilities. This individual will be known for their experience in leading a team through transformation change. The candidate will have led a team of peers and/or external suppliers through a high-profile, business-building initiative, demonstrating a persistence and patience that is unwavering in the face of obstacles. Furthermore, the candidate will have demonstrated skills in the delivery of multiple projects concurrently, with the demonstrated ability to prioritize within a changing business environment.
Strategic change skills. The successful candidate will be a leader in bringing fresh ideas and curiosity to drive the use of digital technology and analytics in our business; leading change and innovation in this area. They will be an individual who values diversity of perspective. They will be data-driven, solutions-oriented with a proven ability to synthesize data from multiple sources and to provide actionable insights to the business based on the story the data tells. The successful candidate will demonstrate an entrepreneurial flair and a tendency to thrive in environments with broad flexibility and scope.
Strong collaboration, relationship-building and people development skills. The successful candidate is known for their ability to build strong partnerships with a variety of stakeholders – senior management peers, functional reports, suppliers and customers. They will be able to utilize their working relationships in order to garner new ideas and improve implementation. Must be able to roll up sleeves and get into details as needed.

OTHER INFORMATION

Key internal relationships: Commercial, Marketing, Manufacturing, Agriculture, HR Leaders. Global and regional Finance teams. FLT engagement. Global Technology partners. Global and Regional Data and Analytics leads.
Travel: as required
Job is primarily performed in a standard office environment

The above information indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

job_summary: Ubicquia is in the business of making cities smarter with connected infrastructure. Our data products include street light control and monitoring, electrical…
job_description: Ubicquia is in the business of making cities smarter with connected infrastructure. Our data products include street light control and monitoring, electrical grid monitoring, Wi-Fi network solutions and computer vision traffic monitoring systems.Our products need to handle information at massive scale and extend well beyond basic IoT devices. We're looking for engineers and developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information storage/retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, and artificial intelligence. As a Ubicquia employee, you will work on a specific project critical to the company’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across technologies and disciplines as we continue to push technology forward.Ubicquia is looking for a data scientist to work in the Data team of our Field Engineering department. This team member’s main tasks involve:Analyzing the data that is created by our electrical grid monitoring sensors to create value-added alerts and notifications about the state of city electrical infrastructure. This is a Data as a Service (DaaS) initiative. The data scientist will perform time series analysis and anomaly detection, while interacting with subject matter experts in grid resiliency and electrical engineering to create valuable insights for our customers.The data scientist will take descriptions of events that affect electrical grid assets and transform these into signatures in our generated data that identify events. Proper evaluation methods will be used to monitor performance and identify areas of improvement. Writing the python scripts that find these signatures and scheduling them on a VM to generate reports on a cadence will also be expected.Performing reliability analysis for new field deployments of a particular sensor or existing deployments under new conditions. The data scientist will analyze when and how reliability issues occur and build visualization tools in the form of control charts on Grafana to monitor ongoing deployments.ResponsibilitiesUnderstand business problems and uncover value using data mining techniquesEngage with subject matter experts to prioritize and orient data analysisOwn machine learning algorithm creation from data cleaning all the way to maintenance of models in productionPerform root-cause analysis using data about failures in the fieldDesign experiments to create statistically significant information on business problemsCreate visualizations to communicate findings effectivelyQualificationsBSc (Masters Preferred) in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalentMinimum of 4 years of experience with Python and data science libraries like Numpy, Pandas, ScipyExtensive experience in at least one of the following: statistics, time series analysis, anomaly detectionExperience working with databases (SQL) and cloud computing resources (AWS, GCP)Experience with development best practices like version control, documentation, and unit testingExperience working independently and presenting results to diverse audiencesExcellent oral and written communication skillsCollaborative and positive attitudeNice to HaveExperience in analysis of power grid performanceElectrical engineering backgroundReliability testing certificationsInterest in IoT and smart city solutionsDatabase design experienceUbicquia is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.Job Type: Full-timePay: $90,000.00-$130,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental carePaid time offSchedule:Day shiftSupplemental pay types:Bonus payWork Location: In person

title: Cloud / DevOps Engineer - Toronto, ON (Hybrid)
job_summary: CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11…
job_description:
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.

What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.

Job Description

POSITION PURPOSE
Cloud Engineers set up, operate, develop, evolve, and maintain cloud-centric platform(s) including IoT, Customer Solution Delivery, Data Science Environments and Software Delivery, as well as satellite tools and environments (file storage, databases, tensorflow, data streaming, eventing, machine learning and big data frameworks, notebook technologies, and container orchestration tooling).

SCOPE
Global
MAJOR / KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Responsible for experimenting with and implementing machine learning frameworks for data science/machine learning development and operationsResponsible for learning and operating new data science frameworks and technologies and exploring their viability for current and planned projectsResponsible for learning and operating data storage frameworks and technologies and exploring their viability for current and planned projectsResponsible for learning and operating data recovery, data backup and high availabilityResponsible for learning, operating, evolving, contributing to, and maintaining Digital bespoke frameworks that support the BRIX platform (such as specific data pipes)Responsible for rigorous testing of framework robustness and scalabilityWill contribute to data science teams across Digital and the engineering teams discussions, providing insight as needed on other team member’s current approaches and methods as well as on tools and data repositories.Liaise with Cloud Team (Global IT) to understand company-wide cloud standards and policies and ensure complianceSupporting Serialization and Asset digitization programs across Company by setting up and maintaining IoT and Edge platformsResponsible for the Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelines to support product and software deliveryResponsible for contributing to capability building of the Cloud Engineering team, including researching and staying up-to-date on best practices e.g. GitOps, IaC (infrastructure as code).
MEASURES
Successful roll out, development and continuous evolution and operation of cloud-based data science and machine learning platforms, IoT, Edge and Software Delivery frameworks, both for research & development and for continuous operationEffective support of data science projects, digitization projects and software delivery projectsReliability of systemsAdoption of systems
AUTHORITY / DECISION MAKING
Data science and machine learning frameworks, IoT, Edge and Software Delivery frameworks, selection and implementationTooling selection and implementationWorking autonomously in a highly matrixed organization
KEY CONTACTS
Global IT, Digital Data Science and Application Development team, Digital Product Teams (PM), Software Engineering Team
External:
Potential vendors (i.e., security)
QUALIFICATIONS
BS degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Physics, or similar formal training or equivalentProven experience with looking after data recovery and database high availability and database tuningProven experience with FinOps and being able to optimize spend for CE impactExperience with working with IoT and Edge interaction with the Cloud
EXPERIENCE
5 years relevant experience in Cloud / DevOps Engineering or adjacent fieldsInstalled, operated, and managed several data science and machine learning frameworks, or developed own data science methodologiesExperience with Continuous Integration and Continuous DeploymentExperience operating, optimizing, querying, and administering databases (such as Postgres, TimescaleDB, etc.)Comfortable using and working in a polyglot computer language environment (Python, Go, Julia etc.)Experience with Amazon Web Services (S3, EKS, ECR, EMR, etc.)Experience with containers and orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)Experience with Big Data processing technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Flink, etc.)Experience with interactive notebooks (e.g. JupyterHub, Databricks)Experience with Git Ops style automationExperience with *ix (e.g, Linux, BSD, etc.) tooling and scriptingParticipated in projects that are based on data science methodologies, and/or physical experiments, or statistical analysis – especially in a data engineer and dev ops capacity.
SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
Knowledge of major data science and dev ops frameworks and methodsVery strong analytical skills and systems thinkingStrong programming skills in addition to operational skills a plus (ideally in one or more of the following languages: Python, Go, Julia, or C/C++)Attention to big picture and details
Preferred Education

Bachelors

Preferred Level of Work Experience

5 - 7 years

title: Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics
job_summary: Come Work with Us! At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper,…
job_description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Manager, Fraud Detection Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and execution of fraud detection strategies using advanced analytical methodologies and techniques. These fraud detection strategies will be applied with the goal of reducing RBC’s Fraud Risk and losses, while maintaining a positive client experience and controlling operating costs. You will innovate and implement novel methodologies to improve detection and efficiency across the team, further automating and streamlining processes. You will contribute to and support a variety of projects and initiatives across Fraud Management and collaborate with multiple stakeholders at varying levels of seniority.

Please Note: This position is not a people manager role and we welcome applicants from across Canada to work in a hybrid capacity.

What will you do?

Implement advanced analytical methodologies and proactively identify opportunities to innovate new techniques for fraud detection strategy creation and process and technology improvements
Collaborate with Data Science & Innovation on machine learning and artificial intelligence projects that impact fraud detection, document methodology and standardize process to ensure repeatability
Develop, maintain and optimize fraud detection strategies for non-traditional channels & products, and explore multiple data sources to proactively identify emerging fraud trends and patterns
Leverage reporting to monitor the performance of existing fraud detection strategies, optimize these strategies and use analytical tools to improve detection strategies, enhancing the tools & techniques
Prioritize fraud detection alerts across detection platforms, verify that all rule deployments are accurate and ensure a balance between fraud losses, client experience and operational costs
Contribute to Fraud Management projects and initiatives, provide detection recommendations and implement detection strategies by project deadlines
Develop Fraud Detection analytics best practices, contribute to the development and implementation of the rule strategy framework and create programming code standards for fraud detection
Collaborate across the team to ensure best practices are applied, act as a technical resource for other team members and respond to inquiries regarding fraud data and detection strategies

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

3+ years’ experience in analytics or data science related roles, working with large, real-world datasets
Strong practical knowledge of, and proven experience with, analytical software packages and various programming languages (eg: SAS, R, SQL, Python etc.)
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills with the ability to solve complex problems and develop data-driven solutions
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, including the ability to effectively communicate analytical recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences
Thought leadership capability to lead complex initiatives and discussions driven by analytical and business insights
Ability to see the big picture and guide groups with strategic thinking
Excellent time management skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize workload effectively
Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative discipline

Nice-to-have

Experience with Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Scala or other big-data platform technology/tools
Knowledge of Canadian banking and payment industry payments transaction data and financial fraud

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Continued career advancement opportunities
Exposure to strong mentorship and leadership examples
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

job_description:
The Olympus Markets Data Strategy team is building a next generation Data Fabric to solve the evolving Business, Analytical and Regulatory needs of Citi’s Institutional Clients Group (ICG). The Fabric will bring together disparate data sources for the Global Markets organization and enable industry-leading analytics, client reporting, regulatory, surveillance, supervisory reporting(s) and data science solutions. It will also provide enhanced data quality controls, completeness and accuracy, reconciliations, entitlements, performance, management of data retention and archival per regulatory guidelines.

As part of this program build out the team are developing best in class applications to meet these use cases and managing complex data\application migrations to the Olympus Architecture.

Responsibilities:
Design and Develop real time and batch data transformation processes using wide range of technologies using Hadoop, Spark Stream, Spark SQL, Python, Hive etc.
Design and Develop programs to migrate functionalities, consumer applications and historical data from legacy to next generation Big-data platform
Ability to translate architecture and low-level requirements to design and code using Big-data tools and processes.
Utilize in-depth specialty knowledge of applications development to analyze complex problems/issues, provide evaluation of business process, system process, and industry standards, and make evaluative judgement
Conduct tasks related to feasibility studies, time and cost estimates, IT planning, risk technology, applications development, model development, and establish and implement new or revised applications systems and programs to meet specific business needs or user areas
Monitor and control all phases of development process and analysis, design, construction, testing, and implementation as well as provide user and operational support on applications to business users.
Consult with users/clients and other technology groups on issues, recommend advanced programming solutions, and install and assist customer exposure systems
Serve as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.

5-8 years of Development experience with expertise in the following:

Preferred Skillset:
Spark
SQL
Scala/Python/Java
Linux Based Hadoop Ecosystem (HDFS, Impala, Hive, HBase, etc.)

Good to have below skills:
Web-services
XML/JSON
Experience in Big data technologies , real time data processing platform(Spark Streaming) experience would be an advantage.
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
A history of delivering against agreed objectives
Ability to multi-task and work under pressure
Demonstrated problem solving and decision-making skills
Excellent analytical and process-based skills, i.e. process flow diagrams, business modelling, and functional design.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience

CPA and/or relevant audit experience is preferred

Experience with automation concepts and tools, including identifying automation opportunities and implementing solutions

Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik, SSRS, Cognos)
Utilization of languages like SQL, DAX, Python, and Scala would be considered an asset

Strong self-starter with the ability to drive projects independently in a client-focused environment
Inquisitive, analytical, and problem-solving mindset with a focus on automating processes
Excellent business acumen and ability to present insights from operational and financial data
Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills

Ability to explain complex information in a clear, concise manner to a wider audience
Initiative to learn new tools and concepts or experiment with innovative work independently
Sound judgment regarding confidential information and sensitive matters
Adaptable to an ever-evolving, continuously growth-focused work environment

title: UI Full Stack Developer, VP - Natural Language Processing (Toronto)
job_summary: How will you fulfill your potential? A true greenfield opportunity, you will join the team as we embark on creating new, scalable and resilient Generative AI…
job_description:
How will you fulfill your potential?

A true greenfield opportunity, you will join the team as we embark on creating new, scalable and resilient Generative AI platform leveraging large language models for a complex finance industry. You will collaborate with other NLP engineers, data scientists and business leaders to understand challenges facing the firm and its clients. Your design and development work will contribute to a world-class client experience and optimize business performance.

Your Impact

You will be joining the team that builds and operates foundational Generative AI platform, used by the rest of Goldman Sachs to apply Conversation AI and Document AI based digitization, automation, productivity improvement and efficiency gains to the daily operations of the firm. We take the best components from open source and major cloud providers and adapt and expand them to accommodate unique needs of the firm.

Our Impact

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning and natural language modeling alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. Engineering is at the critical center of our businesses. Our dynamic environment requires strategic thinking that is innovative and produces smart solutions.

The Goldman Sachs NLP and AI Platform team provides high-impact solutions for our engineers and business users responsible for solving problems of significant business value across multiple divisions of the firm. We build scalable and resilient systems using predictive modeling, natural language processing, deep learning, and other techniques on high-volume and high-velocity data. As a UI Full Stack Developer on the NLP and AI Platform team, you will be responsible for helping to build conversational AI services using Large Language Models that can enable interactions such as question and answering, summarization, and more.

Responsibilities may include:
Developing and implementing techniques for improving search and retrieval algorithm using language models.
Experiment & select appropriate AI models for a use case as well as building and training working versions of the models using AI platform.
Create reusable patterns, libraries and datasets.
Optimize, Fine tune and implement deep learning models on information extraction tasks like NER, Summarization and Question Answering.
Conducting research to identify new NLP techniques and approaches,
Evaluating the performance of NLP models and refining them to improve accuracy and efficiency.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate NLP solutions into existing applications and systems.
Build conversational AI services using Large Language Models that can enable interactions such as question and answering, summarization.
Build and enhance orchestration tools to enable semantic search data ingestion pipelines that will be used in document ingestion, vector embedding for document digitization, search and retrieval and conversational services.

Qualifications and desired skillsets include:
A degree in computer science, computational linguistics, or a related field.
Strong programming skills, particularly in Python and/or Java.
Strong UI and full stack development experience.
Experience in building Conversational AI services and orchestration using tools such as LangChain, Vector DB, LLMs, Inference tools such as AWS Sagemaker and experience in Prompt Engineering.
Experience with data pipeline orchestration tools as such Flyte, Airflow, Metaflow, experience with Big Data tools such as PySpark, Kafka.
Experience in building platforms using document extraction using Apache Nutch, JSoup etc.
Experience in designing and implenting large information retrieval systems using embeddings (ex: MiniLM), vector stores like (Faiss, PineCone, Vespa), similarity match & ranking techniques.
Working experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Knowledge of natural language understanding, question answering, summarization, sentiment analysis, and other NLP tasks.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, as well as the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.

title: Senior Applied Scientist
job_summary: INTRO CNL’s Applied Physics Branch explores and investigates the development and applications of radiation based systems and detectors, including performing…
job_description:
INTRO
CNL’s Applied Physics Branch explores and investigates the development and applications of radiation based systems and detectors, including performing experiments, developing physics models and simulations, and building, testing, and evaluating prototypes or third-party devices. Work is performed in a variety of science and technology areas with particular emphasis on applications for nuclear Safety and Security. The Applied Physics Branch reports to the Safety and Security Directorate.

Within the area of Safety and Security, the Applied Physics Branch pursues senior expertise and leadership to maintain and grow CNL’s position in: nuclear instrumentation (detector design, development, and testing), electronics expertise, Monte Carlo simulations and modelling (e.g., GEANT4 simulation of novel detectors or systems), algorithm development, data analysis, and radiation system/equipment testing.

DUTIES
The Senior Applied Physicist will report to the Applied Physics Branch Manager, and have the following responsibilities:

Lead medium to large groups of scientific and technical staff in highly technical applications, and is responsible for the motivation and guidance of the team and their technical output.Mentor science & technology staff.Identify new opportunities as a result of scientific investigations and leads R&D activities to exploit new prospects. Organize, manage, and propose projects in support of CNL's areas of research and commercial prospects in alignment with the mission of the Safety and Security Directorate.Propose and develop new characterization systems and methods for nuclear safeguards and forensics applications. This can include developing and effectively articulating novel ideas, concepts, and proposals for new projects for existing or proposed new customers.Has the ability to handle experimental and computational physics problems; devise new approaches, apply existing criteria in new manners, and draw complex conclusions.Help CNL to transform cutting edge and promising technologies of academic pursuits to addressing challenges related to nuclear safety and security.Coordinate work across directorates and provide technical support, leadership and mentoring to staff and projects led by the other directorates in coordination with the Safety and Security Directorate. The other directorates are: Advanced Reactors; Isotopes, Radiobiology & Environment; Hydrogen & Tritium Technologies; and Reactor Fleet Sustainability.Provide advice on strategic direction, planning, and coordination of major research programs.Provide presentations to stakeholders and contribute to technical refereed journal publications.Other duties as required.
QUALIFICATIONS
Ph.D. in a Physics from a university of recognized standing,Have a minimum of 15 years of experience in subatomic physics or a related field, with an established publication history.Practical knowledge and hands-on experience with computer hardware and software required for nuclear, particle, or radiation physics experiments and applications.Proven experience in designing, building, operating, and optimizing complex detection systems for alpha and neutron particles.Demonstrated experience in applying fundamental physics phenomena, such as superheated liquid and acoustic waves, for detection of elementary particles and radiation.Excellent skills in troubleshooting physics experiments, data analysis, interpretation, and reporting.Strong knowledge of detector hardware and electronics experience is required, such as configuring VME, CAMAC, and/or NIM data acquisition systems.Strong technical problem solving skills, particularly with multi-disciplinary teams and challenges, make recommendations on technical issues, and prepare work plans with minimal supervision.Proven leadership experience leading scientific and technical staff in the accomplishment of scientific endeavours and in the application of applied research for internal or external customers.Good computer skills, including word processing, spreadsheets. Good analytical, documentation and communication skillsHistory of working carefully, safely, and accurately, with good knowledge of and commitment to quality assuranceKnowledge of the utility and application of Monte Carlo methods would be an asset.Computing background with a working knowledge of C/C++, Python, ROOT, and UNIX/Linux operating systems would be an asset.
Why CNL?
Does working with a team across Canada to advance nuclear science and technology for a clean and secure world speak to you? We're reinventing ourselves to be the pace setters, so we can lead the charge in solving the problems that matter, like building the next generation of clean nuclear and hydrogen energy solutions, developing new and better-targeted cancer treatments, and continuing to lead the world in environmental remediation.

We offer a complete total rewards package:
o paid time off (vacation, sick, floater & personal);
o benefits effective day one, that’s right no waiting period;
o tuition support
o and a pension!

Location:
CNL’s Chalk River laboratory is nestled in the Ottawa Valley and affords our employees an area that is environmentally pristine with extensive forests, hills and numerous small lakes, all of which support a variety of wildlife typical to the southern edge of the Canadian Shield. Many surrounding towns, such as Pembroke, Petawawa and Deep River provide you need with unparalleled outdoor adventures at your doorstep! In fact, Deep River was named as the fourth best place to live in Canada in a recent ranking by movingwaldo.com.

About CNL:
CNL is Canada's premier nuclear science and technology organization and a world leader in developing nuclear technology for peaceful and innovative applications. Using our unique expertise, we are restoring and protecting the Environment, we are advancing clean energy technology, and our medical breakthroughs continue to improve the health of people around the world.

Our Priorities:
Clean energy for today and tomorrow.Restore and protect the Environment.Contribute to the health of Canadians.
CNL is committed to providing an atmosphere free from barriers that promotes equity, diversity and inclusion in achieving our mission. CNL welcomes and celebrates employees, stakeholders and partners of all racial, cultural, and ethnic identities.

CNL also supports a workplace environment and a corporate culture that is built on our Core Values: Respect, Teamwork, Accountability, Safety, Integrity and Excellence which encourage equitable employment practices and career prospects inclusive of accommodations for all employees.

CNL is committed to being an equal-opportunity employer. If you require accommodation measures during any phase of the hiring process, please indicate via our ATS when applying. All information received in relation to accommodation requests will be kept confidential.

The Chalk River Laboratories site is located on the unceded and unsurrendered territory of the Algonquin Anishinaabe people. As an organization, CNL recognizes and appreciates their historic connection to this place. CNL also recognizes the contributions that First Nations, Métis, Inuit and other Indigenous Peoples have made, both in shaping and strengthening this community in particular, and this province and country as a whole.
