title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (15617) Canada (Remote)
job_summary: Form strong cross-functional relationships with engineering teams. Maintain focus on reliability, resiliency, and security. Experience with CI/CD and Gitlab.
job_description:
About Getty Images

Getty Images is a preeminent global visual content creator and marketplace that helps businesses of all types and sizes connect and compete in an increasingly digital and visual world. Through its Getty Images, iStock and Unsplash brands, websites and APIs, Getty Images serves over 1 million customers in almost every country in the world and is the first-place people turn to discover, purchase, and share powerful visual content from the world’s best photographers and videographers.

The company works with over 450,000 contributors and more than 300 content partners to deliver powerful and comprehensive content. Each year, Getty Images covers more than 160,000 news, sport and entertainment events providing depth and breadth of coverage. The company maintains one of the largest and best privately-owned photographic archives in the world with over 135 million images dating back to the beginning of photography. As photojournalists, videographers, creators, art directors, creative researchers, data scientists and customer service professionals, they have made it their mission to help tell stories which will move your brand, your customers, your readers, and viewers, and help create lasting connections.

The company also takes inherent biases in AI and machine learning very seriously. They are committed to checking data to identify potential biases from the individual/s developing the tool. It is their mission as a company to be a passionate advocate for the realistic representation of all people and communities through visual content, celebrating diversity and authenticity in every area of life.

About the team:
The Search Team at Getty Images is responsible for building the search technology that empowers our customers to move the world with images. To meet the ever-changing needs of our customers, we explore, develop, and deploy new AI/ML technologies, visual search algorithms, computer vision models, and new ranking techniques at scale.
What you will do
Build scalable software solutions that delight our customers
Form strong cross-functional relationships with engineering teams
Maintain focus on reliability, resiliency, and security

What we are looking for:
Experience building and operating complex distributed systems at scale
Empathy for users and their business goals
Proven experience building and leading software engineering teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity
Tenacity and the ability to balance competing priorities across multiple cross-functional stakeholders
Orientation towards long-term impact as the yardstick for prioritization, but able to strike the right balance between short-term goals and longer-term vision
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Curiosity and pragmatism
Qualifications & Experience
Experience developing with ML Libraries (Such as Onnx, TensorFlow, Bert)
Well versed in C#, Java, or other object-oriented languages
Working knowledge of search algorithms and their practical applications.
Hands-on experience with AWS Technologies (Such as Dynamo, ECS, EC2, S3)
Experience with containers and container schedulers (Docker, ECS)

Nice to have:
Familiarity working with: Solr, Lucene, Spark and Kafka
Knowledge or experience with FAISS, vector search, or NLP
Understanding and utilization of scripting languages such as Bash, Python and Ruby
Experience with CI/CD and Gitlab
Experience with monitoring tools such as Splunk, Grafana, and Prometheus

Benefits at Getty Images

Extended Health Insurance

Time off Work/life balance is important to us
We provide flexible time off plus 3 sick days each calendar year. Additionally, we offer 16 weeks paid Maternity Leave for birth mothers, and 4 weeks fully paid leave for other new parents.

Company Paid Holidays
Employees enjoy company-paid holidays for each of our global locations.

Disability and Life Insurance
We automatically enroll and pay for Basic Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance (AD&D) up to 2 times your annual salary. We also provide you with fully paid Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability Insurance.

Employee Assistance Program
Employees have access to free, confidential assistance for everyday problems such as stress management, financial coaching, marital or family issues, substance abuse, occupational problems, and referrals for legal, childcare, and eldercare services. Employees can seek additional discounts on other wellness activities such as travel, gym memberships, and sports! Through our EAP services, employees are also eligible for 3 free counseling visits and life coaching sessions.

Group RRSP Matching Program
Save for retirement by making contributions consistently and conveniently through payroll deductions. Plus, Getty Images will match 100% of your contributions, up to a maximum of 3% of your base salary! Contributions are taken from your gross pay BEFORE payroll taxes are calculated resulting in an immediate tax reduction. Participation is voluntary so you must enroll in the plan for contributions to begin.

Learning & Growth
We value continuous learning and development to help everyone develop their skills. Enjoy mentorship, curated training & more.
__________________________

Who We Are:
Getty Images is a preeminent global visual content creator and marketplace. Through Getty Images, iStock, and Unsplash, we offer a full range of content solutions to meet the needs of any customer—no matter their size—around the globe.

Getty Images encompasses the largest and best path to market for visual creators through their premier brands including its core, Getty Images; iStock, a value offering of creative stills and videos providing a significant volume of exclusive content to small and medium-sized businesses; and Unsplash, a free offering of creative stills servicing the fast-growing and broad-based creator economy.

Help us move the world with images! Bringing award-winning imagery to everyone, Getty Images has customers in almost every country in the world, with websites in 23 languages, bringing the world’s best content to media outlets, advertising agencies and corporations, small businesses and increasingly, direct to consumers.

Getty Images works with over 516,000 contributors and image partners to provide comprehensive coverage of more than 160,000 news, sport, and entertainment events around the globe. With over 520 million assets, of which over 320 million are digitized, encompassing the latest global news, sports, celebrity, music and fashion coverage; exclusive conceptual creative images; and the world’s largest commercial archive. New content is added daily, with 8-10 million new assets added each quarter.

Getty Images offers the most exclusive and unique creative and editorial visual content globally. The breadth and quality of our content allow our customers and partners to tell their stories with greater creativity and accuracy, thereby eliciting more emotion and enabling more action. Getty Images moves the world —whether the goal is commercial or philanthropic, revenue-generating or society-changing, market-disrupting or headline-driving. Getty Images offers the highest quality and most diverse visual content, based on industry-leading expertise and innovation.

Leadership Principles
As a company, we're committed to living these Principles every day. Here's how we support our mission to be the best place to work globally.

We are trustworthy, transparent, and honest
We love character, authenticity, and integrity.

We always raise the bar
Excellence is our norm; we get better through endeavor, curiosity, and speed.

We collectively bring solutions
We love debate but collaborating to solve problems for ourselves and our customers is everyone’s responsibility.

We care, are kind, courteous, and respectful
We will not tolerate rudeness.

We reject biased behavior and discrimination
We seek to understand biases in all forms. We call out biases and discrimination when observed and take action where responsible.

We are inclusive of different voices, perspectives, and experiences
Diversity and inclusion are never done, but we are passionate in their pursuit.

We are one Getty Images with no silos
We share goals and accountability; we and actively seek information and expertise; we make time for our peers.

We deliver on our commitments, and commercial goals
With one voice and shared accountability.

We put the customer at the heart of everything we do
We listen to, anticipate, and exceed customer needs, adapting as they evolve.

We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives. Women, gender-nonbinary, people of color, LGBTQIA+ people, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Getty Images is committed to providing Reasonable Accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance to search for a job opening or submitting an online application, please email RecruitingAccommodations@gettyimages.com.

Visit Getty Images at www.gettyimages.com to learn more about how the company is advancing the unique role of still and moving imagery in communication and business, and enabling creative ideas to come to life.

For company news and announcements, visit our Press Room, and for the stories and inspiration behind our content, visit Stories & Trends.

Find Getty Images on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Pinterest and Tumblr, or download the Getty Images app where you can explore, save and share the world's best imagery.

Getty Images is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Getty Images believes that diversity is critical to our success in moving the world with images and is committed to creating an inclusive, mutually respectful environment that celebrates diversity. We seek to hire on the basis of merit, competence, performance, and business needs.

title: Data Scientist - Functional Biology
job_summary: Designing data analysis pipelines integrating multiple data sources. Implementing standardized statistical analysis and visualizations of complex multifactorial…
job_description:
AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune systems to find antibodies that its partners can develop into drugs to prevent and treat disease. We are seeking a highly motivated Data Scientist to support our rapidly growing functional and translational biology teams.

The successful candidate will interact with a diverse team, liaising between wet-lab scientists, software engineers and data scientists in a fast-paced and focused environment. The candidate is expected to be able to multitask, problem-solve, think critically and demonstrate scientific rigor.

How you might spend your days:
Designing automated analysis pipelines for a variety of data types derived from medium and high throughput experiments, including flow cytometry, spectrophotometry, spectrofluorimetry and high-content imaging.
Implementing and maintaining these analysis pipelines (typically in Python), ensuring data integrity, correctness, clarity and adherence to regulatory requirements.
Collaborating with scientists to develop standard protocols to execute and capture results from medium and high throughput experiments.
Developing processes and tools for inventory management of experimental samples and reagents.
Coordinating with different scientific, business and software teams to develop strategies for data analysis, curation, storage, presentation & interpretation.
Analyzing and presenting data and analysis methods to colleagues and partners.
Organizing, supporting and collaborating with other team members to meet project deliverables and timelines.

We'd love to hear from you if:
You are passionate about data science and want to work in an interdisciplinary environment.
You have experience in complex data analysis and integration, and the curiosity and drive to learn about new applications in the life sciences.
You have experience with high throughput and/or IND-enabling scientific workflows.
You can effectively communicate scientific ideas across disciplines and levels of experience. You enjoy cutting to the heart of a problem to explain it and explore solutions.
You have experience using and developing processes and tools that integrate with an ELN system.
You take pride in being self-motivated, a fast learner, a team player and a creative problem solver.
You’re driven to learn and master new technical skills.

We don’t expect all of these to match but we’ll be excited to hear about the experiences that resonate with you.

Desired qualifications and experience:
PhD, MSc or BSc in computer science, statistics, the sciences or a related field with 3+ years of related work experience.
Strong fluency in a programming language for data analysis and an interest in using Python and the related data science stack (such as numpy, scipy, pandas) day-to-day.
Experience collecting or analyzing laboratory datasets.
Demonstrated ability to create flexible data analysis pipelines intended for use by others, such as:
Building and deploying user-friendly interactive data analysis applications, using tools such as Dash or R-Shiny
Implementing standardized statistical analysis and visualizations of complex multifactorial data.
Designing data analysis pipelines integrating multiple data sources.

About AbCellera:
At AbCellera, we find the next generation of therapeutic antibodies. To succeed, we create innovative solutions - combining custom antigen preparation and immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation - leaving no stone unturned, revolutionizing how scientists can explore natural antibody diversity and the scale at which they can do it. You’ll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.

We’re a rapidly growing publicly traded company, and we have state-of-the-art discovery tools and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn’t just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of innovators working together to solve the toughest problems. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We’re looking for someone like you to support and organize our efforts along the way.

To apply:
Please submit your application through our website and refer to Job ID 23050 in your cover letter. We apologize in advance, but we receive a large volume of applications and are only able to contact those who are selected for an interview.

#LI-AS

title: Instructor - Computing and Data Science
job_summary: Command-line scripting and data wrangling. Position Title Instructor - Computing and Data Science. Position Status Regular Limited Term.
job_description:
Competition Number F18552P
Position Title Instructor - Computing and Data Science
Employee Group Faculty
Position Status Regular Limited Term
Position Type Instructor
Special Appointee
Others please specify
Workload Amount 4.0
Department Computing Science
Additional Notes
Location North Vancouver
What you’ll do
Position: 1-year Regular Limited Term (RLT) appointment (with the possibility of an additional 1-year extension) to the position of Instructor in Computing and Data Science. The School of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) is located within the Faculty of Arts and Science. The successful candidate will teach courses to support STEM programs in Engineering and Bachelor of Science, with Concentrations in Biomedical, Environmental, and Computational Sciences.

We are seeking a dynamic educator who has a passion for teaching and learning and is committed to excellence in undergraduate education. Our ideal candidate embodies our Academic Model, which delivers experiential, problem-based, studio-learning experiences, with a core focus on developing students’ imagination with problem-solving, innovation, teamwork, and leadership skills. We are looking for an instructor who is able to transcend the technical details of simply teaching programming, algorithms, data structures, and statistics, to mentor students through every course in the fundamental computational thinking skills that will see them through rapidly changing technologies and practices.

Our successful candidate will teach a base load of 3 – 6 undergraduate courses (1/2 to full-time load) per year. Candidates must be able to teach a range of first-, second-, and third-year courses in the following areas, as needed:
Computer Science 101 (discipline overview)
Introductory programming (Python, C, C++)
Introductory micro-controller / robotics (Arduino)
Introductory Computational and Data Science
Command-line scripting and data wrangling
Applied databases
Social, economic, environmental impact of computing technologies

As a small, high-functioning department at a teaching-oriented University, we are seeking a collegial, energetic, and innovative individual who can work within a creative, collaborative team. Though the position is a 2-year limited term, we anticipate this will evolve into a more permanent position, and are seeking someone who is motivated to join our department and contribute to the continued development of our unique programs and pedagogies.

Regular Limited Term appointment provides placement on salary scale, paid Professional Development and vacation, and on-going work load rights, as defined in section 2.1.4 of the CFA Collective Agreement.

What you’ll bring

Our ideal candidate will:
demonstrate excellence in teaching and learning at the undergraduate level with an ability to develop relevant, engaging experiential and applied learning opportunities for students;
have exceptional communication and collaboration skills;
cultivate life-enhancing learning experiences in diverse and inclusive environments;
have passion for collaborative work that inspires innovative, inter-disciplinary curriculum and pedagogic design to improve student experiences and outcomes across all our programs;
develop and teach emerging inter-disciplinary topics that combine computation, statistics, and science;
proactively respond to rapidly evolving technologies and best-practices by sharing and creating relevant knowledge and timely skill development;
be committed to partnering with local communities and external partners for the wider good and the long-term;
continuously reflect on and learn from experience to effectively advance our commitment to co-create a distinct university experience;
actively participate in departmental activities, STEM initiatives, and University service;
commit to an on-going program of professional development;
support the University’s strategic vision, which pledges to “transform the lives of learners, employees and communities with experiences and engagement opportunities to actualize their passion and potential."

Our selected candidate must possess and demonstrate the following qualifications:
a Masters (or higher) degree in Computing, Computing Science, Data Science, or related discipline;
instructional experience at the post-secondary level;
excellent communication skills;
enthusiasm for supporting and engaging directly with students and student initiatives;
a commitment to a collaborative and collegial working culture;
a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion throughout the University.
Posting Detail Information

Internal or External Position External
Appointment Date (mm/dd/yyyy) 08/01/2023
Salary Scale Faculty Scale
Post Date 05/09/2023
Close Date
Open Until Filled Yes

title: Data Analyst, Analytics & Insight / Analyste de données, analytiques d’affaires
job_summary: Create captivating and engaging data visualizations that break free from traditional presentations. Ability to analyze large data sets, articulate results and…
job_description:
At Brother, we l ive and breathe our “at your side” spirit by offering our people careers where they can learn, grow and thrive . And with over 100 years of experience making high-quality printers, labellers, scanners, sewing, embroidery, and quilting machines, we’re a rock-solid company with a reputation for being great people delivering a superior customer experience.

Are you passionate about data and analytics? Do you possess an insatiable curiosity to uncover hidden insights and make a significant impact? Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst and unleash your analytical expertise to drive insights for business operations and strategic initiatives, drive go-to-market tactics through effective performance analysis.

Reporting to the Director, Analytics & Insights, the Data Analyst partners with the Analytics team to build and maintain tools and processes that enable the manipulation and transformation of data across multiple platforms and enhance decision making processes. They can automate processes and imbed data science principles to enhance decision making processes. The Data Analyst commits to enhancing customer experience and identifies, plans and executes continuous improvement endeavours accordingly.

What’s in it for you?

Understand and analyze business needs from stakeholders to track and assess performance.

Transform raw numbers into impactful stories to drive decision-making and go-to-market tactics.

Collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather business requirements and helping them understand complex data concepts.

Analyze datasets and prepare formal documents.

Create captivating and engaging data visualizations that break free from traditional presentations.

Design analysis methodologies and execute projects to generate valid and reliable insights with statistically significant results.

Communicate execution progress through written status updates and identify areas for improvement.

Design and execute analysis methodologies, manipulate, and transform datasets across various data sources to extract insights and facilitate decision making.

What we look for:
Bachelor’s Degree specializing in Economics, Analytics, Math/Statistics, Business, Engineering or related fields

Master’s degree is an asset (MBA, MSc, MMA, etc.).

1-3 years of experience in analytics roles.

Has practical experience with statistics and research methods (quantitative and qualitative).

Ability to analyze large data sets, articulate results and communicate conclusions eloquently.

Ability to build strong partnership with cross-functional business teams.

Advanced proficiency with Python, SQL, etc.

Knowledge of Python ML Libraries, Tableau and big data tools like Apache Spark, Pandas and Polars.

Knowledge of cloud-based systems like AWS and development tools.

Is detail-oriented, self-motivated and time-efficient.

Is flexible and can adapt quickly to an ever-changing environment.

Is capable of working in high-pressure, time-constrained situations.

.

What you need to know about Brother:
Our shared values are Inclusion, Collaboration, Customer Centricity and Social Responsibility.

We’re an open and honest group of people that foster a challenging spirit in all that we do.

"At your side" is more than a slogan; it’s our purpose and we do our best to fulfill it every day.

We’re great people who work hard, play hard and look out for each other because we’re a team – it’s that simple!

What Brother has to offer:
We're committed to achieving shared success and we provide opportunities for you to develop through experience, training and learning via Brother University.

RRSP program – we match up to 4% base salary per year after your first year of enrollment.

Insurance package that cares for you as much as we do.

Wellness subsidy to support your wellness goals.

Recognition Awards Program: we give and receive kudos through our social recognition program, where you accumulate points towards your preferred reward.

Friends and Family discount on Brother products saves you, your friends and family money on the things you need.

Hybrid work model (at home/in the office) provides greater balance in supporting our Brother Community and team spirit.

Bring your positive attitude and great personality and apply today to become our next Data Analyst! #LI-Hybrid.

At Brother Canada, we strive to provide an environment where everyone feels valued by respecting individual differences and welcoming diverse life and work styles. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate or make employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

_____________________________________________________

Chez Brother, nous incarnons et respirons l’esprit « At your side » en offrant à nos employés des carrières où ils peuvent apprendre, grandir et s’épanouir . Possédant plus de 100 ans d’expérience dans la fabrication d’imprimantes, d’étiqueteuses, de scanners et de machines à coudre, à broder et de courtepointe de qualité supérieure, nous sommes une entreprise solide comme le roc et nous avons la réputation d’être des gens formidables qui assurent un service remarquable.

Êtes-vous passionné par les données et l’analyse? Possédez-vous une curiosité insatiable qui vous pousse à pour découvrir des faits saillants et à avoir un impact significatif? Joignez-vous à notre équipe dynamique en tant qu’analyste de données et mettez à profit votre expertise en analyse pour générer des analytiques d'affaires pour nos activités commerciales et nos initiatives stratégiques, et optimiser les tactiques de mise en marché grâce à une analyse du rendement efficace.

Relevant du Directeur, Analytiques d’affaires , en collaboration avec leur équipe, conçoit et tient à jour des outils et des processus qui permettent de manipuler et de transformer des données provenant de diverses plateformes. Il automatise les processus et intègre les principes de la science des données afin d’améliorer les processus décisionnels. Il définit, planifie et met en œuvre des initiatives d’amélioration continue en vue d’améliorer l’expérience client.

Ce que vous ferez :
Comprendre et analyser les besoins commerciaux des parties prenantes pour effectuer le suivi et évaluer le rendement.

Transformer des chiffres bruts en récits percutants pour orienter la prise de décision basée sur les données et les tactiques de commercialisation.

Collaborer étroitement avec les parties prenantes pour recueillir les exigences commerciales et les aider à comprendre les concepts de données complexes.

Recueillir les exigences, analyser les ensembles de données et préparer des documents formels.

Créer des visualisations de données captivantes et attrayantes qui vont au-delà des présentations traditionnelles.

Concevoir des méthodologies d’analyse et réaliser des projets visant à générer des analytiques d'affaires valides et fiables avec des résultats statistiquement significatifs.

Faire part de l’avancement des projets au moyen de rapport écrits, repérer les domaines d’amélioration et améliorer les processus.

Concevoir et mettre en application des méthodologies d’analyse, manipuler et transformer des ensembles de données provenant de différentes sources pour extraire des analytiques d'affaires et faciliter la prise de décision.

Ce que nous cherchons :
Baccalauréat spécialisé en économiques, analyse de données, mathématiques/statistiques, gestion, ingénierie ou domaines connexes.

Maîtrise, un atout (en administration des affaires, en sciences, en analytique de gestion, etc.).

De 1 à 3 ans d’expérience dans un poste d’analyse.

Expérience pratique avec les statistiques et les méthodes de recherche (quantitatives et qualitatives).

Capacité à analyser de vastes ensembles de données, à interpréter les résultats et à les communiquer de façon éloquente.

Capacité à établir des partenariats solides avec les équipes interfonctionnelles de l’entreprise.

Connaissance approfondie de Python, SQL, etc.

Connaissance de Python ML Libraries, Tableau et d’outils d’analyse de mégadonnées, comme Apache Spark, Pandas et Polars,

connaissances des systèmes infonuagiques, comme AWS, et des outils de développement.

Personne axée sur les détails, motivée et efficace.

Capacité à faire preuve de souplesse et à s’adapter rapidement à un environnement en constante évolution.

Capacité à travailler dans un environnement sous pression et à respecter des contraintes de temps.

Ce que vous devez savoir au sujet de Brother :
Nos valeurs communes sont l’inclusion, la collaboration, l’orientation client et la responsabilité sociale.

Nous sommes un groupe de personnes ouvertes et honnêtes qui cultivent le goût du défi dans tout ce que nous faisons.

« At Your Side » est beaucoup plus qu’un slogan; c’est notre philosophie d’entreprise.

Nous sommes des gens formidables qui travaillent fort, associent sérieux et plaisir et s’entraident parce que nous sommes une équipe — c’est aussi simple que cela!

Voici ce que Brother vous offre :
Nous nous engageons à parvenir au succès commun et nous vous offrons des occasions de vous développer par l’expérience, la formation et l’apprentissage avec l’Université Brother.

Programme de REER : nous versons une contribution de contrepartie allant jusqu’à 4 % du salaire de base par an après votre première année d’emploi.

Un ensemble d’assurance qui se soucie de vous autant que nous.

Une subvention de santé pour vous aider à atteindre vos objectifs en matière de santé et bien-être.

Programme de reconnaissance : nous donnons et recevons des félicitations par le biais de notre programme de reconnaissance sociale, dans le cadre duquel vous accumulez des points pour le cadeau de votre choix.

Des rabais accordés aux employés sur les produits Brother vous permettant, ainsi qu’à vos amis et à votre famille, d’économiser de l’argent sur les articles dont vous avez besoin.

Mode de travail hybride (à la maison et au bureau) offrant un bon équilibre pour soutenir la communauté Brother et l’esprit d’équipe.

Apportez votre attitude positive et votre belle personnalité en postulant aujourd’hui pour devenir le prochain ou la prochaine analyste de données chez Brother! #LI-Hybrid

Chez Brother Canada, nous nous efforçons d’offrir un environnement de travail où tous se sentent valorisés en respectant les différences individuelles et en accueillant des styles de vie et de travail variés. Nous sommes un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité des chances. Nous ne faisons aucune discrimination et ne prenons aucune décision d’embauche fondée sur la race, la couleur, la religion, le genre, le handicap, ni toute autre caractéristique protégée.

title: Intermediate Machine Learning Developer
job_summary: We are looking for a Machine Learning Developer who is passionate about solving challenging computer vision and machine learning problems in collaboration with…
job_description:
Weir ESCO
Vancouver, Canada

Purpose of Role:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Developer who is passionate about solving challenging computer vision and machine learning problems in collaboration with other data scientists and developers. AI team members will be involved in various stages of algorithm development from research to production, which includes AI model development for embedded, edge and cloud environments.

Why choose Weir:
Be part of a global organization dedicated to building a better future: At Weir, the growing world depends on us. It depends on us constantly reinventing, quickly adapting and continually finding better, faster, more sustainable ways to access the resources it needs to thrive. And it depends on each of us doing the best work of our lives. It’s a big challenge – but it is exciting.

An opportunity to grow your own way: Everything moves fast in the dynamic world of Weir. This creates opportunities for us to take on new challenges, explore new areas, learn, progress and excel. Best of all, there is no set path that our people must take. Instead, everyone is given the support and freedom to tailor-make their own career and do the best work of their lives.

Feel empowered to be yourself and belong: Weir is a welcoming, inclusive place, where each individual’s contribution is recognized and all employees are encouraged to innovate, collaborate and be themselves. We continually focus on people and their wellbeing. We believe in fairness and choose to be honest, transparent and authentic in everything we do.

Responsibilities:
Review the literature for the state-of-the-art computer vision and machine learning methodologies.Design and implement proprietary machine learning algorithms and optimize them based on runtime system requirements and constraints.Propose, implement and monitor validation and performance metrics for the proprietary algorithms.Conduct code reviews and work closely with the software/hardware teams to transfer the prototyped models to the production environment.Setup the development pipeline including data management and deployment through continuous integration scheme.
Safety First: Demonstrate 100% commitment to our zero harm behaviors in support of our drive towards developing a world class safety culture.

Job Knowledge/Education and Qualifications:
Master’s Degree or higher in Computer Science or a related technology/engineering field.3+ years of hands-on experience in developing and implementing and evaluating machine learning models algorithms.Solid understanding of statistical learning algorithms, including (self, semi) supervised, unsupervised and transfer learning and computer vision algorithms.Proficiency in Python and version control.Basic familiarity with object- and service-oriented design, api development, containerization, and complexity analysis.Solid Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch and OpenCV.Familiarity with image processing algorithms.Strong analytical, communication and presentation skills.
Founded in 1871, Weir is a world leading engineering business with a purpose to make mining operations smarter, more efficient and sustainable. Thanks to Weir’s technology, our customers can produce essential metals and minerals using less energy, water and waste at lower cost. With the increasing need for metals and minerals for climate change solutions, Weir colleagues are playing their part in powering a low carbon future. We are a global family of 11,000 uniquely talented people in over 60 counties, inspiring each other to do the best work of our lives.

For additional information about what it is like to work at Weir, please visit our Career Page and LinkedIn Life Page.

Weir Motion Metrics (WMM) is a Canadian mining technology division that enables a new generation of safe, smart, and sustainable mining based in Vancouver, B.C. Serving the mining market since 1999, then joining Weir in 2021, Motion Metrics is proud to be Weir’s first-ever center of excellence for artificial intelligence and machine vision technology.

For additional information about Weir Motion Metrics, visit us at www.motionmetrics.com

Weir is committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are an equal-opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

title: Sr. Machine Learning Engineer
job_summary: Implementing data pipelines to support running cutting-edge machine learning techniques on massive amounts of data.
job_description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

Interset is part of the Cybersecurity group in OpenText. We use big data and advanced machine learning/behavioral analytics to detect and prevent the theft of intellectual property … simply put, WE CATCH BAD GUYS WITH MATH!!!

We foster a thriving, dynamic environment rich with inventive minds and entrepreneurial spirit and our employees are empowered and encouraged to build their careers at OpenText.

The Opportunity:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Ottawa, ON / Richmond Hill, ON (Hybrid role)

This is an exciting opportunity for a Machine Learning Engineer to work with a team of driven, experienced ML engineers and data scientists building our next generation behavioral analytics platform for our fast-growing SaaS business.

If you are passionate about true machine learning and want to be part of a company building solutions that leverage the latest in big data technology, we want to talk to you!!

You are great at:
Implementing data pipelines to support running cutting-edge machine learning techniques on massive amounts of data.
Working with product managers and data scientists to turn new features and algorithms into beautiful, battle-tested code.
Leveraging technologies we use to analyze and identify cyber-security threats for our customers.
Working side-by-side with some of the smartest minds in machine learning and behavioral analytics.
Exploring new technology options for data processing and storage and share them with the team.
Developing tools and contributing to internal and open-source projects wherever possible.

What it takes:
An undergraduate or masters' degree in Computer Science or equivalent engineering experience.
Proficiency in at least one major language (e.g., Java, Scala, Python) and SQL.
Experience with data lake storage technologies such as Apache Iceberg, Delta Lake, and Apache Hudi.
Experience in developing streaming platforms using Spark Structured Streaming or Flink.
Experience in building and implementing data pipeline workflow by leveraging Airflow, Prefect, or Dagster.
Familiarity with MLOps platforms to manage ML lifecycles such as MLflow and Kubeflow.
Experience with Kubernetes, Docker or any other infrastructure or containerization management/automation platform.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Practical experience with Agile/Lean software development methodologies

Nice to have:
Contributions to open-source software (code, docs or mailing list posts).

OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us at hr@opentext.com.

title: Machine Learning Engineer, Fulfillment / Supply Chain
job_summary: Passion for applying data science to dynamic open-ended problems. Experience with big-data tools, e.g. Spark, Beam, Kafka. Experience in shell scripting/unix.
job_description:
At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experiences, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating the online businesses of Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. Based in downtown Toronto, we are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and collaborative team working towards transforming the way Canadians shop by creating leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, loyalty, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started! To achieve these goals, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to collaborate and solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.

As a Machine Learning Engineer on our team, you will be a key member of a team that has the goal of developing complete machine learning solutions that helps us build a better fulfillment platform that improves our customers’ experience as well as colleagues working in store operations. Leveraging the wealth of operational data available you’ll focus on delivering solutions that predict, forecast & optimize how we manage our inventory and our fulfillment capacity to provide a fulfillment experience that balances a complex trade-off between ensuring millions of Canadians who shop with us get their orders in a timely fashion and ensuring our operational & fulfillment costs stay low.

Your work requires communicating with an array of business stakeholders across Store Operations, Fulfillment Software Engineering Teams, Product Management, and Online Analytics to name a few primary ones. From brainstorming on numerous options to solve a problem, through deploying the completed solution in a production environment, you will partner with colleagues who offer a diverse set of ideas that are all immensely valuable to our purpose and mission.

What you'll Do
Communicate cross-functionally with business teams — Product, Store Operations, Fulfillment Specialist, Store & Area Managers— to source data, establish requirements and define success
Code robust, scalable, high-performance ML solutions based on massive structured and unstructured datasets from various sources
Collaborate with Engineering and Data Platform teams to build and deploy your ML models into production
Design experiments to measure the effectiveness of your product in driving a seamless fulfillment experience through key metrics such as labour rate, pick efficiency, orders ready of time, fill rate etc.
Document and share, findings and results in a structured manner with stakeholders, as well as drive technical discussions with other Data Science teams
Does this sound like you?
MS or Ph.D. in a STEM field — especially computer science — or BS plus equivalent work experience in a Data Scientist or a closely related role
A portfolio including work in the domain of data science and ML with a focus on predictive analytics, time series forecasting, operations research & supply chain optimization
Creative, resourceful, and productive problem-solver
Passion for applying data science to dynamic open-ended problems
Able to work independently and collaboratively
Comfortable with advanced SQL querying
Proficient in Python programming
Experience in shell scripting/unix
Experience with big-data tools, e.g. Spark, Beam, Kafka
Experience with Airflow for workflow scheduling
Experience with or working knowledge of a public cloud AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience with or knowledge of software development best practices
How you’ll succeed

At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!

Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

title: Senior Analytics Specialist
job_summary: Identify significant information from a variety of sources, collect and analyze data to develop, assess, and establish meaningful ways of grouping and…
job_description:
Job requisition number
037566
Job location
Richmond
Full-time / part-time
Full-time
Posting period
From 12/09/2022 to 07/28/2023
Overview

We are looking for a highly motivated, innovative, experienced customer-focused analyst, with a keen interest in strategic analysis, data-science, and performance measurement and evaluation to join our Business Intelligence and Analytics (BIA) team which has been rated as one of the best in the Canadian public sector.

In this role, you’ll contribute to the effectiveness of WorkSafeBC by providing strategic analysis, advanced analytics, and business intelligence to support business decision making.

If you’re a team player, proactive, and a strong communicator with sound problem solving and critical thinking skills, then consider joining us for a rewarding career keeping the population of British Columbia safe. We’d like to hear from you!

What you'll do

As a senior analytics specialist on our BIA team you will:
Conduct data analytics, performance measurement analysis, and program evaluation addressing a wide variety of issues in occupational health and safety, management oversight, internal operations, and disability management
Identify trends, emerging issues, drivers, and opportunities of business significance to WorkSafeBC, and developing recommendations to management and senior management related to those areas
Develop/improve data models for forecasting/prediction, targeting, outlier detection, and performance measurement to successfully convey key themes and messages
Facilitate inter-departmental and inter-organizational sessions focused on performance improvement, opportunity identification, and problem solving, leveraging data to meet business objectives
Lead various internal teams on ad-hoc requests, investigations, pilot studies, proofs of concept, and various program evaluation projects
Is this a good fit for you?

We’re looking for someone who can:
Independently plan, prioritize, schedule, and complete complex multi-task workload of projects and activities to consistently meet deadlines
Gather information; summarize, verify and interpret data; assimilate technical and business information; and review relevant information with clients, co-workers, and contacts
Clearly and concisely present analysis results and recommendations both in written reports and verbally to individuals and groups of varying levels of expertise
Identify significant information from a variety of sources, collect and analyze data to develop, assess, and establish meaningful ways of grouping and transforming data to draw conclusions of underlying issues
Apply quantitative and qualitative research methods (e.g. statistical analyses, data modeling, text mining, machine learning, predictive analytics, sampling, survey and questionnaire design).

Your background and exprience:
A master’s degree in a quantitative-related discipline such as statistics/mathematics, operations research, big data, data science, computer science, information technology, finance, business, management information systems, or engineering.
A minimum of three years of directly related experience in business intelligence, statistical analysis, strategic analysis, and/or advanced analytics.

Important to know

Before we can finalize any offer of employment, you must:
Consent to a criminal record check
Confirm you’re legally entitled to work in Canada

WorkSafeBC’s COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the “Policy”) is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect.

Who we are

At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries or diseases occur, we provide compensation and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We’re honoured to serve the 2.49 million workers and 263,000 registered employers in our province.

What’s it like to work at WorkSafeBC?

It’s challenging, stimulating, and rewarding. Our positions offer diversity and opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important, and so are the people we do it for.

Our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences that reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self.

Learn more: Discover who we are.

Our benefits

As a member of our team, you’ll have access to services and benefits that help you get the most out of work — and life. Along with a competitive salary , your total compensation package includes:

Extra 4% of your salary in lieu of benefits and 4% in lieu of vacation from the day you start. Once you’ve worked a certain number of hours (approximately 12 months), you’ll switch to getting:
Up to 4 weeks of vacation
Extensive health care and dental benefits
Sick leave and long-term disability coverage

Learn more: Find out what we offer.

Want to apply?

Applications are welcomed immediately, however must be received no later than 4:30 p.m. PST on the closing date.
Please note that we will be starting assessments prior to the closing date.

We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) when you submit your application.

Any additional application materials must be received by email to HR Talent Acquisition (SM) by 4:30 p.m. PST on the closing date of the competition.

title: Senior Specialist Talent Solutions Enablement- 12 months contract
job_summary: KPI measurement and data analytics. Gather benchmark data about best-in-class TA practices and KPIs and make recommendations to improve processes and practices.
job_description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our TA team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. We offer meaningful opportunities because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Senior Specialist, Talent Solutions Enablement is responsible for liaising with the Recruitment and Workforce Planning teams to understand CN’s hiring needs and provide recruitment solutions and strategies. The role tracks and reports talent acquisition Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in order to provide recommendations in accordance with the results as well as running the backend Applicant Tracking Software (ATS) platform and other technology-driven Talent Acquisition (TA) solutions.

Main Responsibilities
Tracks and Reports on TA KPIs — 50%
Track and report the TA KPIs on a monthly basis to identify top drivers of attraction, retention, and engagement
Provide analysis, insights and recommendations based on the results
Measure the performance and effectiveness of recruitment campaigns and partner sourcing platforms through the use of Google and other analytics tools
Gather benchmark data about best-in-class TA practices and KPIs and make recommendations to improve processes and practices

Enables Talent Solutions – 50%
Work with Human Resources (HR) to manage the ATS platform and be the TA team’s super user and support the team by resolving administrative backend issues
Identify and support the implementation of TA technology solutions
Working Conditions
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday with the possibility of afterhours work during important projects or TA enhancements. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress. The role requires minimal travel (approximately 5%).

Requirements
Experience
Human Resources
Minimum 7 years of combined experience in a similar role with:
Systems integration and management
KPI measurement and data analytics
Experience in data visualization
Employer marketing campaign measurement
Education/Certification/Designation
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Human Resources, Marketing or a related field

About CN
As a leading North American transportation and logistics company, CN is a true backbone of the economy. With a team of approximately 25,000 railroaders, our focus is on moving both our company and the economy forward. We transport US$200 billion worth of goods annually for a wide range of business sectors from resource to manufactured products to consumer goods, across a 20,000-mile network spanning Canada and mid-America. CN is the only Canadian company listed in the Transportation and Transportation Infrastructure sector of the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI). Launched in 1999, the DJSI World represents the gold standard for corporate sustainability. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - AI Chatbot IT Company

job_description:
This is the leading open-source chatbot stack, allowing developers to build better chatbots without a team of data scientists and machine learning experts. First released in 2017, the platform includes a unique managed NLU engine, an integrated development and visual conversational design environment, flexible integrations, and extensive options for customization.

Developers love the product and has more than 9500 Github stars and 100,000 users. The company is privately held and headquartered in Quebec, and recently closed a series A funding, led by Decibel.

Role:
We are seeking a highly skilled and passionate Senior Developer to join our Engineering team. Someone who excels with both front and back-end programming, all in Typescript. The Senior Full Stack Developer is responsible for developing and designing front-end web architecture, along with scalable backend code, on his own, from Day-1.

As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will both jump in current initiatives, and will lead a project from conception to final product, requiring excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Full autonomy and creativity are super important in our team. You will be expected to solve challenging problems on your own. It sounds rough - but that’s how we succeed.

title: Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations
job_summary: Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data.
job_description:
: 1260941

Who we are
We, at Staples Professional, provide our business customers with a deep professional expertise when it comes to Business Essentials, Furniture, Facilities, Technology, Print/Promo, and Pack and Ship, as well as next-day delivery service and customized solutions for ordering, billing and reporting. We are part of the Staples umbrella in Canada, and as such we are a true multi-channel solution provider – online, at our customers place of business and in-store, for all our customers needs. We are looking for people who are curious, passionate and put the customer first.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team
Staples Professional is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
Reporting to the Sr. Director, Sales Operations and Customer Service, the Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations will develop and execute the strategy, priorities, and direction of our recently formed team. Lead the design and execution of best-in-class dashboards and scorecards to bring on-time, accurate visibility across all team in Staples Professional.

Supporting multiple functions, (sales, customer service, marketing, supply chain & senior leadership), in Staples Professional and across Staples Canada, the candidate will enable data-driven decision making which will be used to answer key relevant questions about business performance, drive sales growth, expand lines of business and improve profitability across small to enterprise-sized accounts. The individual will be a hands-on leader, working with their teams to visualize data which will tell compelling stories, creating a bias for action. They will lead BI, Data Governance and CRM projects, in support of analytics- and CRM-product roadmaps.

We are on a Next-Generation Sales and Customer Service 3-year journey where new technology and processes, powered by AI/ML, will accelerate our go-to market strategy, and supercharge our B2B customer experience. This is a highly visible role that requires being able to link analytics to business implications to form actionable, high-impact recommendations that drive revenue growth & reduce seller friction. A strong understanding of a sales-led SaaS model - both motions and metrics - is key.

To be their authentic self each day, they thrive on leading change, collaborating across teams, inspiring people, are highly motivated and are a die-hard for analytics. The work environment is ever-changing, and agile so the ideal candidate would demonstrate resiliency, prioritization, and be passionate about the customer experience.

Specifically, You Will:
BI Intelligence & Data Governance - 60%
Sales Operations - 40%

Develop short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic, business performance and operational objectives; Building and maintaining scorecards, dashboards that can be leveraged across Staples Professional and Staples Canada.
Partner with key stakeholders to address their unique needs to drive performance and support exploring ‘how-to’ best utilize data to achieve outcomes; selection of the right KPIs for new initiatives and storytelling of the data after launch
Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data. Key partners include Finance, Data Science, IT, and Sales Leadership.
Working with the Data Science team, leverage unified 360 view of customers to deliver customer health reporting, insights, and drive a customer data narrative across all aspects of Staples Professional
Leverage the relationship with technology and SaaS vendors to bring thought-leaders and best- practice into Staples Professional
Collaborate with the CRM Centre of Excellence, IT, 3rd party Integrators and software vendors to lead, develop and design the SFDC, sales ops and other sales enablement tools roadmap.
Facilitate alignment and collaboration across sales, pricing, sales enablement, and marketing, to directly affect Staples Professional’s revenue and customer experience.
Responsible for technical activities, enablement and user adoption associated with Staples Professional’s day-to-day sales & service tools: SFDC, HighSpot etc. Measure, monitor and improve tool utilization.
Build-out automated process flows and seller motions to maximize revenue and penetration potential of markets (white space, adjacent products, new business)

Leadership
Motivate, mentor, and ensure your direct team has the right tools, processes, and principles in place to deliver work that is on time and to support partner needsLead a continuous learning environment with respect to utilizing the latest methodologies, technologies, and illustrative best practices to tell stories which can drive business decisionsDevelop a community where associates are energized, with an ownership mindset, that enable each other to be better every day, and extend that support across all teams.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_summary: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights. Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams.
job_description:
Purpose

Drive the implementation of the new BI framework and governance policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
Strategy: Support & Deliver

Governance

Maintain VGW reporting taxonomy, by updating and classifying as necessary
Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams
Creates new reports and retrofits existing reports as part of the rollout strategy of BI related products to the new state
Follow and promote the adoption of the governance framework for VGW's Data Catalog to ensure policies, standards and definitions are followed with peer Analysts across the organisation
Become an advocate of Alation across the organisation & lead discussions
Create & review supporting documentation (Articles & Wikis) that support the rollout and adoption of the new BI framework across the organisation

Reporting

Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework & governance
Apply the new report tooling framework when developing new reports, dashboards and self-service BI tools
Review data sources & queries to determine if it is accurate or relevant for the development of VGW's Data Catalog and Business Data Dictionary
Collaborate with the Data Management team to maintain and improve the performance of data sources used as part of BI products.
Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of scalable and reliable analytical products, dashboards, and metrics that drive VGW crucial business decisions
Provide ad-hoc support on data collection, analysis and reporting

Stakeholder Management and Team Collaboration:
Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve
Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW's Data Catalog & BI's new processes and procedures.
Summarise queries and concerns from external teams in relation to the rollout of BI's framework
Can run requirement sessions with a product or data team to discuss relevant requirements and best solutions
Can work autonomously on program components and ad-hoc analytics work, is capable of problem-solving issues that are encountered, however, understands to when to escalate blockers.
Builds and maintains positive relationships with stakeholders, and proactively identifies and addresses any issues or concerns they may have.
Clearly articulates and communicates insights to stakeholders.

Learning & Development:
Mentor and provide support to associates BI in best practices and technical optimisation
Support the execution of L&D programs for BI-related tooling (Data Catalog & Tableau) and proficient SQL skills
Work with direct reports to build comprehensive personal learning and development plans to deepen technical or social tracks and broaden skill sets on underdeveloped areas that will add value to VGW and enable career progression
Encourage diverse opinions and problem-solving from a variety of sources that differ from your personal context and background
Provide broad growth impact, through internal skill shares, public user groups, blog posts or similar.

Qualifications, skills & experience:
A Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Data Science or Artificial Intelligence.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to create and review queries.
Business acumen
Experience working with BI analysts, data analysts, and/or cross-functional teams.
Problem-solving skills to identify pain points and recurring concerns.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

Personal Competencies:
Delivers results. Works tenaciously toward and derives satisfaction from achieving challenging goals; pitches in where required without regard to status. Self-disciplined; measures progress and evaluates results; prevents irrelevant issues or distractions from interfering with the timely completion of important initiatives.
Interpersonal skills. Demonstrates clear, professional, and respectful communication in all interactions, consistent with an inclusive work environment. Treats others with dignity and respect. The team isn't just better for having you; the others are better by having you
Pursues excellence. Dedicates required time and energy to assignments or tasks to ensure that no aspect of the work is neglected; works to overcome obstacles to completing tasks or assignments. Raises the bar, and helps others reach it too.
Applied learning. Readily absorbs and comprehends new information from formal and informal learning experiences.
Embraces change. Actively tries to understand changes in work tasks, situations, and environment as well as the logic or basis for change; actively seeks information about new work situations.
Teamwork and collaboration. Adheres to the team's expectations and guidelines; fulfils team responsibilities; demonstrates personal commitment to the team.

title: Lead Data Scientist (DL & AI Modeling, Forecasting) (Canada)
job_summary: Create repeatable, interpretable, dynamic, and scalable models seamlessly incorporated into analytic data products. Data Visualization in Tableau/PowerBI.
job_description:
Tiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Scientists to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. Our employees bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.

We are looking for a robust Lead Data Scientist, preferably with a Ph.D. who holds solid knowledge of deep learning, is a quick learner, and has strong coding capabilities. This person will be responsible for leading the POD and managing the stakeholder engagement as well as writing complex production-level codes.

Key Responsibilities

Effectively communicate the analytics approach and how it will meet and address objectives to business partners.
Advocate and educate on the value of data-driven decision-making; focus on the “how and why” of solutions.
Lead analytic approaches; integrate solutions collaboratively into applications and tools with data engineers, business leads, analysts, and developers.
Create repeatable, interpretable, dynamic, and scalable models seamlessly incorporated into analytic data products.
Collaborate, coach, and learn with a growing team of experienced Data Scientists.
Stay connected with external sources of ideas through conferences and community engagements.
Support demands from regulators, investor relations, etc., to develop innovative solutions to meet objectives utilizing cutting-edge techniques and tools.

Requirements

Ph.D. (highly preferred) or Master in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 5-7+ years of extensive Data Science experience with super deep knowledge in AI, and DL modeling coding capability as this person needs to make designs happen.
Strong statistics foundation and knowledge of statistical packages. Proficiency with Python and SQL and ability to write complex Python codes and SQL queries.
A solid knowledge of deep learning, quick learner, and a strong coding capability. This person will be responsible for writing complex production-level codes.
Hands-on experience building models is a must.
Experience with demand forecasting and/or supply chain/retail forecasting is a must.
Data Visualization in Tableau/PowerBI
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to understand business partner needs and deliver solutions.

Benefits

This position offers an excellent opportunity for significant career development in a fast-growing and challenging entrepreneurial environment with a high degree of individual responsibility.

title: Lead Technical Data Analyst
job_summary: 7+ years of progressive experience in data analysis/data science and handling of large data sets. Use SQL to self-serve data from disparate sources & manipulate…
job_description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Lead Technical Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team. Needs a strong background in data analysis and to be able to effectively communicate complex analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences, focusing on our highly profitable Search Engine Monetization business. This role requires a strong background in exploratory data analytics, statistics, data modeling as well as excellent communication and leadership skills.

The Role You Will Have:
Serve as a subject matter expert to both the Analytics team and business leaders, providing sound & data-driven strategies that help meet or exceed business goals
Develop and create models in production (classification, clustering, learning models, multivariate regression, time series, k-means, etc.) to identify the best business solution
Use Python and packages like Pandas, NumPy, etc., perform complex statistical analysis on results, and utilize APIs for data ingestion
Use SQL to self-serve data from disparate sources & manipulate multiple large data sets simultaneously for analysis
Perform complex exploratory analysis on historical search engine marketing campaign data - including keyword performance, ad spend, and conversions - and identify opportunities for new expansion & data acquisition
Collaborate with teams in Taxonomy & Performance Marketing to proactively identify keyword trends & develop data-driven optimization strategies
Use tools like Tableau, Looker, or PowerBI to visualize results and present directly to business leaders
Provide mentorship & training to junior analysts and new hires, and evangelize ways to implement better data-driven practices throughout the organization
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in search engine marketing and data analysis

What You Bring to the Team:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Data Science)
7+ years of progressive experience in data analysis/data science and handling of large data sets.
Strong experience with mathematical optimization methods, exploratory data analysis, predictive modeling and machine learning techniques
Advanced proficiency in SQL, strong proficiency in Python & its data science packages (Pandas, NumPy, MatPlotLib, Seaborn, etc.)
Familiarity with digital marketing KPIs including CPA, CPC, CPM and ROAS
Excellent communication, and experience in providing leadership within your team (code-review or pair-programming, interviewing & onboarding new hires, etc.)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g. AWS, Snowflake, Hadoop, Spark, BigQuery)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI), as well as surfacing insights with interactive notebooks (e.g Jupyter, Google Colab)
Familiarity with pulling data from third party API’s and basic ETL processing

What We Have to Offer:
Competitive salary + bonus + equity
Generous PTO + 11 company holidays
Open sick time
Medical, Dental & Vision
RRSP w/matching
Paid professional development
Leadership & growth opportunities
Virtual company and team building events
