Collaborating with scientists to develop standard protocols to execute and capture results from medium and high throughput experiments.
Developing processes and tools for inventory management of experimental samples and reagents.
Coordinating with different scientific, business and software teams to develop strategies for data analysis, curation, storage, presentation & interpretation.
Analyzing and presenting data and analysis methods to colleagues and partners.
Organizing, supporting and collaborating with other team members to meet project deliverables and timelines.

We'd love to hear from you if:
You are passionate about data science and want to work in an interdisciplinary environment.
You have experience in complex data analysis and integration, and the curiosity and drive to learn about new applications in the life sciences.
You have experience with high throughput and/or IND-enabling scientific workflows.
You can effectively communicate scientific ideas across disciplines and levels of experience. You enjoy cutting to the heart of a problem to explain it and explore solutions.
You have experience using and developing processes and tools that integrate with an ELN system.
You take pride in being self-motivated, a fast learner, a team player and a creative problem solver.
You're driven to learn and master new technical skills.

We don't expect all of these to match but we'll be excited to hear about the experiences that resonate with you.

Desired qualifications and experience:
PhD, MSc or BSc in computer science, statistics, the sciences or a related field with 3+ years of related work experience.
Strong fluency in a programming language for data analysis and an interest in using Python and the related data science stack (such as numpy, scipy, pandas) day-to-day.
Experience collecting or analyzing laboratory datasets.
Demonstrated ability to create flexible data analysis pipelines intended for use by others, such as:
Building and deploying user-friendly interactive data analysis applications, using tools such as Dash or R-Shiny
Implementing standardized statistical analysis and visualizations of complex multifactorial data.
Designing data analysis pipelines integrating multiple data sources.

About AbCellera:
At AbCellera, we find the next generation of therapeutic antibodies. To succeed, we create innovative solutions - combining custom antigen preparation and immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation - leaving no stone unturned, revolutionizing how scientists can explore natural antibody diversity and the scale at which they can do it. You'll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.

We're a rapidly growing publicly traded company, and we have state-of-the-art discovery tools and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn't just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of innovators working together to solve the toughest problems. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We're looking for someone like you to support and organize our efforts along the way.

title: Contract Sr. Specialist, Downstream Integrated Ops Data Management and Analytics
job_summary: Experience with data visualization and advanced data science platforms. Promote data management and data governance philosophies within the DSM organization.
job_description:
We’re a Canadian-based integrated energy company headquartered in Calgary. We’re committed to maximizing value by sustainably developing our assets in a safe, innovative and cost-efficient manner, integrating environmental, social and governance considerations into our business plans.

We operate in Canada, the United States and the Asia Pacific region. Our operations include oil sands projects in northern Alberta, thermal and conventional crude oil and natural gas projects across Western Canada, crude oil production offshore Newfoundland and Labrador and natural gas and liquids production offshore China and Indonesia. Cenovus’s downstream operations include upgrading, refining and marketing operations in Canada and the United States.

Our shares trade under the symbol CVE and are listed on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges.
Cenovus Downstream Manufacturing (DSM) is taking a coordinated approach to modernize its business processes and strategically apply technology solutions in an integrated way to make our assets safer, make the work we do more efficient, better inform our decisions, and help deliver on our commitment to world class performance. The Downstream Manufacturing Digital Enablement Program (DEP) is a 5-year plan to improve, modernize, and integrate our systems, applications, workflows, data, and assets that drive our business.

Reporting to the Director, Digital Enablement, the Contract Senior Specialist, Integrated Ops Data Management and Analytics will be the integrated business owner accountable to work with Downstream business leaders, Operations, Engineering, Process Control teams, Downstream Technical Services (DTS) functions, IT, the Corporate Data Office (CDO) and other stakeholders to develop, implement, and manage an aligned operations process data management plan and applied analytics strategy on behalf of DSM as a foundational Downstream Manufacturing capability. This role is accountable for developing the long-term strategy and roadmap for process data information management and operations analytics, for the integrity and reliability of an integrated operational sensor and process data environment needed to support digital modernization, the quality of data generated from Downstream facility operating processes, and the enrichment, useability, and accessibility of process information needed for applied analytics and to drive continuous improvement of operations performance.

This role is responsible to guide and coordinate cross-functional digital initiative working groups implementing and delivering digital capabilities focused on addressing technical deficiencies, aligning ops data management methodologies, and building the long-term, future-state ops data architecture for DSM. This role is an important piece of the Digital Enablement program to ensure ops data system requirements from Downstream sites are consistently represented, solutions are properly selected through thorough business evaluation, integrated into business workflows and systems, and overall business objectives are achieved.

This integral role within the Digital Enablement Office leads, plans, prioritizes, and implements effective ops data management and analytics solutions across all sites in alignment with site priorities, Digital Program objectives, Downstream Manufacturing’s annual Journey Book, and in coordination with Enterprise and Corporate Service organizations.

WiFi Motion Analytics is growing and we’re looking to add a Lead Software Developer (Backend) to our team in Montreal.

You will have the opportunity to join us at a very impactful time, and help us develop a new and exciting technology that has the ability to change people's lives all over the world!

As a Lead Software Developer (Backend), you will play a pivotal role in defining and building our innovative WiFi sensing solutions. You will lead the definition of our system architecture and participate in the development of our new platform.

We aim to become the wireless standard for smart motion detection through continuous innovation, passion, and inventiveness for the smart home, home care, security, healthcare, and hospitality applications. Based in Montreal, we also operate from two regional offices in the USA and Europe.

title: Financial Dev & Spend Sr Machine Learning Development Engineer
job_summary: Passion for decision making based on sound data analysis. 4+ years experience with designing and building metrics collection and data visualization.
job_description:
Your work days are brighter here.

At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.

About the Team

Do what you love. Love what you do.

At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.

About the Role

As one of our core values, we invest heavily in our people - the team hosts a diverse mix of technical talks and networking events, supports travel for conferences and speaking opportunities, and cultivates career-defining work through a focus on health and wellbeing that starts with an optimal blend of work/life balance. This is a place where you can thrive in a fun, people-first culture that creates an environment that enables you to succeed and do your best work. Join us as we change the way millions of people work.

The Financial & Spend ML/Experience team at Workday is responsible for the architecture and development of the machine learning services powering a range of applications in the financial domain. Our work is a blend of large-scale data processing, battle-hardened machine learning methodology, and microservice design that places craftsmanship at the forefront of everything we do. Built on a backbone of startup DNA, we operate with a high degree of autonomy and strong sense of ownership.

About You

As a part of this team you'll drive design, analysis and development of metrics collection and users’ feedback systems to improve machine learning services through monitoring and personalization of the models.

Basic Qualifications:
4+ years experience with Python in production environments and a strong understanding of computer science fundamentals

4+ years experience designing experiments, A/B testing and data analysis in the domain of quality metrics for machine learning services

4+ years experience with designing and building metrics collection and data visualization

Other Qualifications:
Passion for decision making based on sound data analysis.

Proven understanding of modern frontend development frameworks (e.g., Angular or React)

Proven understanding of modern web applications architecture and development process

Understanding of REST-based API design, e.g., Flask or Django.

Interest in or experience with machine learning methodologies and tools (e.g. Natural Language Processing (NLP), sklearn, pandas, numpy, keras, tensorflow, etc.)

Exposure to large-scale data processing tools like Kafka, Spark, or Hadoop

Exposure to cloud-computing technologies like AWS/GCP, Docker, Kubernetes etc.

Experience using modern frontend development frameworks (e.g., Angular or React)

Proven understanding of modern frontend development frameworks (e.g., Angular or React)

A strong sense of ownership and a persistent desire to grow and lead beyond the scope of the current role

Our Approach to Flexible Work

With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.

title: Director of Product Management, Asset Analytics (Hybrid)
job_summary: 7+ years of Product Management experience in a relevant area such as data analytics, software applications or a SaaS field. 10+ years in a leadership role.
job_description:
OUR VISION

At EarthDaily Analytics we strive to build a more sustainable planet by creating innovative solutions that combine satellite imagery of the Earth, modern software engineering, machine learning, and cloud computing to solve the world’s toughest challenges in agriculture, water management, carbon capture verification and more. Our focus has been on building the world’s most advanced satellite image processing pipelines capable of delivering automated, reliable, meaningful analytics from our customers’ satellites and our own. Our belief is that insights can only be as good as the data itself and we pride ourselves on generating the highest quality data products in the industry. With our upcoming constellation in 2024 which will image the Earth’s entire landmass in 22 spectral bands, every day everywhere, we’re excited to continue pushing the boundaries of what's possible in Earth observation and analysis. Our goal is to provide our customers with not just data, but solutions that drive real-world impact and change. We're committed to being at the forefront of sustainability innovation, and we're looking for talented individuals who share our vision and want to make a positive impact on the planet.

OUR TEAM

We work in a product driven environment, where we are dedicated to bringing innovative earth observation services to life to deliver customer focused solutions. Our products are delivered by our highly skilled multidisciplinary team of engineers with backgrounds in Geography, Physics, Computer Science, Atmospheric Studies, Mathematics, Cloud Infrastructure, Industrial Design, and Aerospace Engineering, among others. Our team of experts have achieved numerous groundbreaking achievements including developing the world’s first colour HD video from space, building processing pipelines for some of the most well-known commercial satellites, and creating an award-winning raw satellite calibration and processing SaaS for ours and our partner’s satellites. We’re also currently underway building revolutionary earth observation-based analytics to help solve some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We are currently looking for an experienced Director of Product Management to join our crew to contribute to our ongoing innovation and product leadership!

READY TO LAUNCH?

Do you want to work for one of the most exciting space companies at the forefront of global daily change detection/change monitoring and predictive analytics for a variety of emerging applications? The ideal candidate takes a target driven and customer-oriented approach to define and bring to market a suite of products and services leveraging our revolutionary satellite constellation, and partner datasets combined with advanced processing and ML-based solutions.

PREPARE FOR IMPACT!

As a Director of Product Management, you will take a customer focused approach to lead the product management and rapid growth of a key product portfolio in the area of physical asset products and solutions using earth observation based change detection, object detection and predictive analytics. You will be responsible for defining, launching, and managing products that align with EDA's vision and strategy and be involved with the following high impact activities:

Lead the product development process from ideation to launch, including market research, competitive analysis, customer requirements gathering, and product roadmap development for a product vertical.

At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our TA team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. We offer meaningful opportunities because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Senior Specialist, Talent Solutions Enablement is responsible for liaising with the Recruitment and Workforce Planning teams to understand CN’s hiring needs and provide recruitment solutions and strategies. The role tracks and reports talent acquisition Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in order to provide recommendations in accordance with the results as well as running the backend Applicant Tracking Software (ATS) platform and other technology-driven Talent Acquisition (TA) solutions.

Tracks and Reports on TA KPIs — 50%

Enables Talent Solutions – 50%
Work with Human Resources (HR) to manage the ATS platform and be the TA team’s super user and support the team by resolving administrative backend issues
Identify and support the implementation of TA technology solutions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday with the possibility of afterhours work during important projects or TA enhancements. Requirements
Experience
Human Resources
Minimum 7 years of combined experience in a similar role with:
Systems integration and management
KPI measurement and data analytics
Experience in data visualization
Employer marketing campaign measurement
Education/Certification/Designation

As a leading North American transportation and logistics company, CN is a true backbone of the economy. We transport US$200 billion worth of goods annually for a wide range of business sectors from resource to manufactured products to consumer goods, across a 20,000-mile network spanning Canada and mid-America. CN is the only Canadian company listed in the Transportation and Transportation Infrastructure sector of the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI). Launched in 1999, the DJSI World represents the gold standard for corporate sustainability. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

title: Director of Product Management, Environmental Analytics (Hybrid)
job_summary: 7+ years of Product Management experience in a relevant area such as data analytics, software applications or a SaaS field. 10+ years in a leadership role.
job_description:
OUR VISION

At EarthDaily Analytics we strive to build a more sustainable planet by creating innovative solutions that combine satellite imagery of the Earth, modern software engineering, machine learning, and cloud computing to solve the world’s toughest challenges in agriculture, water management, carbon capture verification and more. Our focus has been on building the world’s most advanced satellite image processing pipelines capable of delivering automated, reliable, meaningful analytics from our customers’ satellites and our own. Our belief is that insights can only be as good as the data itself and we pride ourselves on generating the highest quality data products in the industry. With our upcoming constellation in 2024 which will image the Earth’s entire landmass in 22 spectral bands, every day everywhere, we’re excited to continue pushing the boundaries of what's possible in Earth observation and analysis. Our goal is to provide our customers with not just data, but solutions that drive real-world impact and change. We're committed to being at the forefront of sustainability innovation, and we're looking for talented individuals who share our vision and want to make a positive impact on the planet.

OUR TEAM

We work in a product driven environment, where we are dedicated to bringing innovative earth observation services to life to deliver customer focused solutions. Our products are delivered by our highly skilled multidisciplinary team of engineers with backgrounds in Geography, Physics, Computer Science, Atmospheric Studies, Mathematics, Cloud Infrastructure, Industrial Design, and Aerospace Engineering, among others. Our team of experts have achieved numerous groundbreaking achievements including developing the world’s first colour HD video from space, building processing pipelines for some of the most well-known commercial satellites, and creating an award-winning raw satellite calibration and processing SaaS for ours and our partner’s satellites. We’re also currently underway building revolutionary earth observation-based analytics to help solve some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We are currently looking for an experienced Director of Product Management to join our crew to contribute to our ongoing innovation and product leadership!

READY TO LAUNCH?

Do you want to work for one of the most exciting space companies at the forefront of global scientific monitoring with a goal to support some the most pressing environmental challenges? The ideal candidate takes a target driven and customer-oriented approach to define and bring to market a suite of products and services leveraging our revolutionary satellite constellation and partner datasets, combined with advanced processing and remote sensing based solutions.

PREPARE FOR IMPACT!

As a Director of Product Management, you will take a customer focused approach to lead the product management and rapid growth of a key product portfolio in the areas of earth observation based environmental products and solutions. You will be responsible for defining, launching, and managing products that align with EDA's vision and strategy and will be involved with the following high impact activities:

Lead the product development process from ideation to launch, including market research, competitive analysis, customer requirements gathering, and product roadmap development for a product vertical.
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the market, customer needs, and competitive landscape.

Monitor and analyze product performance metrics, customer feedback, and market trends to identify areas for improvement and new product opportunities.
Act as a spokesperson for your product portfolio, communicating product features, benefits, and roadmap to internal and external stakeholders.
Drive continuous improvement of the product development process and product management best practices.

YOUR PAST MISSIONS

YOUR TOOLKIT

Lead the design and execution of best-in-class dashboards and scorecards to bring on-time, accurate visibility across all team in Staples Professional.

Supporting multiple functions, (sales, customer service, marketing, supply chain & senior leadership), in Staples Professional and across Staples Canada, the candidate will enable data-driven decision making which will be used to answer key relevant questions about business performance, drive sales growth, expand lines of business and improve profitability across small to enterprise-sized accounts. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_summary: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights. Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams.
job_description:
Purpose

Drive the implementation of the new BI framework and governance policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
Strategy: Support & Deliver

Governance

Maintain VGW reporting taxonomy, by updating and classifying as necessary
Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams
Creates new reports and retrofits existing reports as part of the rollout strategy of BI related products to the new state
Follow and promote the adoption of the governance framework for VGW's Data Catalog to ensure policies, standards and definitions are followed with peer Analysts across the organisation
Become an advocate of Alation across the organisation & lead discussions
Create & review supporting documentation (Articles & Wikis) that support the rollout and adoption of the new BI framework across the organisation

Reporting

Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework & governance
Apply the new report tooling framework when developing new reports, dashboards and self-service BI tools
Review data sources & queries to determine if it is accurate or relevant for the development of VGW's Data Catalog and Business Data Dictionary
Collaborate with the Data Management team to maintain and improve the performance of data sources used as part of BI products.
Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of scalable and reliable analytical products, dashboards, and metrics that drive VGW crucial business decisions
Provide ad-hoc support on data collection, analysis and reporting

Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve
Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW's Data Catalog & BI's new processes and procedures.
Summarise queries and concerns from external teams in relation to the rollout of BI's framework
Can run requirement sessions with a product or data team to discuss relevant requirements and best solutions
Can work autonomously on program components and ad-hoc analytics work, is capable of problem-solving issues that are encountered, however, understands to when to escalate blockers.

Clearly articulates and communicates insights to stakeholders.

Encourage diverse opinions and problem-solving from a variety of sources that differ from your personal context and background

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Sr. Deep Learning Compiler Engineer III, AWS Neuron, Annapurna Labs
job_summary: 5+ years of non-internship professional software development experience. 5+ years of programming with at least one software programming language experience.
job_description:
5+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
5+ years of programming with at least one software programming language experience
5+ years of leading design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
Experience as a mentor, tech lead or leading an engineering team

At AWS our vision is to make deep learning pervasive for everyday developers and to democratize access to cutting edge infrastructure. In order to deliver on that vision, we’ve created innovative software and hardware solutions that make it possible.

AWS Neuron is the SDK that optimizes the performance of complex neural net models executed on AWS Inferentia and Trainium, our custom chips designed to accelerate deep-learning workloads

The Neuron SDK consists of a compiler, run-time, and debugger, integrated with Tensorflow, PyTorch, and MXNet. It’s preinstalled in AWS Deep Learning AMIs and Deep Learning Containers for customers to quickly get started with running high performance and cost-effective inference.

The Neuron team is hiring senior compiler engineers in order to solve our customers toughest problems.

This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge products at the intersection of machine-learning, high-performance computing, and distributed architectures. You will architect and implement business-critical features, publish cutting-edge research, and mentor a brilliant team of experienced engineers. We operate in spaces that are very large, yet our teams remain small and agile. There is no blueprint. We're inventing. We're experimenting. It is a very unique learning culture.

As a senior deep learning compiler engineer on the Neuron team, you will be a thought leader supporting the development of a compiler targeting AWS Inferentia and Trainum. You will be developing and scaling the compiler to handle the world's largest ML workloads. You will need to be technically capable, credible and curious in your own right as a trusted AWS Neuron engineer, innovating on behalf of our customers. You will leverage your technical communications skill as a hands-on partner to AWS ML services teams and you will be involved in pre-silicon design, bringing new products/features to market, and many other exciting projects. A background in machine learning and AI accelerators is preferred, but not required.

Explore the product and our history!
https://awsdocs-neuron.readthedocs-hosted.com/en/latest/neuron-guide/neuron-cc/index.html

https://aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/neuron/

https://github.com/aws/aws-neuron-sdk

https://www.amazon.science/how-silicon-innovation-became-the-secret-sauce-behind-awss-success

About the team
#1. Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

#2. Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

#3. Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

5+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

title: Software Developer / Développeur logiciel - Computer Vision
job_summary: These are the essential tools for the neural networks and data science functionalities development. We have built an infrastructure of cloud tools that allow to…
job_description:
The team:
Working in Genetec’s AutoVu division is a chance to immerse yourself in an extremely interdisciplinary environment. Software developers (both embedded and cloud), hardware engineers and technicians, mechanical designers, specialists in deep neural networks, computer vision, and production, work together to develop a range of innovative products. Be part of an ecosystem where collaboration is the watchword, made up of specialists always on the lookout for scientific and technological discoveries.

You can be part of a multidisciplinary team of computer vision/machine learning specialists and software developers. The team collaborates on the development of intelligent vehicle centric cameras in optical, image acquisition control and machine learning aspects. We have built an infrastructure of cloud tools that allow to acquire, store, generate, manage a very large amount of data and to monitor cameras. These are the essential tools for the neural networks and data science functionalities development.

Genetec is looking for an experienced developer in video or image processing to join the research and development team.

What your day will look like:
You will be responsible to develop, test and integrate video processing algorithms (low level control of camera, diffusion and management of video stream, intelligent analysis of video, real time transformation of video stream, etc.) and image processing algorithms in Genetec products
You will participate to the acceleration of the algorithms that run real time, taking advantage of the possibilities of our processors and coprocessors
You will design automated tests and modernize existing code
You will evaluate the system components, recommend possible alternative (including newer technologies) and then implement, test and evaluate changes
You will propose, test, develop and evaluate proofs of concepts and prototypes for new generations of products; propose new products and/or solutions to enlarge existing product line

About you:
Bachelor's degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, physics or mathematics
A minimum of three years of experience in object-oriented programming
A minimum of three years of experience in image or video processing
Strong ability to conduct experimental and hands-on research
A strong sense of initiative

Technical Requirements:
Mastering an object language: C #, C ++, Java
Ability to recognize, analyze and integrate new technologies into the development of new products
Knowledge of different software development methods and procedures
Excellent technical and communication skills

Great if you have:
Knowledge in build pipelines
Knowledge of concurrent and async (thread pools, async await)
Knowledge of embedded programming
Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
Experience in Linux
Let's talk perks!
Attractive compensation package
Training Tuition Reimbursement Program
Subsidized meals in our amazing Bistro (Les Cordons Bleus)
Work-life balance with a flexible working schedule
Free, unlimited coffee
Private, free parking for all employees
Onsite fitness facility with personal trainer

Would you like to know what it looks like to work at Genetec? Click on the following link to find out for yourself! Genetec Culture

-

L'équipe

Travailler dans la division AutoVu de Genetec c’est avoir la chance de baigner dans un milieu extrêmement multidisciplinaire. Des équipes de développeurs en programmation embarquée, infonuagique, firmware, des ingénieurs et techniciens hardware, des designers mécaniques, des spécialistes en réseaux neuronaux, en imagerie et en mise en production, collaborent pour développer une gamme de produits innovants. Faites partie d’un écosystème dans lequel la collaboration est le mot d’ordre, composé de spécialistes toujours à l’affût des découvertes scientifiques et technologiques.

Vous pourriez faire partie d’une équipe multidisciplinaire de spécialistes en vision numérique, en apprentissage machine et en développement logiciel. Le développement logiciel est autant embarqué qu’infonuagique. L’équipe collabore au développement de caméras intelligentes, tant dans les aspects optiques, de contrôle d’acquisition d’images que de développement d’analytiques centrés sur les véhicules. Nous avons bâti une infrastructure d’outils infonuagiques qui permettent d’acquérir, stocker, générer et gérer un très grand nombre de données ainsi que monitorer des caméras. Ce sont les outils essentiels au développement de réseaux neuronaux et d’outils en science des données.

Genetec est à la recherche d’un développeur expérimenté traitement vidéo ou en traitement d’images pour se joindre à l’équipe de recherche et développement.

À quoi ressemblera votre journée:
Vous serez responsable de développer, tester et intégrer des algorithmes de traitement vidéo (contrôle bas niveau de caméra, diffusion et gestion de flux vidéo, analyse intelligente de la vidéo, transformation de flux vidéo en temps réel, etc.) et de traitement d’images dans les produits Genetec
Vous participerez à l’accélération de nos algorithmes roulant en temps réel en profitant des possibilités des processeurs et coprocesseurs
Vous concevrez des tests automatisés, et moderniserez du code existant
Vous évaluerez les composantes des systèmes actuels, recommanderez des alternatives possibles (en incluant les nouvelles technologies) ainsi qu’implémenter, tester et évaluer les changements
Vous devrez aussi proposer, tester, développer et évaluer les concepts et prototypes pour les nouvelles générations de produits; proposer de nouveaux produits et/ou solutions en vue d’élargir la gamme de produits existants

Votre profil:
Baccalauréat en génie informatique, science informatique, génie électrique, physique ou en mathématiques
Un minimum de trois années d’expérience en programmation objet
Un minimum de trois années d’expérience en traitement d’images ou vidéo
De fortes capacités à effectuer des recherches expérimentales et pratiques
Un grand sens de l’initiative

Expertise technique:
Maitrise d’un langage objet : C#, C++, Java
Habileté à reconnaître, analyser et intégrer de nouvelles technologies dans le développement de nouveaux produits
Connaissance des différentes méthodes et procédures de développement de logiciels
Possède d’excellentes aptitudes techniques et de communication

Encore mieux si vous possédez ces atouts:
Connaissance des pipelines de build
Connaissances en programmation concurrente et asynchrone (thread pools, async await)
Connaissance de la programmation embarquée
Expérience avec les technologies de conteneurisation telles que Docker et Kubernetes
Expérience en Linux
Voilà ce que nous offrons!
Régime de rémunération attrayant
Programme de remboursement des frais de formation
Repas subventionnés à notre incroyable Bistro (Les Cordons Bleus)
Équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à un horaire de travail flexible
Café gratuit à volonté
Espace de stationnement gratuit pour tous les employés
Centre d’entraînement sur place

Si vous souhaitez savoir à quoi ressemble l’environnement de travail chez Genetec, voici le lien vers notre vidéo d’entreprise: Culture à Genetec

title: Cloud ML Engineer (Sr. Technical Specialist)
job_summary: Build architecture for Analytics and AI and collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, developers, operations and security.
job_description:
Location
Toronto , Canada

Our Global IT team is reshaping the InsurTech landscape by promoting innovative strength and a healthy competitive spirit to contend with the best IT companies in the world. We are making targeted investments in digital transformation and helping our clients tackle modern digital problems with cutting-edge, forward-looking solutions.

We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Cloud ML Engineer, internally known as a Senior Technical Data Specialist. The successful candidate will drive high priority customer initiatives on the Microsoft Azure Platform in collaboration with customers. This is a customer facing role, owning overall technical relationship between customer and BDAP Data, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence Platform.

You will own the Data Platform & Advanced Analytics technical customer engagements within our North American Business Units including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or MVPs. The ideal candidate will have experience in customer-facing roles and success leading deep technical architecture discussions with senior customer executives, Enterprise Architects, IT Management and Developers to drive Data Platform and Advanced Analytics solutions to productions.

Your job

Key responsibilities include:
Operationalising analytics. As an analytics architect close this data-to-insight-to-action loop, which requires deep understanding of the applications and integration infrastructure environment.
Mapping requirements to implementation to accommodate many and sometimes conflicting requirements and constraints with requirements coming from diverse stakeholders, such as line-of-business users, data scientists, analysts, and administrators.
Create prototypes of ML Use Cases and present to Customers and other relevant stakeholders.
Participate in Software Development life-cycle to productize ML use cases and AI pipelines.
Build architecture for Analytics and AI and collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, developers, operations and security.
Align technical implementation with existing and future requirements.
Working with multiple customers, Munich Re Black Belts to create Proof of concepts (POCs) / Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) etc. and guiding customers through to production deployment and operationalization of ml projects.
Maintain expert-level knowledge and skills to guide client’s journey through Analytics-led data transformation.
Apply technical knowledge to architect solutions that meet business and IT needs, create and modernize Data Platform, Data Analytics and AI roadmaps, and ensure long term technical viability of new deployments, infusing key analytics and AI technologies where appropriate (e.g. Azure Databricks, MLFlow, Azure ML, Cognitive Services, AKS, Data Lake etc.).
Ensure that solution exhibits high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, appropriate reusability and reliability upon deployment.
Develop deep relationships with key customer stakeholders and IT decision makers, who drive long-term cloud adoption within Munich Re.

Be a Voice of Customer to share insights and best practices, connect with BDAP Engineering team and BDAP HOME Team to remove key blockers.

Your profile

University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field
Certification in one or more of the following technologies preferred: Cloud, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, Big Data, Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence
5yrs+ of success in consultative/complex data science and analytics projects, architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications required
Creating AI Proof of Concepts, Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) for customers that lead to production deployments
Technical experience and knowledge, with depth / Subject Matter Expertise in three or more of the following Data Platform Cloud solutions
Data Science / Machine Learning including Azure Data Bricks, Python, R, Azure ML.
Artificial Intelligence including Cognitive Services
Advanced Analytics including Azure Data Bricks, visualization tools as PowerBI
Application development skills - ability to stand up a back end (Python or similar), front end (node.js or similar)
Prior solution delivery experience in AI specialized solution providers desired

About us

Together, we engage with everything we have and are, to help humankind act braver and better.

As the world’s leading reinsurance company with more than 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into manageable risk, we enable fundamental change. We recognize Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging as a key priority with a culture that welcomes different thoughts and opinions. We dare to think big and are continuously innovating on behalf of our clients.

Please note that only candidates who are selected for interview will be contacted directly. We thank all candidates for their interest.

Apply now!

Munich Re Canada is committed to providing a work environment that is inclusive and free of employment barriers and discrimination. Accommodations will be made for qualified applicants with a disability throughout the recruitment process. If you receive a request for an interview and you have a disability which will require an accommodation to support your participation, please consult with Human Resources or contact AODARequestHR@munichre.ca as soon as practical so that suitable accommodations can be arranged.

title: Senior Specialist Talent Solutions Enablement- 12 months contract
job_summary: KPI measurement and data analytics. Gather benchmark data about best-in-class TA practices and KPIs and make recommendations to improve processes and practices.
job_description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our TA team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. We offer meaningful opportunities because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Senior Specialist, Talent Solutions Enablement is responsible for liaising with the Recruitment and Workforce Planning teams to understand CN’s hiring needs and provide recruitment solutions and strategies. The role tracks and reports talent acquisition Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in order to provide recommendations in accordance with the results as well as running the backend Applicant Tracking Software (ATS) platform and other technology-driven Talent Acquisition (TA) solutions.

Main Responsibilities
Tracks and Reports on TA KPIs — 50%
Track and report the TA KPIs on a monthly basis to identify top drivers of attraction, retention, and engagement
Provide analysis, insights and recommendations based on the results
Measure the performance and effectiveness of recruitment campaigns and partner sourcing platforms through the use of Google and other analytics tools
Gather benchmark data about best-in-class TA practices and KPIs and make recommendations to improve processes and practices

Enables Talent Solutions – 50%
Work with Human Resources (HR) to manage the ATS platform and be the TA team’s super user and support the team by resolving administrative backend issues
Identify and support the implementation of TA technology solutions
Working Conditions
The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday with the possibility of afterhours work during important projects or TA enhancements. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress. The role requires minimal travel (approximately 5%).

Requirements
Experience
Human Resources
Minimum 7 years of combined experience in a similar role with:
Systems integration and management
KPI measurement and data analytics
Experience in data visualization
Employer marketing campaign measurement
Education/Certification/Designation
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Human Resources, Marketing or a related field

About CN
As a leading North American transportation and logistics company, CN is a true backbone of the economy. With a team of approximately 25,000 railroaders, our focus is on moving both our company and the economy forward. We transport US$200 billion worth of goods annually for a wide range of business sectors from resource to manufactured products to consumer goods, across a 20,000-mile network spanning Canada and mid-America. CN is the only Canadian company listed in the Transportation and Transportation Infrastructure sector of the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI). Launched in 1999, the DJSI World represents the gold standard for corporate sustainability. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.
